Thank you, family, friends, others alike, and readers! Your support, gratitude, and love has this publication possible. God bless you, thank you, and enjoy the excitement you have all waited for and have long-deserved to experience. You are all heroes in my eyes, heart, and soul. Thanks to you, this writing experience will always be infinite.

 

-Jacob Arasim, 2013

Part 1:

Press Play

Chapter 1: Welcome to Kingzing City

 

      Welcome! Welcome to Kingzing City, population of almost a million! Sitting on the beautiful waterfront, in the state of Oregon, Kingzing City never fails to be a part of an awe-inspiring community! Other than the citys free-spirited people, gorgeous climate, and amazing architecture, theres one person who tends to make a complete ass of himself! His name is Jakeronovitch Matthew Smithy, hes eighteen, and over 90% of people hate him! Anyone would think being hated by so many people would lower Jakes self-esteem, though it doesnt. Jake only cares about himself and only cares about what he does!

width=510 height=182 src="infinite_files/image004.png" v:shapes="_x0000_s1254"> 

 


        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Jakeronovitch Matthew Smithy, formally known as just Jake,   walks through the hallways of the school, with a smug grin spread across his face, as followed by others. The jocks walk by, other students stand out of the way, clearing a path for the most popular kids in KHS. Adding to that, the jocks are also joined by their girlfriends (Jake is the only one whos single, which is a substantial surprise for many.). Three minutes before the horrible passing period bell rang, Jake and his group of jocks started to walk toward a skinnier kid, known as Kyle John Manning. Kyle is Jake's most vulnerable target. As Kyle is pulling out a couple books from his neatly organized locker, Jake comes out of nowhere, slamming the door shut. This makes Kyle jolt in surprise drops everything on the brown-painted, tile floor.


Welcome to Kingzing City

 

 

        

          

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Hey, Kyle, Jake said, followed by slight laughs from his friends.

         Without any eye contact and full of fear, Kyle utters, H-hey Jake.

         Jake looked down at the books on the floor. You dropped your stuff, buddy-boy.

Y-yeah, I-I did.

         Jake smiles, followed by more annoying chuckles. Well, aren't you gonna pick 'em up? Hesitant and full of anxiety, Kyle quickly kneels down to pick up his things, unknowingly that one of Jake's friends is about to kick him in the rear, from behind. Jake signals his friend, known as Cale Omnous, and the jock gives a swift kick up Kyle's bum. Such a powerful blow like that made Kyle fall forward and hit his head against the lockers, thus falling onto the ground. The whole group roared with laughter, but Jake stands still, smiling with his arms crossed. You better tie your shoelaces too, buddy-boy. The group finally leaves, after Cale rockets a wad of snot out of his nose onto Kyle's trapper keeper. As they leave, Kyle could hear how proud Cale was, after performing that unnecessary stunt.

          Jake Smithy, the perfect asshole. He's the guy where dating him would be like babysitting a six year-old. As the bell rings, Kyle is rises on his two skinny legs, rubbing his head, as he picks up his things. Then, a girl walks toward him and helps him. The girl was extremely gorgeous and she wore

Chapter 1

 

         luscious, blonde hair. She looked at Kyle's snot-covered trapper keeper in disgust. She then pulled out a tissue, from her bag, and wipes Cale's disgusting clean. The girl and Kyle both stand up and look at each other.

         Th-thanks Holly, Kyle stuttered, making actual eye-contact with her.

         You're welcome, the girl replied with a cute smile. If those stale pieces of crap come near you again, let me know okay?

         Kyle nodded, and they both started walking to class. This was Kyle's best friend in the whole wide world, Holly Ransfield. She is the prettiest young woman that ever walked the school campus. The jocks, the nerds, the stoners, the emos and the rockers all know of her, and none wouldn't hesitate to get a piece. Other girls, included, wouldn't mind in doing so, also. Holly is very independent, very experienced! After eight years of knowing karate and boxing, anyone wouldnt dare mess with this girl.

          Holly and Kyle have been friends, ever since they were freshmen in high school. They first met, during Kyles first year of drama class, a class that seems to amuse him the most. Kyle loves to act and perform on stage, while Holly would rather jam out on a guitar. Although, they both have a lot in common, especially when it comes to music, movies, and video games. Ever since they met, they have been inseparable.

         So, you got trigonometry? This period, right? Holly asked, as they walked through the empty hallways of the school. Kyle didnt talk, just nodded. Holly frowned, plastering pity all over him, and she knew he couldnt defend himself, let alone speak to his nemesis. Kyle wasnt like that, or so he thought.

         How've you been? Kyle asked.

         Oh, I've been okay. I was good until I saw you on the floor. God, Jake and Cale are such tools. You might as well just call them 'Fake' and 'Fail.'

Kyle laughed out loud, and was feeling much better, now. After more talking, the duo finally approached Mr. Loughmillers trigonometry class. Before Kyle walks in, Holly says, Meet me during lunch. We can go to the Funky Munkey Cafe. Kyle smiled, nodded, and walked into class.

         Holly walked in the opposite direction to get to her's, when just around the corner, behind her, comes Jake and Cale hollering. Jake whistles at her. Hey, little lady shouldn't you be in class?

Welcome to Kingzing City

 

 

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Cale busted up and repeats what Jake said, like a copy-cat poser.

         Holly rolled her eyes and kept walking, the two idiots followed.

            Holly finally stopped, turned around, and faced the two lunk-heads, saying, Can't you two just go kiss each other somewhere else?

Jake and Cale spat out laughter.

         Ooooh, someone is on their time of the month! Jake hollered. Damn, girl, we didn't do anything to you. What's your problem?

         YOU are my problem! I know what you guys did to Kyle.

         Who? That little snot? Cale snorted. We didn't do anything! He just fell. Fell, like the little baby wussy that he always--.

         Cale was stopped immediately when Holly punched him in the stomach and grabbed him by the nose. She twisted it with two of her knuckles back and forth. Cale screamed like a little sissy, as she had done so. There was no one else in sight to witness this!

         You know, I can break your nose, you sick, twisted toad! Holly said angrily. Jake just stood there and watched, his eyes wide. It takes only seven pounds of pressure to break the human nose. You like that? You like that feeling?? Jake took a step to help his friend, but Holly gave a quick horrifying look that said, Don't even think about it!

Cale was on his knees now, with faint trails of blood trickling from his nostrils.

         If, you ever TOUCH or do ANYTHING to Kyle again, so help me


Chapter 1

 

         God I will break not just your nose! We got a deal? Cale nodded weakly, in agony. Holly faced Jake, once more. Got it?! Jake quickly responded and Holly let go of Cale's nose. The jock covered his nose with cuffed hands and slowly got up, as Holly spits on him and walks off. Jake stood there in shock, for he so totally did not know what just happened. A girl, half his size, almost broke his friend's nose, like it was no problem. He was sure that anyone else could do the same, but the thought gave Jake a big smile on his face.

         Cale looks at him, covering his bloody nose. Wut are you so excited abutt?

         Nothing. Let's go to class.  Jake now had a major crush on Holly.

Out there. . . .In the stars.

            You unlock this door with the key of imagination. Beyond it, is another. A dimension of sound, a dimension of sight, a dimension of mind. You're moving into a land of both shadow and substance of things and ideas. You just crossed over into...the Twilight Zone.

         Having nothing to do with the classic television series, the small excerpt explains the truth of what is really happening in Jake Smithys universe and how its not always going to be perfect by his standards. On the planet Strom lies a base, a military base, a non-human military base, a military base for a race, known as the Asids. As of right now, the Asids base is under attack by another non-human military force, also known as the Adoa. Ships, of advanced technology, swarmed everywhere around the base, deploying Adoa troops. (There are the Adoa Mazers and there are the Adoa Strikers. The Strikers are much larger and they carry heavy weaponry.) Right now, the enemies have broken into the Asid base, taking them by surprise. Why are they attacking? What's their motivation?

         They're after something, something of good value, something in the hands of two alien beings, known as Preox and Rig. They are very special alien beings, indeed. Preox is a high rank, as a formal Asid Magnate. In other words, Don't mess with him. As for the incredibly stupid, yet gifted, Rig

Welcome to Kingzing City

 

            whose race is an Aziquet, has an antenna which can shoot a substantial amount of deathly lightning. Deathly enough to blow stuff up!

         Anyway, as the Asids consistently fought off the Adoa in an epic, gruesome battle of terror, Preox and Rig fought through enemy forces, wiping them out like a napkin on spilled milk.

         There's they is! shouted an Adoa Striker. Eliminate them! Get the Misara! Do not disappoint our master!

         Rig stands there, laughing like the happy-go-lucky idiot he always was. The Adoas open fire, as Preox reloads his gun. As the two take cover, Preox shoots at the walls, thus ricocheting the bullets into the bodies of their enemies. Apparently, there was a suicide bomber in with the small group of Mazers and it just so happens that one of Preox's bullets impacted on the Mazers' bomb. An implosion occurred, tearing portions of the base, followed by dismembered limbs. Preox and Rig began to run through the halls of the base, taking out any other forces who dared to stand in their way.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Wooh! This is so much fun I wish I had pants! hollered Rig happily.         

 

 

 

Oh, I just love wearing pants!!! Where's we going Preox?

         Preox sighed. He hated talking to that blubbering idiot companion of his, all the time. A Mazer came up to them, Rig extended his antennae like a whip and smacked the Adoa with his tremendous volts of lightning. The Mazer died. We are, Rig, going to the hangar area. We're getting the hell out


Chapter 1

 


           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            of here! 

         Rig screamed happily. We goes to another planet??

         Yes, we do 'goes to another planet.' Now, shut up and let me think! Okay, dammit, the Adoas are blowing up everything! I can barely recognize where we're going! Preoxs voice was raspy and dry, as Rigs voice was loud and obnoxiously high-pitched. Preox detached an ammo packet from his armor, reloading his rifle. (The device on his back is what the Asid military have to wear when in training, or fighting in combat. It's called a Vambit and it has mini turrets inside, followed by a jet-pack.) Preox pushed a button on his Vambit, and out came two auto-turrets.

         More fighting went on, along with shredded gray and neon pink blood from both the Adoa and the Asids. Preox proceeded through a door, which led to another Asid structure on the outside. This was where the hangar was located. A giant enemy drop ship was swooping down, opening fire upon the base. Preox wanted to ignore it, but Rig was not about to let it go. Hey over here, stinky poo!!!!

         Rig! hollered Preox alarmingly. Get your ass back over here now!

         Rig didn't listen, he kept waving and yelling at the drop ship. The ship took notice of the moron and slowly turned to face Rig. Its laser cannons prepared for total annihilation, upon the two. Preox didn't hesitate to shoot at the pilot of the ship, followed by bullets implanting inside the enemy's


Welcome to Kingzing City

 

         cranium. Grey blood splattered on the windshield, along with the turrets shooting out of control, which killed several other Adoa troops, dropping them dead.  The drop ship had begun to fall down to the surface of the planet and Preox Rig ran for it, toward a seemingly large, yet heavily damaged, structure. Go, go!!

         They both got into the building through the large, damaged, metallic door, and they ran through a large hallway, full of dead troops. All they hear is a distant crash and explosion. The drop ship was diminished.  

         They continued running as Rig said, Hey that was my ship to explode! Grrr, me angry now. Me wanted to blow it up!

         Don't get your G-string in a wad! Preox yelled right back. Preox started getting a huge headache, not just from the battle, but from hearing Rig's voice. Around the corner was the hangar area, their escape from this epic battle. Two Strikers stood in the way, however.

         Okay, Rig go ahead, said Preox stopping, trying to catch some breath.

         Oy! hollered a Striker. Its da special aliens! Dey is the super bad ones!!  Kill dem now!!

         Rig started screaming at the top of his lungs, like some sort of mental patient. His antenna, charging thousands of volts of electricity, striking the two Strikers point blank in the face! (Damn, thats got to hurt!) The back of the two Strikers' heads burst open, with grey blood gushing everywhere. They collapsed, one of them faintly saying, Ow. Those are typical last words for an Adoa troop.    

         Preox pushed a few buttons on a pad next the the door and it opened just enough for them to barely squeeze through, due to all the damage that has been caused. Only one ship sat there, good as new and ready to be taken into flight. It also happened to be one of the first light-speed ships, ever invented so it was pretty innovative for the time being. Not only that, it's never been tested! Deactivating his Vambit and taking a seat in the cockpit, Preox got the ship started. Having never flown a ship, which could go so fast, before in his life, Preox still had no hesitation in getting the ship off the ground. The ship went through the broken glass of what used to be the ceiling and began to fly away. Rig marveled the view of the shattering glass. After getting rid of other opposing forces swarming the area, Preox took a deep


Chapter 1

 

 

 

         breath and activated the light-speed. Rig, totally ignoring the whole ordeal, just sat there shouting WEEEEEEEEEEEE!!!!!! The ship was going so fast, Preox almost coughed up his fourth lung. He had to get as far away from the Adoa, as possible. The ship went faster and faster and Rig flew backward, slamming his head on wall.

         'I see skies of blue and clouds of white! the Aziquet laughed deliriously, after taking the huge impact.

         Rig, you okay? Preox asked, turning around to face Rig, actually feeling concerned for him. All he heard was a great belch coming from his companion. Oh you're fine. He turned to face the window, as he deactivated the light-speed, once more and shrieked at the site of an Earth cellphone satellite, labelled Flint, as a massive obstacle.

         Preox jerked the ship quickly to the side, and Rig whined in agony, I think my butt has been punctured.

         Then your mouth and your ass! yelled Preox, turning the ship with all his might, though it was too late. The ship's left side burst through the satellite's solar panel. All the sudden, the ship's engines were failing, as it was just entering the planets atmosphere.  Preox attempted the emergency evac option, but believed that wouldnt help, considering the situation he was in.

Welcome to Kingzing City

 

                  Damn, damn, damn! Oh dammit! Preox cried frantically, trying to save the ship's life. The ship gave a sudden jolt, making Preox fly from his seat, bashing his head against the ceiling. The container, which contained the Misara Serum (A weapon of which the Adoa desperately needed to grasp their fingers on) flew off his Vambit. Rig quickly caught it, with a slight chuckle of insanity.

         Oooo, hoo hoo! That was close! A small explosion occurred, blasting a freshly torn hole through the ship. The extreme pulling force of oxygen snatched the Serum right out of Rig's hands. Oooohh, and it's gone.

         What's gone?? demanded Preox, whom had gotten back to manage the controls.

         Uhhh the thingy.

         What thingy?

         The special potion thingy.

         The MISARA SERUM??!

         I believe so, dude, the idiot said in a calm matter. Before Preox could go on an episode, the ship gave another sudden jolt, indicating the ship's engines exploding. Ahh, son of a triscuit! We just lost the ship!

         The ship was up in flames, was in Earth's orbit, and was falling rapidly towards the surface. Rig was pinned against the back of the ship screaming at the top of his lungs, as Preox held on for his life. Bits and pieces were flying off the ship and there was no way in saving it, now. With his stomach swirling everywhere in his body, Preox pounded his fist which opened a trap door. Rig immediately flew out and Preox activated his jet-pack, from his Vambit, and flew out of the ship quickly. He saw a falling Rig, bawling his eyes out, and caught him immediately. He stopped bawling, once he had done so. Rig looked up at him, with tearful eyes of happiness. The look he gave made Preox want the satisfaction of gouging his eyes out.

         Oh Preox, you're my hero.

         Yeah, yeah shut up. The ship gave off a fiery, neon purple explosion from, with debris flying everywhere.

         Why you gone go blows up our toy? Rig asked.

         I didnt, you dolt. Preox rolled his eyes, for he surely had no time to put up with Rigs ludicrous questions.

Chapter 1

        

         We certainly had no point in flying it, anyway, Rig laughed.     

         How dense are you? The Adoa almost tore us apart.

         Oh, come on we could take 'em! We didn't need to fly off, like a couple of neurotic wussies, light-speed ship, which you epically failed at operating!

         Shut up Rig! I shouldn't have to be taking criticism from someone who doesn't even know what the term neurotic!

         Oh yeah?? Yeah?? Well what does 'nertonic' mean then?? Hmm?!

         It's 'neurotic', you dip! Plus, it means— Preox and Rig were both silenced, once a large portion of debris slammed against their bodies.  Preox's Vambit became critically damaged and their unconscious selves hurdled toward Earths surface, along with the rest of the ships remains.

 

Chapter 2: Misara Serum

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

    Shortly after the terrible blow, which Preox and Rig had received from falling debris, the Misara Serum was gone out of the hands of the ones who had a major responsibility in keeping it captive and out of the Adoas sight. For a detailed insight, the Misara Serum was contained in a black container, with a tight lid on top. The Serum is a weapon, a weapon of mass destruction, created by the Adoa. This is another why it was considered deadly, being the fact the Adoa were the creators. With a weapon of mass destruction, there was really no telling what the Adoa was capable of doing with it. The Asids stole the Serum because knew well of the the Serums capabilities. The leader of the Adoa, Zjok, created this Serum shortly after betraying the Asids, long ago. Zjok invented the Serum to become supremely powerful and a successful leader, as reigning his own militia of Adoa Mazers and Strikers.

         The Serum is made of a toxic blood found from the extinct species, known as the Drokensmur. After the last Drokensmur died off, Zjok was able to extract its blood. Once he got the blood, he mixed it with hot boiling lava and ice from a comet. After he obtained these materials and the Serum was 

Chapter 2

 

         ultimately created, Zjok recorded a test run on a web cam, and posted it on the social network of Bookface, so all his Mazers and Strikers could see. He tested the Serum on a rat and once the rat barely took no more than a couple of samples, the rat immediately grew twice its size and began flying around its cage. The rat opened its mouth and breathed fire like a dragon and began bending the bars of his cage, with his own paws. Zjok laughed his evil laugh and blasted the rat dead, with a big ray gun. His horrible, ugly face came to camera and simply said, Adoa, we will now rise!

         Oh, and did they rise. Over the course of ten Earth years, Zjoks Adoa had become a stronger Empire, destroying dozens of other species and colonizing other planets, as their own. The Asid Military was prepared, however, once Zjok eventually threatened their planet, Suzia. Preox and Rig were sent on a suicide mission to collect the Misara Serum, on the Adoa's home planet, Fleek. The mission was a complete success. After Zjoks Serum was stolen, while he was conveniently asleep, Rig actually managed to drop the Misara Serum during a celebration party. Obviously, Rig would do something as clumsy as it was and after the Misara had dropped, the lid snapped off, spilling a puddle of the fluids onto the ground. Preox had resealed the lid tight. As for the puddle of Serum, well, Rig offered to lick it off the floor. Idiot.

         No! yelled Preox. Don't you dare! We dont know what the capabilities--. The puddle was gone.

         Mmm, it needs salt, Rig said with a smile. He hiccupped, as an antenna grew on his head and eventually spark electricity. Preox was shocked and concerned about his companion. Rig felt very sick, ever since he had slurped up the Serum. The Asids examined the poor, ill Aziquet and they realized that Rig was now a living weapon, of mass destruction. They realized the amazing advantages they have achieved when possessing the Serum. The Serum was too deadly, however, according to the Asid Council and it had to be disposed of properly. Unfortunately, the Serum was impossible to evaporate and it could not be touched at all. Strom was the perfect planet to do research and plan on how to destroy it. So the Asids made a rendezvous point to their base on the planet. Everything was going great.

 

Misara Serum

 

            The Adoa, miraculously, had the guts to form an attack on the base, though failed. With the help of their combat skills and his lightning, Preox and Rig were unstoppable, until they unexpectedly, and unfortunately, got ultimately knocked unconscious by falling debris. And that is the story of the Misara Serum.

 

         The Misara Serum was hurdling towards Kingzing City, towards a truck, which was loading off boxes of Boiling Blood energy drinks at a local coffee shop. A coffee shop known to be the Funky Munkey Caf.

         Hey! yelled the truck driver to his partner. Hurry up with those boxes! We still got another load to take to the next shop!

         I'm hurryin', I'm hurryin'! the truck driver's partner snapped. Just hold on a sec', while I pick this damn thing up, Chuck! Haha, I said 'upchuck'.

         Chuck shook his head. Want me to call your mom to help you, Cletus?

         Shut up!

         The Serum, falling from over 100 miles per hour, landed straight onto Chuck's big head. A perfect hit. The big-bellied man grunted and fell forward on the ground. Good thing he was wearing his trucker hat, those can save lives! The Misara Serum, resembling a typical can of Boiling Blood, rolled beside the half-conscious Chuck, who made the angriest face ever. Ever. He slowly got up.

         Cletus! Why in the hell did you throw this at me?

         Ugh, throw what?!?

         This energy drink, you dipstick!

         I din't throw crap! hollered Cletus, walking out with a box of Boiling Blood.

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 2

           

         Chuck shrugged and threw the can at Cletus.

         Cletus squealed as it hit him in the head, making him drop everything as he was walking down the truck's ramp. Bottles and cans tumbled everywhere, making the Serum completely unrecognizable.

         Shove that in your little, scrawny butt, Chuck said, laughing. People inside the Funky Munkey Caf stared at the two truckers, with concerned looks on their faces. Holly and Kyle, whom were also in there, had the same looks on their faces, as well. As the mess was cleaned up, the Serum was placed inside a box full of energy drinks. Uh oh. The two truckers left, once the employees of the Funky Munkey began stocking the Boiling Blood into the coffee shop.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         So, I got in for the spring play, said Kyle, joyfully. He was feeling a lot better than before. With the help of Holly being there for him, and his caramel mocha, nothing could go wrong!

         Really? Holly replied, taking a sip of her hot black coffee. That's awesome, man. What play is it?

         The Princess Bride.

         Oh, sweet!! I love the movie! Who are you playing as??

         Inigo Montoya, Kyle answered with a smile.

         Aaah! Do the impression!!

         Kyle got into acting mode. 'My name is Inigo Montoya...You killed my father...prepare to--. Jake and Cale came out of nowhere.  

 

Misara Serum

 

         Hey, what's up ya jagga-loons, said Jake with a smile. Cale snorted out laughter, though immediately stopped because his nose was insanely sore. Holly scoffed at the two, assuming that they both followed her and Kyle to the Funky Munkey, just to cause more trouble. They both took a seat at the table, the one where Kyle and Holly were sitting at. So what's up? You two on a date?

         Cale snorted. Haha, yeeeahh. The blonde-haired jock took Kyle's caramel mocha and downed it. MMM! That's good stuff.

         Kyle sat there and said nothing, staring down at the table.

         Aw, you gonna cry? Jake laughed hysterically. Look he's gonna cry!

Kyle looked awful and Holly looked pissed.

         That was his mocha you know that? she said to Cale sternly.

         Pffft, so? he replied.

         He paid $3.45 for that mocha, with his own money. You think it's funny to just take it and drink it all, butter head?

         Cale laughed. Quite a bit, yeah. Holly was enraged with fury, as she slammed her palm against Cale's nose. Ahhh! He fell backward from his chair, Jake laughed his ass off. Holly hated that laugh, she really did, so she wasn't hesitant at all when she took her hot black coffee and splashed it in Jake's face. AAAAAHH! Jake fell backward, also, wiping the hot coffee of his face.

         Hey! This ain't a prayground! You wanna pray?! You pray outside! yelled the Funky Munkey manager, who had a thick accent.

         We were just leaving, anyway, Holly said with a smile. Let's go, Kyle. The two left the cafe, leaving Jake and Cale on the ground.

          Stop acting rike fun wittle pansies and get up. Stretch it out.

         They both got up and Jake walked and approached the front counter to buy a Boiling Blood. Without even noticing, he selected the Serum and put it on the counter, taking out his wallet. The manager typed on the cash register.

         That'll be $1.99. That all for you, wittle pansy?

         Jake nodded. Yeah. He gave the money and took the Serum, thinking that it's Boiling Blood, and gave the manager a threatening look. Hey! I am in varsity baseball and I can lift sixty-fives! Don't mess with me, alright? Don't make me kick your ass. So you, most definitely, better watch          

Chapter 2

 

         it, buddy-boy.

         The manager spat laughter in his face. Ooooh me so scared! Good thing I have unrimited amount of black coffee for your face! Go home, wittle pansy hahahahahahaha!!

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The two jocks left the cafe and they watched Holly drive away, with Kyle, in her car. Cale groaned as he looked at his cell phone.

         What now? Jake asked as they both stood there.

         My phone. It has no signal at all.

         What phone company do you have?

         Flint.

         Ah, no wonder, Jake stated as he struggled to open his energy drink. Flint is the worst cellphone company, ever. Ugh, damn this thing is on tight! Look, the Boiling Blood label isnt on it! Weird. What a weird day.

         That is weird, yet I do not care, Cale simply said.

         Jake continued trying to open the can. After one final try, the lid burst open, with a little bit of Serum spilling out. Jake then took a large gulp of the substance. Jake took a deep breath from the quick refresher, picked up the lid, from the ground, and put it back on the container. Jake felt a weird feeling inside his stomach, as if he was going to throw up.

         Hey man, you okay? Cale asked.

         Jake nodded. Yeah, yeah, I'm good. C'mon, let's get back to school.

         Cale looked confused. But I thought we were going to skip?

         Jake answered in his head. But Holly is in my Biology 2 class, hee

 

Misara Serum

 

            hee! He actually ended up not saying anything. Instead, they got into Jake's black 2003 Sierra pick-up truck and drove off. The taste of the energy drink was foul and extremely warm. Strangely enough, it felt so cold when he took it out of the fridge, in the cafe. Jake felt weird, really weird. Not only he felt sick, he also didn't feel the energy coming from what he just drank. Something was wrong. Jake decided to let this concerned though slip his mind, as he took another sip of the Serum, hoping hell just get used to the taste. Today was gonna be very different for Jakeronovitch Matthew Smithy, very different indeed.

On the coast of Golden Gardens beach. Seattle, Washington.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

      A hand was rising out of the cold, sandy and salty waters. Was someone going swimming? Oh, it's just Preox rising out of the surface, with Rig holding onto his leg. It was a cold and foggy, yet very wet, day for Seattle. The Asid gasped for air as he stomped his armored feet on the cool wet sand. His four lungs were about to burst. Angrily, he kicked Rig in the face so he would let go of his leg.  They both inhaled and exhaled deeply, becoming aware of their surroundings. His eyes grew, as wide as dinner plates. He had never been to Earth before and, according to the Asids, the planet has always been known as a universal myth. Planet Earth is in fact real and Preoxs first thought was doom.

Chapter 2

 

            No, he began, this is impossible!

            Anything is possible, if you just set your mind to it, Rig said happily.

         Shut up, you ridiculous weasel! Preox snapped. This is planet Earth. We're on planet Earth? How? I thought this place was just a horror story.

         Well, I guess it's not, Rig replied in a smart-assed tone.

          This is Earth. The studies were true. But where are the humans?

         Humans? Rig asked confusingly

         Yes, humans. There seems to be none out here. But be careful and do not get spotted.

         Why? the Aziquet whined. I wanna cuddle with the humans.

         They are not to be cuddled with, Rig! Humans are so ridiculous when it comes to new discoveries. If they discover a species outside their planet, they'll tear us apart, put us on autopsy tables, and gut us out.

         But what if I want to be gutted out?

         Preox flinched. He was not in the mood for stupid questions. You DON'T want to be gutted out. First thing we should do is find something to blend in! Then, we shall search for the Misara Serum. My Vambit is totaled, so flight is certainly out of the issue. Ill have to fix it later, in an isolated area.

         Rig blinked. How do you know it's still around here?

         When the Misara Serum was invented, Preox began, Zjok planted a tracking device inside the lid of the container. Since we have the codes to do that, I can get us to the Misara Serum in no time! Although, again, my Vambit is busted, but I believe the coordinates are still intact. The sooner I get my Vambit fixed, the sooner we can retrieve the Misara and get off this God-forsaken planet.

         Yeah, about that, Rig said, how are we getting off this planet? You broked the flying toy remember?

         That wasnt me! And that, I do not know yet. Lets go, quickly!

         The two aliens began running lightly through the sands of the beach and onto a trail that led into the parking lot. They could see a small tunnel up ahead under some railroad tracks.

         There's a spot, said Preox.

         Hey, Preox? said Rig. How did you know all that stuff about the

Misara Serum

 

            humans?

            Preox sighed. Looks like someone wasnt paying attention in Myths & Legends class.

         Yeah, and your point is?

         They gently, and quietly, ran toward the dark tunnel as light rain began to intensify. Before they got into the tunnel, Preox spotted a human hobo sitting up against the wall. The Asid gasped and pulled Rig back.

         I know it's you, alien, said the hobo. I know you are here to take me away into space, where I belong. Preox walked into the tunnel, followed by Rig, both staring at the hobo, cautiously, with concerned expressions on their faces.

         Wh-what happened to your teeth? Preox finally asked, after a brief moment of silence.

         The hobo laughed, completely ignoring Preoxs question of concern. With this hand, I can control myself; pleasure myself; love myself.

Chapter 2

 

         even notice.

         Oh, thank God, thanks man, the hobo replied happily.

         Yeah. Sure, Preox replied.

         Rig sniffled and tried not to cry, as they both departed the tunnel. What a sweet, cute human. As they made it through the other end of the tunnel, they crossed the rail-road tracks and continued on a trail that led to the inside of a forest. Once out of plain sight, they stopped and began to dress up.

         Rig put on a greasy T-shirt when he said, Awww, look Preox! A moose!

         They both stared at the creature, which happened to be a few yards away from them. It perked its head up with a huge mouthful of grass. The moose's eyes grew large at the sight of Preox and Rig.

         Amazing, Preox said sarcastically. He continued to dress up and noticed that the creature never stopped staring at them. It just stood there, staring. Preox shrugged and slipped a stocking cap on his bald head, as Rig ended up putting on a blonde wig, along with glasses. They began to move swiftly, once again, unaware of the mooses true identity. Once Preox and Rig were gone, the moose stood up on its hind legs and ripped a piece of bark off a tree, revealing a metal pad with buttons on it. The moose pushed a couple buttons and a voice came through a speaker.

         Yes? What is it, Agent Moosey17?

         We got somethin', replied Moosey. His voice was small and high pitched. Like a little kid.

         Whoa. Really? replied the voice.

         I just saw two aliens putting on clothes exactly 37.3 yards away.

         What're your coordinates? the voice demanded. The voice was very formal, yet deep and big. He sounded like Robert from the sitcom Everybody Loves Raymond.

 

Misara Serum

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                     The exact location of the aliens are 47.692379 degrees North and 122.43359 degrees west.

         We shall send back-up as soon as possible, buddy. For now, keep an eye on them, you never know what they could be up to.

         Okay thank you. Ooooh this is so exciting! Finally! Moosey laughed hysterically.

        

 

Kingzing City, OR

 

         It's the middle of Biology 2 and Jake was hardly paying any attention, at all. He couldn't stop staring at Holly's fine hair just barely move, every time she looked up to write down notes, from the projector in front of the class. Oh he loved how that hair moved. It didn't have to move at all to be amazing and Jake probably isn't the only one crushing on Holly. For all he knew, Kyle could be crushing on Holly, also. Jake was not only a total jerk, but his paranoia is extremely aggravating. And whether Kyle likes Holly, or not, attempting to actually win her over was the stupidest idea, ever.

         He had to get Holly's attention, but how? She'll most likely ignore him, especially after what had happened at the Funky Munkey Cafe. The room was silent, as students wrote in their composition notebooks. The teacher, Mrs.

Chapter 2

 

            Flatulence, wandered around the classroom looking down on students' desks to make sure they were writing in their note books.

            Every time Mrs. Flatulence would pass by, Jake would open his notebook and pretend to write notes. After Mrs. Flatulence had passed him by, again, Jake silently crumpled up a piece of paper. He tossed it at Holly, hitting the back of her head. She slowly turned around and looked at Jake.

         He mouthed, followed by hand gestures and said, You. Want to. Go. On a. Date. With. Me. Sometime? His final hand gesture was a double thumbs up, with a stupid grin on his face. Holly knew exactly what Jake was mouthing about. She gave him a deadly look and cracked her knuckles.

         Jake loved that about Holly: She always meant business and she was always ready for an ass whoppin'. Jake thought it was one of the hottest things, in the history of time. Holly had turned around, facing the screen of the projector and continued to write her notes quietly. Jake was determined to find another way to grab her attention, when he suddenly felt a sharp pain in his chest. Heart burn? The pain reached his stomach. It felt like someone was lighting a light saber in his body.

         Ooooo, he exclaimed faintly, making some of the students turn around, in order to see who the hell made that silent moan of agony. Jake rose his hand and asked to use the restroom. Mrs. Flatulence excused him and he proceeded to make his way to the toilet. What was happening to him? He didnt eat lunch, either (unless if someone were to call a can of Misara Serum as food), so that couldnt be the reason why he was enduring this new pain.

         Jake felt like he was gonna throw up. The sharp, stinging, fiery pain got worse! He rushed into the men's restroom and went into one of the stalls, got on his knees, and threw up inside the toilet. He barfed three times, before he realized that he was belching no ordinary vomit. The toilet started to melt, turning into a pile of, what looked like, mushy clay from pottery class. Then, the substance, which Jake had released from his mouth, oozed slowly out of the melting toilet.

         What in da... Jake started. He was too astounded at from the sight of hot, boiling lava oozing. He scrambled up on his feet, just about to freak out and scream, like a little girl. He ran out of the restroom and began running

 

Misara Serum

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

           

 

 

 

 

            back to class. Thank goodness no one was in the hallway when Jake unexpectedly release more lava from his mouth.

         Oh, good golly God, he said almost crying. He opened the classroom door and sat down, completely unnoticeable. He took out his pencil and began to write his biology notes, frantically.

Chapter 3: Being Watched

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            First, Jake asked himself if it was possible to literally throw up lava. No? How could it be possible? Jake felt stupid asking himself these questions. If anyone else was in his position, however, there is no doubt that they would feel the same way. Jake was so confused, he got a headache, for all he could think about was what had happened in the bathroom and how people would ultimately react to seeing lava, all over the school floor. Let alone the fact that a toilet had turned into a puddle of mush!

         The bell rang and Jake was the last one to walk out of class. The idea of asking Holly out was a ridiculous idea, especially now. The fire department, the police, ambulances and the Environmental and Health Safety Patrol were at the school, in almost in no time at all. School was obviously dismissed, early.

          Jake didnt do anything, other than walking to his black pick-up. He turned the ignition and began driving to the city, where he and his dad both lived in an apartment complex. He tuned through the FM radio and he kept hearing the Kingzing City news, reporting about what had happened at the high school. He was so anxious that he had to slap himself silly a few times.

            Chapter 3

 

            He stopped in front of the Funky Munkey Caf and took a deep breath. He switched off the ignition, stepped out, and walked inside the caf, just in time when the manager was leaving. He had his car keys in his hands so the manager must have been done with his shift.

         Oh, rook, it da wittle pansy, the manager laughed.

         Shut up, will ya? Jake said, who was full of stress.

         Oh an' what if I no shut up? Har har har.

         Just shut. Anyway, I have reason to believe that there's something going on in your caf.

         Why you say dat, wittle pussy?

         Jake shut his eyes and took a deep breath to relieve the anger. Damn that coffee manager. Jake had to find out whether something was wrong with the caf, or not. Ever since he and Cale left the Funky Munkey, he felt extremely weird. But what was it that caused all this? Not knowing that the answer was right in front of his stupid face, Jake continued and asked, Dude, is there, like, some sort of gas leak, of some sort, in the cafe?

         Uh, herro? the manager chuckled. Dis cafe have been healthy, approved by health inspector, for the past five year! There nothing wong with Funky Munkey. No go 'way, pansy.

         The manager left, imitating Jake's final question and laughed even harder. Jake was angry at that manager. Of course, he never really enjoyed receiving a taste of his own medicine. He walked all over the Funky Munkey Cafe area, finding nothing suspicious.

         He walked back outside and noticed, across the street in an alley way, a person was getting mugged by a couple of ugly people. They were totally wailing on the poor man and no one was doing anything about it. Jake tried to ignore it by going back to his car, then he heard the guy yell, Help!

         Rgghhh! Jake grunted under his breath and ran across the street, with cars honking at him. Hey, buddy-boys, leave him alone!

         Jake was ready. His time in the weight room was finally going to pay off! The last time he beat up someone was Kyle, after the poor teen had spilled pudding all over his school jacket, which was accidental of course, during lunch. That is another story, however. With Jake's fists clenched, the two fat thugs turned around and they looked much larger up close.

 Being Watched

 

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Or what? one thug responded.

         Jake gulped, intimidated, for the first time in his life. O-or, I'll break both your freakin' necks! The two thugs stared at each other, they smiled. The thug that responded, whose name was Butch (And the others name was Tom), had a bat at his side. Jake was asking for a major beating.

         Hey, tubbo, don't you be thinkin' about swingin' that at me, Jake said.

         Then get outta here, Skippy, Tom said, who wielded a crow bar. For this is nun-ya.

         Jake lifted one eyebrow. What the hell is nun-ya?

         Butch laughed. Nun-ya BUSINESS! The thug swung the bat and hit Jake in the side.

         OW!!!! he screamed in pain, kneeling to the ground. Butch was about to swing again when Jake quickly grabbed the bat and yanked it from his hands. That hurt, you big brute! Jake jabbed the bat in Butch's stomach and swung it against his hip. Then, Tom came for Jake with the crow bar. Jake grabbed him by the shirt with both his hands. He pounded Tom against the wall so hard, the thug collapsed on the ground, moaning in pain. Jake heard Butch holler at the top of his lungs, so quickly turned around to lift Butch over his shoulders? The adrenaline was so rushed that Jake didn't realize that he was carrying over 275 pounds on his shoulders. However, amidst everything else, he felt like it wasnt the adrenaline that was helping.

         Jake took Butch outside the alley way and ran him through the city.

Chapter 3

 

            Put me down, you little crap! Butch hollered angrily.

         Where's your car?! Jake yelled back.

         It's a white 1999 Camaro why??

         Jake didn't answer, and he ran faster once he saw the 1999 white Camaro. I shall teach you not to hit people with bats because it's...A STRIKEOUT!! Oh, God, that sounded a lot better in my head.

         Butch yelled and got free, making them both land on the ground. They quickly got up and they were both facing each other. Butch threw the first punch, Jake ducked and did a swift upper-cut up his jaw. Butch fell back on the ground, Butch was knocked out. Everyone was in awe and amazement of what was going on. An eighteen year-old was beating the snot out of a bigger, middle-aged man. People were going nuts, recording with their phones and calling others, Get over here right now! This is crazy! Some teenager, on steroids, is beating the tar out of a fat redneck! Besides the steroid remark,

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Jake felt proud and pumped! He picked up Butch, with both out-stretched arms. Jake couldn't believe what was happening. He felt like he was dreaming, but it was no dream! He also knew, for a fact, that he would never be able to lift a big oaf like Butch, even if his life depended on it. But For a final, finishing blow, Jake slammed Butch on top of his Camaro. The wind shield and hood of the car was totaled, followed by the alarm blaring. People of Kingzing City clapped and cheered (A guy, with his camera, came up to him and said he was there recording him when he first walked up to Butch and Tom, beating a hopeless victim senseless.). Then, the police sirens started were heard, making everyone complain and moan, because the fun was over.

Being Watched

 

            Jake couldn't believe what just happened. He then remembered of the poor guy who was getting the life beaten out of him. He ran off quickly, before the police approached the scene. He got back to the alley way and saw Tom on the ground, completely unconscious. The other adult, however, who was getting beat, was gone. Jake couldn't blame him. He quickly got back into his pick-up and watched a police car pull up to the alley way, carrying Tom into away.

         This little, yet big, moment reminded Jake of him and Cale harassing Kyle. He felt bad, really bad, but he quickly got to thinking how unusually unusual this day has been. He threw up lava, he withstood a heavy blow from a baseball ball bat, and he lifted two ugly middle-aged men like little children. He was amazed about what happened and realized that this could be on the news!  This could make him more popular, therefore hopefully persuading Holly to stop hating him so much?! Oh this was perfect for Jake!! But boy, did his elbows burn. Why did they burn? He bended his forearm back and rubbed it as he examined his elbow. Why is everything being so weird tod--?

PEEEEW!!

         Jake almost soiled himself when a beam of laser burst out of his elbow, shattering his entire windshield. Smoke escaped through the shattered glass, as Jake sat there with a most shocked expression. W-why?

         Yo! yelled a guy. You oughta get yo' window checked!

         Jake, completely awe-struck, replied, Yeah, okay.

         The guy shook his head and said quietly, Crazy white people not checking them windows.

         Good thing that guy was stupid enough to think of something that wouldnt cause so much attention. Jake switched on the ignition and began his drive home. He finally came to a shocking conclusion, having connected to everything peculiar happening, today: Jake had super POWERS!

         Impossible, right? Nope! As Jake came to a halt in front of the red traffic light, he watched the police talking to witnesses. Surprisingly enough, the police did not notice the damage on his windshield. He looked at his passenger seat and eyed his black can of Boiling Blood, lying beside. The

Chapter 3

 

            can was half-way empty and he felt very suspicious. He shrugged, took off the lid, and downed the rest of what was left of the Misara Serum. Woo! I'm thirsty. I still can't believe they forgot to put the Boiling Blood logo on there. Ha! Idiots. The red light turned green and Jake drove off.

 

Pike Place Farmers' Market, Seattle, WA

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         It had to of been over two hours, just traveling several miles, and Preox and Rig absolutely could not find a better place to fix the Vambit. It wasn't at all difficult blending in with the humans, however. Whats more was that time was getting wasted. It was actually time to waste it some more, according to Rig.

         This place rocks! he yelled excitingly, as the two roamed around the interior of Pike Place Market, both completely unaware that they were both being watched. They continued to walk around, with Rig being the only one to admire his surroundings.

         Time is being wasted, you tart! Preox snapped, as they entered a knick-knack shop. We need to find a place, now, to repair my Vammmm....back pack! Yes, we must fix the back pack! Rig ignored his partner, as he admired a dress. Preox detached his damaged Vambit and began examining it. The Vambit was excruciatingly damaged and needed a good fix-up.

Being Watched

 

The alien toyed with a few buttons and a faint projection appeared, revealing a faint, small, red beacon on the state of Oregon. It was the tracking signal of the Misara Serum.

         Jumping Jabberwocky! Preox exclaimed and latched his Vambit back on his armor. He saw the map of North America behind the cashier, ran up, pounced on the counter, and ripped the map off the wall.

         Hey! My family spent generations with that map! the cashier whined.

         Oh calm your hair, you can get one from the gift store, Preox snapped. Rig! Get over here, you lifeless sponge! Rig dropped the dress and stood next to him. Look, Rig, my tracking device barely worked, and enough time for me to see where the Serums location currently is. It appears to be residing in that location, there! He pointed at the south-western coast of Oregon. Rig didn't understand, for all he asked was, So your Vambit is fixed?

         Preox didn't hesitate it folding the map and storing it in the greasy pocket, of the jacket he had stolen from a homeless person. You know what? Never mind, Rig, never mind! C'mon let's go, we gotta get that Serum.

         But Preox! Rig whined. I'm sooo hungryyy!!!

         Preox sighed the biggest sigh, ever. Okay, what do you wish to eat?

         Cheeseburgers! Mmmmm.

         Fine! Let's go get a cheeseburger, then. After that, it's right back to searching for the Serum.

         You got it, pal!

         Don't you dare call me that again or I'll rip your stupid, smiling teeth out, in front of all these people.

         The two finally left the knick-knack store and just as they were heading out, Preox swore that he saw that same moose, from before. The moose was also wearing a suit and tie. This not only gave Preox concern, it seeing the moose gave him enough notice that he and Rig had to stay away from it.

         C'mon, let's go get them cheeseburgers, Preox said, as they walked outside of the market.

         Moosey took a peak, from a pile of freshly caught fish. Exclaiming with distress, and angry fishermen yelled at him for getting fur in their fish.  Moosey appeared to be more suspicious than Preox and Rig did!

Chapter 3

 

            (As Moosey began to trace his two targets, a random civilian walked up to him saying, Cool costume, bra! So, Mooseys appearance wasn't so alarming, after all.)

         One employee of the Pike Place Market was so angry at Moosey, that he started to interrogate him. However, the moose was swift and shot the man in the neck, with a tranquilizer gun. This moose meant business. Moosey began to walk slowly after his targets, until Preox and Rig were almost out of his sight. He took out a cell phone, from his jacket pocket, and spoke into it.

         Theyre on the move, Moosey said.

         Good. Are they going somewhere where it wouldn't cause too much of a scene?

         Ugh, I hope so. I've been travelling almost eight miles, tracking these two. Are you going to send any backup?

         Yes, we are. Agent Nathan12 will be there by the time the aliens get to their next resting area. Any idea where that could be?

         Moosey continued to follow Preox and Rig once again. Some sort of burger place I believe. I heard one of them mentioning cheeseburgers to eat. I'll keep you posted.

         Alright, the voice sighed, Agent Nathan12 will be on his way at 18:00. Moosey, I'm surprised we could contact you, we've been having trouble contacting the others.

Flint.
