Jake's apartment building.

         Jake was somewhat relaxed. Although, he was still eccentric, ready for another fight.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

 

                  He couldn't believe it. The question struck him, as if someone threw a brick at him. Am I a superhero? At this point, if Kyle were there, he would respond, No, you're a super jerk-face! Jake continued to ask this question, as he walked into his dads apartment, room 301.

         Dad! he hollered. I'm home! The apartment was very formal; His dad works as the manager for home sales. Once was wealthy enough, Jake's dad and Jake, himself, both moved into one of the best apartment rooms in Kingzing City.

         The apartment room, in all, had two bedrooms, two bathrooms, one kitchen, which filled about a quarter of the place, an entertainment center,  pinball machines, and a nice living room with nice furniture, a fireplace, and a large balcony. They also had a huge couch with many pillows. A second floor was a part of the establishment, also, which was specifically for the two bedrooms.  

            Chapter 3

 

         Jake tossed his backpack aside, avoiding the fact that he had a substantial amount of homework. To keep himself occupied on a daily basis, other than school and homework, Jake worked at a local supermarket, called Cheese and Crackers. The supermarket was commonly known as having the best cheese in the city. Also, a lot of white people worked there, so anyone could easily guess why its called Cheese and Crackers. Jaek went down to the entertainment center and hopped onto the computer. Time for internet! Jake logged onto the social media website of Bookface and saw that he had over 25 friend requests and 36 new messages. Now if Jake were an attractive young woman, like Holly Ransfield, he would be getting stuff like this every day.        

         Jake was so excited! His popularity was rising up to ULTRA POPULARITY! Oh boy did it feel good to be Jake Smithy, right now. He was actually hoping that Holly was one of the people who had sent him a friend request. He looked, with hopes high, and there nothing Holly-related. He looked in the messages. Nothing there, either. Nothing about Holly at all! Messages and requests were all acquaintances, who either saw him in action, or on the news, during the event from earlier.

         Jake got up from his seat, sighing heavily, and turned on the flat screen TV. The local media was going hysterical over what Jake had done, in order to save someone he didnt even know. Jake nodded with amusement.

         So, you made the news, eh? It was Jakes dad. It was a loud and an exuberant voice. A voice which immediately tells you that Jake is nothing like his dad, at all (Not that he would want to, anyway.).

         Oh, yeah, replied Jake. Dude look at this! See how I punched that guy?? Ooohh, yeah!

         His dad, whose name was Jared Alvin Smithy, shrugged, It's just a fight. You win some, you lose some.

         Jake looked at him. Really? I just beat the snot out of two ugly and I saved someone's life. I rocked it!

         Oh, jeez, Jared chuckled, I'm damn proud, son. However, I wish you could achieve in more important terms, other than a fight. Say, a promotion? Maybe some better grades? Jake rolled his eyes. Hey, Jake! Dont give me that eye-rollin! Got that, buddy-boy?

 

Being Watched

 

         Ugh, sorry, DAD, Jake argued back, I wish my life didn't have to be ruined by your annoying lectures.

         Jared laughed. I've been paying for your school, your truck, and your stupid, dumb phone. With the money I make, youre still the most expensive thing Ive ever spent my money on! When I was your age, I worked at a fast food restaurant. I didn't always live a wealthy life, who owned two pretty fountains! I don't want you to be a snotty, little punk, like the ones I had put up with, when I was in high school.

         Jake snorted, went upstairs, and obnoxiously responded, Why do you have to ruin everything for me, Dad??

See?? That's the attitude I do not enjoy, right there! That pig snort won't get you anywhere, but a circus! Remember that! Jakes door slammed and Jared laughed. Oh, damn, do I just LOVE teenagers.

         Jake was throwing a fit, in his head anyway. Amongst his baby-crying, he wanted to try out his new abilities. He wanted to achieve greatness, and find out what else he was capable of doing! As far as he knows, Jake is stronger than ever before. He can lift heavy objects, shoot a laser out his elbow, and throw up lava! However, puking lava was not Jakes favorite, at all.

The decision was difficult. Would he rather miss out on his Dads famous ribs for dinner, or go out to experiment his powers, somewhere out in the country? After thirty minutes of thinking, followed by a slight distraction of playing with his pocket lint, Jake got up, slipped on his jacket, and made his way out of the apartment. He avoided his dad, like a grumpy four year-old, as he left his home. Other than being angry at his dad for shoving moral fiber down his throat, Jake knew he was going to regret missing out on those delicious ribs.


Chapter 4: Newborn Foes

 

        

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         The day was ready to turn off the sunlight and call itself. Preox and Rig, so far, have had it rough. They were stranded on a fully inhabited, horrendous planet, surrounded by humans who would all literally crap themselves, if they saw anything out of the ordinary, such as aliens from outer space. Preoxs paranoia continued to grow drastically, as Rigs stupidity remained at a constant. Preox became vigorously suspicious, and it was obvious that Moosey was pursuing them. Preox had to fix the Vambit, fast.

         Theyre next conflict began in the residential area of Queen Anne, Seattle, just outside a restaurant known as Dick's Drive-In. Dicks was the perfect place to not only make ridiculous jokes and nautical puns out of its title, but to eat the most delicious cheeseburgers in the city!

         It was 7pm, the sun was setting, and it was the perfect time to grab a bite of Dick's. Rig had been wishing for this in the past few hours. Preox had to fix his Vambit, for he couldn't spend any more time walking around in a homeless person's clothes. Fixing his Vambit was now a number one priority, as well as retrieving the Serum and escaping Earth.

 

Chapter 4

 

            As soon as Preox finished ordering for Rig's cheeseburgers, Preox ran into the restroom and occupied one of the stalls. He detached his Vambit, pulled out an exotic tool (a tool for fixing Asid technology, specifically), and began working on the repairs. Neon sparks shot out, during the fixation of the Vambit, also followed by loud crackling noises. The fixing process was so obnoxious, that anyone within the Dick area could take notice, and be concerned, about it.

         A man, who appeared to be an employee, walked into the restroom and Preox immediately stopped working. The employee was silent. He looked confused and peculiar. It was dead, quiet, until the employee finally spoke in a high-pitched, deep voice, as if puberty was just barely leaving him. Umm.. You OkAY in hERE, sir?

Preox pretended to moan in agony, pretending to release his digestive tract.          Err...Ugh...Oh...YES! Yes I'm fine! Just...You know...Releasing! Oh dang! Oooohh here it comes! Preox found a pen laying nearby, taking it and dropping it in the toilet, in order to convince the employee.

         Oh, the nerdy teenage employee said, well okAY! Feel better, sIR.

         Thank you, kindly, precious human. Ohhhhh!!

         Once the employee was out of the restroom, with an awkward expression on his face, Preox immediately went back to work, with the return of that loud and obnoxious noise. Preox was very clever.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Agent Moosey17 stood patiently outside the Dick's restaurant. As he stood there, people laughed because he thought he was a ridiculous human in a ridiculous costume, as usual. The Agent didnt mind it one bit. Moosey was actually a living, talking, moose in a nice dark blue suit, who was the hunter

Newborn Foes

 

            of two unknown species from a distant planet.

         As Moosey stood in his place, trying to resist the urge to tranquilize the next person to tease him, a dark blue vehicle drove up and parked by the curb, several feet away from the moose. An average-sized man came from the passengers seat and approached Moosey. They both stood upright, side-by-side each other, avoiding any eye contact. The dark blue car drove away and was out of sight, as quickly as a ghost. The man, who had joined his fellow Agent, was much shorter than Moosey. Moosey was about seven feet tall, however. It was an awkward stature for the both of them, especially the fact that Agent Nathan12 was a mooses partner.

         Glad you could make it, Agent Nathan12, Moosey said in his little voice. His voice was too admirable to be taken seriously.

         Always been a pleasure working with you, Agent Moosey17, replied Nathan smiling, though he immediately straightened expression back to neutral. So, what do you got so far?

         The aliens are in that restaurant to the left. They've been in there for exactly-- looks at his phone --sixteen minutes and forty-seven seconds.

         Wow, you're really precise with your timing, huh? Nathan said.

         I know. I love this phone. It has a timer and everything! Its so revolutionary.

         Nathan chuckled. Welcome to 2005, Moosey.

         Oh, yes, thank you. The two agents laughed softly

         So, has the man given you any updates? Nathan asked.

         Yes. He said that when you get here, we have the permission to tranquilize the aliens. We have several other Agents surrounding the area. All I have to do is give the word and well be on the move, but you must be very careful!

         Don't worry, Nathan said, as he took out his tranquilizer gun and loaded it, I'ma make mommy proud.

         You ready, Agent Nathan12? Try to not cause too much of a commotion. We need to perform this act swiftly and carefully.

         Agent Nathan looked around his surroundings, slightly admiring the architecture of the city of Seattle. Turning at his partner, he smiled brightly, lowering his sunglasses. Why ask now? Im not chewing my gum, yet.

Chapter 4

 

            Nathan stuck a wad of gum in his mouth, so he could look much more intimidating. Oh yeah, baby. Let's do this!

 

5 Minutes Later

 

          Preox had finally done it! The Vambit was finally fixed! After a couple more visits from concerned employees, Preox managed to fix his most reliable instrument. Preox was actually, truthfully, happy. Well, just a little bit; enough happiness to relieve his anger toward Rig, as well as getting his heart pumping at its appropriate rate. Rig was sitting in his stool, at the counter, waving at people on the other side of the window, as he gorged himself on cheeseburgers and fries. HI! IM EATING! SEE?!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Rig! Preox whispered loudly, once approaching him.

         Rig turned his head, food sticking out his mouth, Whaff? The idiot spat food on Preox's big, pale green, head. His rage level was rising up, as he slowly wiped the food off. Rig, the Vambit, it's fixed.                   

Rig spat more food out his mouth, against the big window. Wow! About time!!

         Preox grunted angrily. Look, hurry up with those cheeseburgers, we got to get out of-- then, with his peripheral vision, he could see Agent Nathan12 aiming his tranquilizer gun at him —HERE, NOW! GET

 

 

Newborn Foes

 

            DOWN, NOW! Preox tackled Rig off his stool and took refuge on the ground, right when Nathan shot and missed.

         Moosey came around the corner. Prepare to be captured!!! Preox yanked Mooseys tranquilizer gun and smacked it against his head. Moosey fell down and started crying. Preox gave him a look of dissatisfaction and told Rig to get on his back, as people in the Dick area began to leave the restaurant to avoid any injury. Preox activated his Vambit, at last, and the two auto-turrets were deployed, as well as the jet-pack. They zoomed through the window, with the help of immense firepower, thus flying away from the restaurant.

         Targets are on the move, Nathan said with his phone, I repeat, the targets are on the move. Ascend backup now; they just broke this precious window, so be careful! Moosey! Can you get up?

         The poor moose whimpered, He hit me with my gun. He didn't have to do that. He, like, got fast! OH! Mother of God, save us!

         Nathans expression expanded after hearing his partner cry in uttermost despair and went back on this phone. We have an agent wounded. The aliens are hostile! The Captain still wants them alive, use your tranquilizers!

         Wow that was crazy sheeeezz! Rig said with a chuckle, as he and Preox flew through the Queen Anne area. Just then, several dark blue vehicles, were within pursuing view. Men stuck their guns out the passenger window and began shooting. One tranquilizer nearly ticked the Vambit, enraging Preox. Oh! You dare shoot ME with DARTS?! Okay, if you wanna play rough, oh I'll play rough!

         Rig laughed. That's what she said.

         Who said what?

         Rig laughed even harder.

         Preox turned around, fired his weapons, and swooped down toward the cars. Once he passed them by, the agency vehicles were either flipped over or critically damaged, as other cars in the street had collided into one another. People hastily got out of their cars and started yelling at each other, as Preox and Rig hovered in the air watching. Preox saw Nathan get out of his car; his outfit ruined and his glasses broken, followed by bloody scratches. Nathan stood up and looked at the two aliens in the air and shook his fist at them.

Chapter 4

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Is he congratulating us? Rig whispered.

            Preox shrugged. I suppose so. My Vambit is low on lemonade fuel and we need to savor it. Lets find a region to continue our journey for the Misara, somewhere more discreet.

         The aliens were flying away, leaving Nathan who was yelling, I will get you for this!!!! HOW DARE YOU RUIN MY AWESOME SUIT?!          Preox and Rig got away from the evil, mysterious agents. However, were they away from the mysterious agents for good? Preox only knew one thing when they left: The agency will continue to follow them, no matter what.

Meanwhile, National Kingzing City Junkyard

 

         A beautiful, significant, and unforgettable sunset sits just above Kingzing City, followed by perfectly warm climate. The gorgeous weather was the perfect emphasis to conclude such an eventful day. The beginning of the end, of what's also the beginning, starts off with Jake parking his pick-up truck in the middle of the National Kingzing City Junkyard. His windshield had remained shattered, after he had literally blasted it into oblivion with his intriguing laser ability. He seized his vehicle, with a slight push of the brake, and a gently shifted to park. Jake was pretty sure no one worked for the night shift at the junkyard. However, that was just another ill assumption made by an eighteen year-old with a low grade point average.

         Jake took exited his vehicle, stuffing his car keys in his jacket pocket. The junkyard was the perfect buffet for the Iron Giant.

Newborn Foes

 

            The junkyard was full of junk, enough junk to practice incredibly awesome super powers, without dragging too much attention, even though Jake wouldnt mind showing off.

         Okay, Jake whispered to himself, stay calm, stay calm. This has happened before and you are gonna do it again, even though the last time it happened, you could have incinerated people and broke my windshield! His amazing, new strength was the first for him to test. He went behind the tail gate of his big pick-up and calmly lifted the vehicles rear above his head, like it was no big deal. He thought he was like the Grinch who stole Christmas, only better looking (from his perspective, anyway). Slowly setting his truck down, Jake had a great expression of shock. It was an expression that looks like if someone were to mysteriously fart and secretly take a liking of the stench.

         Jake made his way to a pile of junk and found a neat, used pot. Jake hit himself in the head with the pot several times and it felt like he was wearing an invisible helmet the whole time, thus feeling only a slight headache. Jake was beginning to become overwhelmed once again. He couldn't believe it, he actually had super abilities and stuff.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Jake was not only overwhelmed by this experience, but he was also excited and ready for action. Real, serious action! Now it was time for testing the crazy laser, which he had just recently discovered. His elbows felt warm and toasty, as he readied himself for some messy work.

Chapter 4

 

            Jake spotted an old, abandoned automobile, which was useless and pathetic towards todays society. He pointed his elbow directly at it. He liked how his elbow was positioned. Thinking of Holly, Jake flexed his bicep, for only a split second, as his elbow released the mighty laser. The old vehicle was completely destroyed, up in flames. The muffler had flown out of the explosion, landing onto Jake's head. He was too distracted, too excited, and full of adrenaline. He didn't even notice the muffler slamming on his skull. He couldn't help but jump into the air and shout, HOORAY!!!

         Now, something was rather odd after he performed that stunt. As he jumped in the air, gravity did not take its course to bring him back down. He was hovering in the air. Jake screamed at first, swaying his body around. He could fly! Jake soared through the air in a calm and glorious manner, but how was he going to land? He had no professional control of this new ability. So, trying to be cool, as usual, Jake flew down to land on the ground. The only problem was that he was going too fast, and he hit the ground hard.  Jake got up, started flying again, and shot his elbow laser at the same time! Blowing things up and flying at the same time, surely, is every guys' dream and Jake was making that dream come true. Just then, an old man, whom was in fact working the night shift, appeared from the inside of his portable. The man had no teeth, no teeth at all, and he looked furious. Once he heard the door open, Jake was already back on his feet.

         Hey! the old man yelled softly. There's some people trying to sleep! You damn kids and your French kissin', get outta here! This is no place to build a fort, or whatever you were doin'!

         Okay, sorry, sir, Jake apologized, with a face full of excitement upon his face.

         Good, the old man repeated, because Bobby does not like that at all. I'm Bobby, by the way.

         Sorry, Bobby. It won't happen again, sir. I was doing my acrobats for science class.

         Jake, being a jerk, couldn't help but laugh at the old man. He sounded utterly hilarious as he spoke through his gums, where two rows of teeth were once occupying. The old man shook his fist at Jake, muttering dialogue that could not be understood.

Newborn Foes

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Good. Now I must go and finish my soup, by which you have made colder because you distracted me! He slammed the door, never noticing the sparks of fire and smoke, all around the junkyard. Jake took out his keys, activated the ignition, and drove away. He was hoping that his father Jared, had the respectful decency to leave left-over barbecued ribs for dinner.

         Jake thought to himself, Shall I tell people of my amazing abilities, or shall I not? He wasn't so sure what to decide. He did know plenty about superheroes and comic books. Some of them would hide their secret identity, some would not. If Jake were to become an actual superhero, it would be a pain in the ass hiding his true identity from everyone. There would be a lot of interfering with work, hanging with friends, and especially attending school. Jake continued to think about comic book superheroes and what exactly to do if he were to become one. This was actual reality, Jake had realized, and hiding his true identity as a superhero would be a lot more difficult than he had actually hoped for.

          This was something Jake had to really think about, and he really hated the idea of thinking. He was now driving on the interstate, heading back to the city, listening to music. He saw a billboard showing an ad of the latest cologne. Next to the bottle of the cologne was a cute couple, in their underwear, in each others' arms, while making out. This immediately got Jake into thinking about Holly Ransfield. His destiny was to ask her out on a date. Jakes confidence was really going overboard and his hopes were being held higher, than an auctions most expensive item.

Chapter 4

 

            How in the name of Holy Matrimony was he going to get the hottest girl someone, like him? She tossed a substantial amount of hot black coffee in his face, which revealed so much hatred towards him, so why should Jake even bother to try? Fortunately, anyone could guess, but Jake was smart about women, like how they acted and what they wanted. It may not look like it, but he knows. Oh yes, he knows, and he was going to work his magic. Jake had told his friends about dating many different teenage girls and how freshman are the easiest to pick up. He knows that he had never actually dated anyone, since he was a sophomore, however. That was when his ex, Velouria Knight Lancelot, was atrociously dumped after Jake said he was too bored of her and their relationship.

         It wasnt like Jake was a player, or anything. He was, without a doubt, a heartless dolt. Whenever he would see Kyle, it would be an awful day for that poor kid. As any heartless dolt would do, Jake could eventually ruin Kyles entire high school career.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            So, how was Jake Smithy going to get the legendary, feisty tigress known as Holly Ransfield? What first popped into Jake's head, as an idea, was to... Not be a jerk to Kyle, or anyone else? Jake gulped, for this would be the toughest stunt he will ever perform in his life. Although, if it was worth taking Holly for one lousy date, he will stop at nothing in doing so. It was his destiny. At least he thought so, anyway.

         Jake smiled, as he drove through the illuminated city in the night. He turned up the volume on his car radio and started jamming out, unaware of what was about to happen, right about Now.

Newborn Foes

 

            Jake squealed like a girl when he saw it; a big wad of cheese landed on the hood of his car. Jake was lucky to park next to a curb, of the nearby the Kingzing City Dansko Bridge, without completely crashing his vehicle. Jake took a few deep breaths of relief. Whats with the cheese?! He was angry and was ready for giving a serious beating to anyone who was responsible for the mess. Jake took the keys out of the ignition and stepped outside.

         Okay! Who in the name of Captain Crunch did that?? There was complete silence, just the sound of distant cars, the rustling sounds of bushes nearby, and trees swaying with the breeze. There was hardly anyone, or anything, in sight.

         Come on out, wussies! Bring it on!! Jake hollered at the top of his lungs. I am ready for a fight! Any fight! For I am built to be so very--. Jake was immediately silent, once he heard a loud, disturbing, extremely scary chuckle, coming from anywhere. Chills ran up his spine. He kept his eyes open, daring to shut them for not even a second. The chuckle ended with a loud smacking of lips. Jake turned white and clenched his fists. He then noticed every single surrounding sound –the passing of cars, the rustling of leaves –was diminished into nothing but silence. Okay, Jake said with a shaky voice, YOU may think this is a laughing matter, but it isn't! Prepare for a foot in your ass!

         There was nothing but silence, Jake's arm hairs were completely standing straight. Despite the fact that he had super powers, Jake was scared out of his socks. He kept his fists clenched, ready to throw an amazing punch. There was still no sound, just silence, and Jake began to feel relieved. He laughed his cocky and annoying laugh and said, Yeah, you better run and hide, buddy-boy. You better watch it! All hope was lost when he saw an orange street lamp die out, by the shatter of the light bulb itself. The street lamp was only a block away.

         Oh Jesus, he said, with faint amounts of sweat running down his forehead. The disturbing, random chuckle occurred once more, and it seemed closer than it was before. Jake turned around, for he thought it came from behind him. Okay, Cale. If that's you, consider your nose gone, buddy-boy! Then, the street lamp, from the other side of the street, went out. Jake's heart was pounding with fear and anxiety. He felt something hit the top of his head.

Chapter 4

 

            He took his index finger and hot, nacho cheese covered the tip of it. This was scary, yet it was the most ridiculous thing ever. Without warning, two more street lamps went out, leaving just one more lit up. Jake was standing right under it.

         The loud and obnoxious, BAHAHAHAHAHAHAHA!!! made Jake jump ten feet, followed by the sound of SPLAT. The roof of Jake's truck was completely covered with fresh nacho cheese.

         He felt someone tap his shoulder, and he swing his fist around. There was no one behind him. After a few seconds of new silence, he heard a cold, croaked, and horrible voice whisper gently, Boo.

         Jake squealed once again, seeing absolutely no one near him. He had to get out of here! The booming laughter came from out of nowhere once again, as Jake got into his truck and drove off. He began to cry, but only at the sight of the dripping nacho cheese that covered his truck.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

 

 

 

Part 2:

Son of a Triscuit!

(6 Days Later)

 

 

 

 

Chapter 5: The Adoa

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

    It was mentioned earlier that Zjok betrayed the Asids long ago, due to lack of respect from others, ridicule, and his selfish perspective of rule. Zjoks strategic ideas for warfare and other combat conflicts were exemplary. However, other Asids did not think so. Enraged, Zjok was ultimately moved from good to evil. Thanks to the Adoa, who accepted his devilish plans for conquest (such as colonizing other planets and creating unnecessary weapons of mass destruction), Zjok was able to rise in power, making him and the Adoa the most dangerous force the Asids have ever faced.

    Out there in the wonderful region known as SPACE, there lies a fleet, a fleet of the Adoa. As space stations and Adoa ships orbit around the planet Fleek, the leader, known as Zjok, pushes the buttons A and 6 to retrieve his favorite snack from his favorite vending machine. Zjok, himself, is equipped with a Vambit and armor. Zjok was angrier than usual; it has been six days since his Misara Serum was stolen and he stressed, as to where it could be located. He to was also tracking the Serum, just as well as Preox. The ten foot tall alien took his bag of chips out of the vending machine and  

Chapter 5

 

         began to snack on its wondrous flavor. He stood in front of a great window, viewing his entire militia. All of the sudden, the door behind him burst open with a sudden explosion. The door was blown into pieces, followed by no sudden reaction from Zjok. The alien slowly turned around to face the damaged doorway, as an Adoa Mazer entered the room.

         Brilliant job on blasting that door down, Zjok said happily to the Mazer.

         Thank you, your Majesty, the Mazer said with a laugh. As you can see, I have been practicing. The Mazer had an enormous, technological weapon in his hands.  

         I see you have been practicing, indeed, replied Zjok, and this will be a great technique for you in the future, once we retrieve the Misara Serum. IT is my prized possession.

         I can't wait to blow down some doors in combat, the Mazer said happily.

         Soon, Galg, very soon, Zjok replied. Do you have any updates?

         Galg chuckled deeply. The Serum has been traveling, not only to different areas, but also in the same region of the planet, for the past 144 hours. Maybe it's being transported for goods?

         No, Zjok said calmly. Someone has possession the Serum, Galg, can't you get that through your thick skull? Why would our enemies be in the same region for the past 144 hours? Someone else has it, other than our enemies, you dolt. Someone who doesn't know of the Serum, first-hand! This is good news, however. This location gives us a swift advantage.

         Damn, talk about being in the wrong situation at the wrong time. For the one, or ones, who now possess it, of course. Galg laughed, drooling.  

         Shut up! Don't make me laugh. I am supposed to angry. Anyway, we must leave Fleek, before the Serum is used wrongfully, or even worse!

         What would be even worse? Galg asked.

         It would be even worse if someone were to mistakenly obtain its essence, you mozzarella!

         What? Galg questioned with a concerned look.

         Having no clue what mozzarella meant, Zjok simply said, Look, just get the ships ready and tell them we'll be orbiting Earth, within a few weeks.

The Adoa

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

           

 

         How many days is that, sir?

         How the hell should I know?? A lot?!

            Galg smiled. Oh! Well, that's easy!

         Yes, now... GO! Galg left the room immediately, leaving Zjok to finish his snack. Now he had some time to think, to think about how stupid he was for showing a video of the Misara Serum. The thought lingered in his Asid brain, making him angrier. He was so angry that he wished to shoot someone with a laser cannon. All of that will come very soon for him. He knew getting to the Serums location would take a while, and the Adoa had no possession of light-speed. If he hadnt have been sleeping the night of the Serums disappearance, this problem would never have happened.

         Zjok gazed at the amazing view, from the massive window, which he was admiring before, until he started to hear a faint sound coming from a distance, inside the space station. Curious enough, Zjok went out of the room and followed the sound. Adoa Mazers and Strikers waved hello and said howdy-doo, Master Zjok? Zjok ignored them, for he had to know what that sound was coming from. He began to take notice that it wasn't just sound, it was music! Zjok enjoyed the sound of music, he really did. Although, there was some music he just couldnt tolerate

         Oh jeez, not The Carpenters again! Zjok yelled angrily. For the past 

Chapter 5 

 

         forty Earth years, since Zjok formed his army, the Adoa had no interest for any other music group, other than The Carpenters. The Carpenters were something Zjok could not tolerate, along with many other things. He took a rifle, from a gun rack nearby, and burst through the room where the music was coming from. It was an Adoa Mazer, working out with dumbbells, in his small room. The minion squealed, farted, and dropped his dumbbells on the floor. Zjok saw the record player, which was playing The Carpenters Greatest Hits album, and blasted it into smithereens.

         The Mazer began to cry. NOOOOOO!!! Why??!

         Learn the rules! Zjok snapped.

         But, this music was played during my grandma's funeral, master.

         Look at my triangular-shaped pupils of mine, Zjok said quietly, and does it look like I give a damn?

         The Mazer's face was distraught and he was just heartbroken. N-no, your majesty. The Mazer began to tear up, once Zjok had left. The Asid wandered around the area, checking if everything was in order before they finally took off for Sector 13 (Earths location). After a twenty minute walk, had proceeded into the hangar area, where ships of massive sizes were ready for take-off. There were three different types of ships owned by the Adoa Military:

 

         The Adoa Bat Fighter T-93

 

-Travel up to 3,000 mph

 

-This little beast can fly faster

than a real bat! Fires many

rounds of pure bullets made from

lava and solid platinum.

 

-Theyre about the size of the average

fighter helicopter.

 

 

The Adoa

 

The Adoa Mohawk Deployment Ship U5-106

 

-This is not a ship you want to

be close to, when in combat.

 

-Preferably known as a drop ship for

infantry reinforcement. Capacity of

twelve Mazers, two Strikers.

 

-Three laser cannons: two on both

sides, one on top.

 

-Theyre about the size of a blue whale.

are nothing but total devastation!

cannons and several

turrets that shoot small, though

deadly, sharp blades of metal. This

is.

Mother Ship and there are only

three in the entirety of Zjoks fleet.

 

-Extremely durable, very efficient.

 

-Theyre three times bigger than

the tallest skyscraper.

Chapter 5

 

             As more ships took off, Zjok approached a Striker. He was much bigger, much taller, than most Strikers and had special armor plating. This was Magnate Yayvox, the first of many Magnates, of the fleet.

         Ah! Good to see yew, yer Majesty! We're almost ready for official take-off. T-minus two minutes, I believe. You better get into your Elephant.

         Yayvox, Zjok began, that was the most messed up sexual remark I've ever heard you say. I would laugh right now but I'm too angry.

         You're always angry, sir. How was that sexual?

         See. This is why I like you! Zjok said happily, deliberately changing the entire subject, instead of explaining himself. You actually get me, unlike those other idiots who keep playing Carpenters.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

        

         Yayvox nervous look. Ah, sorry about that, your Majesty. I personally love Karen Carpenters voice, but I love you more.

         Yeah, whatever. Turns out we've spent the past five and a half days sitting here, whilst the Serum was in the same, damn region on that planet.

         Speaking of that, Yayvox said, is it okay if I took pictures when we get to Earth? It's gonna be the 15th planet we've ever colonized, you know.

         Zjok stared at him blankly. Fine, fine take some pictures. You better send me some copies, though.

            The Adoa

 

            Yayvox saluted to Zjok and they both proceeded to their designations, as ships took flight. There were three Elephants and they were the only aircrafts left in the hangar, before actually launching. Zjok activated his Vambit and neon green flames have given him flight. He flew up to one of the Elephants and purposely burst through a window. The window shattered, along with Mazers clapping and cheering for his impressive entrance. A secondary, newer, window slid up the frame, like someone was rolling up a car window.

         Thank you, Zjok said pleasantly. Okay, idiots, lets retrieve my prize. Once the Elephants had taken off for their journey, Earths safety had become an all-time low.

 

 

Kingzing City, Oregon, United States, Earth.

         For the past six days, Jake had been making trips to the junk yard, twice as often, to practice his super abilities (it wasn't too difficult to avoid Bobby's threats to call the police.). How does Jake do this? Well, he simply stays further away from Bobby, as far as possible. On another note, Jake won't leave Kyle alone, with his constant questioning about Holly. Kyle had never been so bothered, by someone he despised, in his life. Jake wasnt being a jerk, demanding that Kyle must tell him everything about Holly, but he was rather being consistently annoying. Finding it frustrating to deal with the consistency, Kyle also found Jakes behavior to be completely peculiar.

         Jake was finally done with baseball practice, and with only one more practice until the district game of the season, he was ready to kick it up a notch with his hidden talents. Jake was changing in the locker room, when Cale Omnous exclaimed with excitement. Dude! Keep it up with that radical swinging, broski!

         Where am I? The '80s? Jake said with a quirky smile. The other jocks in the locker room laughed, even though it was the stupidest remark ever said.

         I'm serious, man! Cale exhilarated. With a swing like that, you could get so much pussaaaayyy! Yeeee, boy!

         Indeed, he would get lots of cats, replied a jock, named Hayson Prent.

Chapter 5

 

            Jake laughed. Good one, Hays'!

         Cale snorted. Fine, if you guys aren't gonna take me seriously, I'm just gonna go complain, elsewhere! The jock picked up his stuff, after finally changing, and left the locker room, along with other members of the baseball team.

         Jake was the only one in the locker room, and having an IQ rate being

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

         fairly low, he was especially delayed when it came to changing clothes, let alone eating, for that matter. He was just tying his shoes when he saw something, small, and orange splatter on the ground. Jake's heart sank immediately, and knew it was nacho cheese. He quickly tied his shoe laces, grabbed his stuff and ran out, not daring to take a second glance at the mess.

         Something really weird was going on, with all of the mysterious cheese appearing out of nowhere. Ever since that horrible and anonymous encounter, Jake had been traumatized (Especially from the disturbing, demonic voice he heard that night.), ever since. He bumped into Hayson when he ran out the locker room. Hayson, conveniently, had a plate of nachos in his hand.

         Whoa, man! You almost made me drop mah nachos! Hayson yelled.

         Jake screamed inside his head. W-where'd ya get those?

         Oh the nachos? The annoying cheer leaders are selling them. Pathetic right? As if cheer leading were even a sport. HA! Anyway, would you like a

The Adoa

 

            nacho?

         Jake stared at the nachos, with slight hesitation Nah, Im good. Thanks, bro, I can eat better food at home.

         Yeah, but don't you have work tonight? Hayson asked.

         Jake closed his eyes with an irritable grunt. Ugh... Dammit! I do.

         Hayson laughed and shoved a big, cheesy chip in his mouth. Alright, well, see you around, man. Hayson pat Jake on the shoulder and left in the opposite direction, while Jake proceeded through the other. Thoughts swarmed through Jake's brain, like a crazy Japanese cartoon. Thoughts like: How am I going to get Holly to date me? How are the remaining days of high school going to turn out? How am I going to treat Kyle fairly? Who the hell scared the crap out of me, the other night? And most of all, How am I going deal with these super abilities? How did this happen?? Of course, the eighteen year-old did not know the answers to these important questions. For now, at least.

         Jake was walking in the school parking lot when he saw Kyle opening his car door.

         Hey! Kyle! Buddy-boy, what's up?! Jake hollered, jogging toward him. Kyle rolled his eyes with complete frustration.

         Ugh, not this again. What now?

         Just want to say 'what's up, doggy?'

         Kyle stared at him. What's with you these past few days? I don't have any money at the moment. I-I am in great haste, as it may appear unto you.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 5

 

         Jake looked puzzled, he didn't know Shakespeare at all. No! Kyle, I'm not here to mug you! I'm here to ask you something.

         Kyle put his backpack in his car and looked at him. Well, w-what is it, this time? I probably already know what it is, anyway. He looked slightly intimidated, as usual. If Jake asked him a question that he didn't know the answer of, the result would be disastrous. At least thats what Kyle believed.

         D' you, Jake started, know what Holly else likes?

         Kyle didn't feel so nervous anymore, he frowned. Ugh, not this again! Are you serious? Jake nodded. Kyle stared at Jake and suddenly let out a huge burst of laughter. Jake was embarrassed, embarrassed to be laughed at by someone he has been picking on for the past five years. As Kyle continued to crack up, Jake slammed his palm on the roof of his car. Oh, Jesus! Haha! Please don't beat me up, but are you serious?? You like Holly? The woman who despises you?? Pfft!

         Jake got angry, though resisted to punch Kyles face in. Beating him wouldnt help at all. Sorry, Kyle, but I do. I like her a lot, somehow. I dont know. She's just so...different.

         Well duh, spiffy! Kyle said, laughing some more. She's not like any high school air head you jocks date. Holly has a back bone for everything, she has a 4.5 GPA, she has higher standards, and she can practically kick your ass.

         Hey, don't remind me! She just gets me by surprise, that's all! Jake snapped. Jake had never seen Kyle Manning talk this way before.

         Kyle spat, spitting slightly on Jake's forehead. He was hardly scared of him now, for Holly was Jakes kryptonite. As if! I would like to see you try to take Holly down. For eight years (Count 'em, eight!), she's known karate and other defensive/combat affairs! She wears her black belt daily! Jake, you're an ass and the ass doesn't fall far from the ass tree. So what makes you think Holly would go for you? Ha, I said gopher.

         Jake felt bad. Maybe if you just helped me out, just a little?

         I probably would, if you didnt have make my social life completely miserable for the past few years.

         Kyle, I'm sorry.

        

            The Adoa    

 

            Kyle spat again, Too late... Buddy-boy. Kyle opened the car door, to the drivers' seat, and he paused when he was just about to enter. He was looking out into the distance, staring at someone.

            With an eye brow raised, Jake looked where Kyle was looking and there was Velouria Knight Lancelot, Jake's ex-girlfriend from sophomore year. She was walking to her car, for she had just finished with Art Club for the day. Kyle stared, exhaling passionately. Jake knew, for a fact, he liked her

         Jake grinned. Yo, Kyle. If you help me with Holly, I can guarantee I can score you a nice Velouria, over there.

         Kyle snorted. W-what?

         I dated her dude, I know everything about her, I think. And look at yourself! You look like the desperate girl from Sixteen Candles!

         Which one, if I may ask?

         The Molly Ringwald brat.

         Ah. But, I never see you two talk! Why would she date you anyway??

         Jake grunted. It was back in 10th grade, alright? It's been a while since I've talked to her, but I know I can get her to like you. I know, for a fact, that her favorite flowers are Forget Me Nots. Wow, I can't believe I didn't forget.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Kyle watched Velouria leave the parking lot, driving her car. He looked back at Jake and said sweetly, She's so beautiful.

         Well, have you talked to her at all? Jake asked.

Chapter 5

 

            Yeah, once or twice. She has the sweetest voice, sweetest personality. I still can't believe she dated a goon, like yourself.

         Okay, will you please shut up? I get it. Call me a name one more time and I'm stealing your jacket.

         You're wearing my jacket right now, after you stole it from me! Kyle hollered. Jake rolled his eyes, took off the jacket, and gave it to Kyle.

         There! Do we have a deal?

         Kyle thought for a while. Well, first off, gimme fifty bucks IN CASH! Second off, if you gimme the slightest sort of beating, or harassment, consider yourself GAME OVER! I love Holly, she's my best friend, and if you can prove that you can be a swell guy, there just might be a SLIM chance for you. Thirdly, dont forget to talk to Velouria for me, alright? Im too scared to. Jake moaned out loud. They were both acting like elementary school kids. This was the most difficult decision Jake had ever made in his life. He pulled out his wallet, gave the fifty bucks to Kyle, and they both shook hands.

         Thanks, man, Jake said.

         Whatever, Kyle said getting into his car. But hey I know, for a fact, that Holly's favorite flowers are tiger lilies.

         Jake smiled. I'll see you around.

         See ya. Kyle didn't smile back, for he still hated Jake's guts. He pulled out of the parking lot and drove off. Now, it was time to go to work at the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket, where something interesting was about to happen.

Somewhere in Southern Washington, around 6:30pm.

         Preox and Rig were walking, along an empty interstate, hoping to find means of transport. The Vambit was extremely short on lemonade fuel and Preox had no idea where he could find some.

         Ugh, Preox moaned, I'm so thirsty, yet the air is so moist, here.

         I feel just fine, Rig replied chuckling. I actually have to go to the bathroom. Preox grew angry and was about to deck Rig in the face when they saw a human vehicle headed in their direction.

         Human! Preox yelled hopefully. Please us give a lift in your... thing!!!

The Adoa

 

            The Asid began to look like an idiot, flailing his arms and jumping in the air, while Rig just stood in one spot. The car wasn't slowing down, as being operated by two obnoxious, punk teenagers. They sped right past the two disguised aliens and called them vulgar names. Preox was outraged, he had enough of this God-forsaken planet, already. Preox signaled Rig to electrocute the car before it got away from their view. Rig obeyed and released a huge lightning bolt toward the operated vehicle. The car come to a complete stop and Preox began to sprint to the car, with an expression of pure rage. The teenagers were scared and began to freak out, as he got closer to them. Preox showed up, said Hi, and wielded his rifle from his Vambit. He pointed the gun at them and yelled, GET OUT OF THE VEHICLE NOW!

         Rig snapped his fingers. Ooooh! You just got tolded!

         Shut up Rig! And you, humans, are lucky I don't blow your brains out, right now!!

         Yo, it was just a joke! one of the punk teenagers explained.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

        

         Preox opened the driver door and simply said, I'm not your 'yo'. Got that? The least you can do is shut up and go away, thank you! C'mon, Rig. The two entered the vehicle (Rig reactivating the car with lightning.) and drove off, leaving the two kids completely stranded. Preox had no problem in operating the foreign vehicle, not one bit. He had mastered the manual shift, within seconds. As angry as he seemed, Preoxs mind was spectacular.

         Driving for twenty minutes now, Rig opened the glove compartment

Chapter 5

           

         and found a bag of unrecognizable proportions. The bag contained a decent amount of crystal methamphetamine.

             Preox! What's this stuff?

         Preox caught a glimpse of it and just shrugged. Whatever it is, it disgusts me. Toss it out the window, there.

         Okee dokee!! Rig tossed the bag of unknown elements out the car window, completely unaware that the bag had hit someone in the face.

 

         This is Agent Moosey17, Moosey said speaking on his mobile phone. He had just popped out of a nearby bush, where Preox and Rig just passed. The illegal drugs, which Rig threw out, partially covered his face. I just saw the aliens speed by. You may commence the combat helicopter."

         Great job, Moosey! We are ready capture those aliens for good! Agent Nathan12, over and out.

        

         Here I am, rock you like a hurricane! Rig was singing along to the radio. Rig, not only enjoying a great tune by Scorpions, was also slamming his palms on the dashboard, pretending to play the drums.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                         

 

         Preox remained calm, as he successfully ignored Rigs actions.

The Adoa

 

            At the corner of his eye, Preox saw the helicopter from behind. It seemed to be following them, getting closer and closer.

         Son of a triscuit, he said under his breath and slammed on the acceleration pedal.

         Wooo!!! Preox knows how to have fun!! Rig yelled happily. Let's go! Faster faster faster! He stuck his head out the window and barked like a dog. Tranquilizer darts flew from out of nowhere and one of them whapped Rig in the back of the head. OW! PREOX THEY GONE SHOT ME IN DAH HEAD!! The back of his head was slightly bleeding, then he yanked the dart from his skull before it would put him to sleep.

Rig get down! We seem to have some company! Preox commanded.      

         The helicopter was gaining on them, more Agents began shooting at them. Rig! Take my rifle in the back seat. Blast those humans! Rig grabbed the rifle and shot at the helicopter from the back window of the car, which was completely diminished. Preoxs bullets smacked against the helicopters strong armor, as Rig laughed hysterically.

         Ooooo hoo hoo hoo hoo, Rig laughed, Preox step on it!! Preox slammed on the accelerator. We're gonna die! Rig was so excited that he covered Preoxs eyes in a playful manner, causing him to drive more recklessly

         Rig! Stop! I cant see the road!! Rig let go, spazzing out completely to no end. Their vehicle was now sliding off the pavement and eventually slamming into a tree before Preox could make another movie. The two aliens became seriously injured and completely unconscious, once again.


 

Chapter 6: An Abomination

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Jake was currently working the night shift at the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket.  He worked in the Say Queso film shop. There he sold cameras, batteries, rolls of film, frames, and prints of customers pictures.  Jake had two employee friends, working in different sections, nearby. There was Von Alan, who in the firearms department, and there was Sayra Haro, who was working in the electronics. Von was a middle-aged man who hunts many game and is efficient when it comes to the appropriate weaponry, at the appropriate time, of course. Sayra was just in her early twenties, as an expert in musical instruments. She also owns her own mariachi company

          It was 10:30 at night when Jake was printing pictures from someone's Kodak camera. He was still trying to decide on whether he should approach his ex-girlfriend, Velouria, in the hopes of making Kyle happy, for once in his life. Shall he text her, talk to her face-to-face? They haven't talked in a little over three years and it will be excruciatingly awkward for Jake and Velouria. However, Jake was willing to actually put in an effort.  Jake took out the photos he was printing and inserted them in an envelope, and thats when Von approached him. He was much taller than Jake and had a smile on his face.

Chapter 6

           

            Hows it goin?

         Jake yawned, for he was very tired. I'm good, bro, and you?

         Amazed.

         Why's that?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Some new guns came into stock today, I dont know if you noticed.

         Really? That's cool. Which ones?

         I got some rare M3A1 sub machine guns, and some semiautomatic pistols. Most beautiful things I've ever seen. Not only that, I got this sweet

Remington 870 modular combat shotgun with an eighteen inch barrel. You also gotta check out the new blades I got for camping! Camping!

         Jake yawned again. That's awesome, broski!

         Von looked confused. What's that?

         Jake looked puzzled, too. 'Broski?' You don't know what that is?

         Von shook his head and Jake realized he had no idea what the term broski meant, either. An awkward silence roamed, until Sayra approached.

         Hey guys.

         Hey Sayra! Von said excitingly. Did you see my--.

         Yes, you've told and showed me a thousand trillion times.

         Jake laughed. That's quite a lot of times of telling things, haha.

Hey, you're all just jealous that I work at the firearms department, junior, Von snapped. I'm going back to sell some awesome equipment. Come check out the supplies when you can, Jake. We oughta go fishing sometime.

Sounds good! See ya! Jake laughed, printing more pictures, as he

An Abomination

 

         heard Sayra exhale deeply from the bottom of her lungs.

         Jake sighed right back, imitating her. What is it now, wuss?

          Shut up! God, why you gotta be such a jerk?

         Dang, Jake laughed, what the noodle is wrong with you? Time of the month?

         Sayra paused. Shut up, Jake!

         Sooo...?

         Yes, it is that 'time of the month!'

         Ooooh...

         Yeah. Not only that, I'm starting to feel uncomfortable around this place, bro.

         Jake raised one eyebrow. Why's that?

         Sayra shook her head. I dunno, man. I mean, Im also uncomfortable being the only non-white employee in the whole store, although I keep smelling cheese, like, melted cheese. And its weird.

         Jake got a sudden shiver down his spine, though behaved naturally. Well, we DO work in the Cheese and Crackers Supermarket, dopey.

         Sayra had the urge to back-hand Jake across the face; she also hated Jake's unnecessary attitude. It's not that Jake. It's something else. I keep

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            hearing scratching sounds, coming from the vents.

         Jakes fear gradually began to rise. He immediately thought of the

Chapter 6

 

         mysterious nacho cheese, which once covered the roof of his 2003 GMC. Could Sayra be referring anything related to this subject?

         Oh yeah, and get this, Jake. Some asshole left a whole puddle of nacho cheese on my cash register. Sucks, right? Just my luck.

         Jake squealed, like a ferret, making Sayra jump.

         What's your deal, bro?

         Jake caught his breath. Oh, I'm fine. I just remembered that I need to-- umm-- I need to-- clip my toe nailsss-- laterrr.

         Sayra gave him the look of concern. Um you okay, bro?

         Yeah, I'm fine. I just really need to clip my toe nails!

         Sayra said nothing as she shrugged her shoulders, as she started walking away from Say Queso. Hope you have fun with that!

         Jake was scared out of his wits. The thought that he had super powers left his mind, especially when Sayra brought up the nacho-cheese-all-over-her-register incident. He was very cautious, now that he had of this disturbing update. Whatever he, she, or it was that scared the life out of Jake on that frightful evening, it seemed to have been following him. Being completely aware of this, Jake seemed to be slightly intimidated whenever he would see an item of an orange color.

         A few minutes later, literally no one was around Jake's photography store.  Jake was actually being quiet, which was unlikely for many of the Cheese and Crackers employees. His paranoia was beginning to take over his conscious mind.  Then, just out of the ordinary, Jake noticed something disturbing about the pictures he had recently printed. One picture of the collection was of an orange lit street lamp in the night. Another was of Jakes truck. Jake was starting to feel sick to his stomach; he was sweating out of his pits! Then, he saw a photo of his truck driving down the street, covered in nacho cheese. Jake dropped the stack of photos his hands shaking violently.

         You pathetic, ugly morsel, came a very creepy voice, I pay good money for those pictures.

         Jake recognized that voice, he had heard it before! That was the voice that whispered in his ear that one, horrifying night! Jake turned around and saw what was standing in front of his counter. The monster was at least seven feet tall and was well-structured in body tone, despite his slight deformities.

An Abomination

        

         Although it didn't look human at all, the being had lightly-tinted orange skin, with thick orange spiked hair and he wore a horrible grin, which spread widely across his face. He wore a gray shirt and very baggy pants, with ordinary sneakers, which seemed to be off-putting. The most disturbing feature of all was that the monster had razor sharp, yellow nacho chips attached to his entire body.  

         Jake coiled, with intense fear growing inside him.

         The monster grinned and politely said, Hello. May I introduce myself? I am what you pathetic humans call Evil Nacho.

         Jake stared blankly at him. Then how come I haven't heard of you?

         Evil Nacho was gonna speak again when a security guard began to pursue him.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Hey man, are you responsible for spilling limited amounts of cheese, here? I know we have a lot of cheese in this supermarket, but that doesn't necessarily mean you can just leave it on the floor like that! You're gonna halfta come into my office, you naughty boy, you! Evil Nacho turned slowly, his mouth slowly opening, revealing horrifyingly substantial and sharp teeth. The security guard looked horrified. Okay, I had no idea you were that tall until you turned around.

         Evil Nacho screamed ferociously and punched the security guard, causing him to fly into a shelf of delicious candy. This caused the other

Chapter 6

 

         shelves to collapse in a domino effect, and shoppers fled before the Evil Nacho.  More security guards approached, in an attempt to tackle the beast, but Evil Nacho was too fast, too strong. He plucked several nacho chips from his body and threw them like ninja stars. The stale, piercing tortilla chips injured one security guard and also injuring the other. Jake was about to soil himself. Jeez! What?! W-whats happening?! Then, he realized that he had an opportunity. A great, powerful opportunity. This was it! This was going to be Jake's first real fight with his super powers! There was no time for hesitated decisions, no time for delay! He was going to become the famous alter ego that everyone in Kingzing City will know of!

         Jake had to make it to the costume section, pronto, so he hopped over the counter, without Evil Nacho noticing. The monster turned around to face Jake and saw he was gone. Dammit! The one time I let my guard down! RRRGGHH!! Where are you, idiot?? I'm here to kill you, Jake!!

         Jake squealed, as he scrambled through a pile of costumes, which were all completely thrashed from Evil Nachos onslaught. How does he know my name? Jake thought to himself, and he felt completely thrown off, when he realized that this Evil Nacho had been stalking him in the past few days. Most of all why did the monster want to kill him?!

         The reason I wanna kill you is because this city doesn't need a freak, like you protecting the city, especially ME! This is MY city!

         Jake rolled his eyes as he put on a cheesy red ninja mask, tied a red cape around his neck, and his employee uniform. Now, he looked like a totally different person, somewhat. Jake stood up and noticed that everyone in the supermarket had fled, except for him and Evil Nacho. Jake lurked toward the sound of Evil Nacho, as the monster tearing everything apart. Jake was no longer afraid of this looney he was ready to kick some ass. Without warning, Evil Nacho came from around the corner and did not recognize Jake. Excuse me, goon in a ridiculous outfit, you know where I can find a putrid turd, like you. Jake pointed his elbow at the monster and blasted him with his laser. Evil Nacho grunted as he flew back against the wall. Evil Nacho quickly got up, for the laser barely took effect upon him. 

         You sly, little gerbil! Evil Nacho exclaimed laughing. His laughing was cackled and devilish. Ha! My, I didn't even recognize you! What're you,

An Abomination

             

         some sort of lame super hero? What are you? 'Super Jakey?' HA! Super Jakey glared at him, with determination. He felt like he was living a different life behind the eye holes of the ridiculous ninja mask. Boy, did it feel awesome.

         Let's go, skippy, Super Jakey said confidently, you mess with me, you mess with the supermarket. Wait, that's not what I meant--.

         Evil Nacho threw a nacho chip at him, hitting him in the fore head. Super Jakey yelled angrily, ripped the chip out, and began shooting at Evil Nacho with his laser once again. As the monster dodged Super Jakey's laser, he laughed hysterically. Amazing! You can shoot lasers out your elbow and take a terrible hit from my nacho chips! Remarkable, I might add!

         That's not all I can do! Super Jakey yelled and flew at Evil Nacho, tackling him. They tumbled through the automatic doors of the supermarket, scraping their bodies against the gravel of the parking lot. Super Jakey grabbed Evil Nacho by the leg and threw him at a street lamp. Evil Nacho quickly grabbed the street lamp, swung around, and gave Super Jakey a powerful kick in the face. The teenager flew backward against the back of a parked vehicle. The car alarm blared obnoxiously, as Evil Nacho threw five more chips at Super Jakey. The hero dodged all five, as Evil Nacho threw more. Without thinking, Super Jakey tore a car door from its hinges and shielded himself, from the chips. Citizens were watching, simply in awe.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 6

 

            Quickly, Super Jakey threw the car door at Evil Nacho. Evil Nacho jumped at a great height, avoiding the thrown object, and then tackled Super Jakey. He had him pinned against the ground and Super Jakey had noticed nacho chips were growing back from where he plucked them. Who is this freak?!

         Let's make this easier than it has to be, cackled Evil Nacho and started making hawking up phlegm. Out his mouth came a thick strand of hot, boiling, orange cheese. This cheese was gonna boil Super Jakey's face off! Evil Nacho was hella strong, too. However, Super Jakey was able to shift his elbow under Evil Nacho's stomach and flexed his muscle. Evil Nacho grunted angrily as he was thrown off, landing roughly on the pavement. Super Jakey got up and began walking to Evil Nacho, who was on the ground breathing hoarsely.

         Please, Super Jakey said, I don't wanna die, especially after I just got these sick powers! Makes me so mad! Super Jakey stomped his foot hard against the ground, a sonic boom to occurred, causing Super Jakey and Evil Nacho to fly backward.

         OWW!!?? Super Jakey yelled angrily. I had no idea I could do that!

         Evil Nacho laughed his ass off. How pathetic! Next thing ya know, you'll end up puking lava!

         Super Jakey stared at him with a stern look on his face. It got awkward when Evil Nacho realized that the puking lava remark was not a false assumption. Evil Nacho began throwing chips once again, Super Jakey went into the air and flew away from him. Evil Nacho jumped high, grabbed onto Super Jakey, and they were both flying through the sky, punching each other. Before they knew it, they were flying through the busy streets of Kingzing City.

         Evil Nacho attempted to spit on Super Jakey again, but missed. Evil Nacho grew angrier and threw Super Jakey down on the ground, like a rag doll. Super Jakey impacted the street and cars stopped before him. Honking horns went off, after a few vehicular collisions had occurred. Evil Nacho picked up Super Jakey by the shirt and threw him at a car windshield. Super Jakey moaned with displeasure. This was the roughest, let alone the first, beating he had ever received.

An Abomination 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                      

            The owner of the vehicle poked his head out the drivers window. Oh, dios mio. Rough night, my friend?

            Super Jakey got off the car and nodded as he wiped blood off his arms.      Very rough.

         Oh it must be, the driver said.

         Sorry, about the windshield, buddy-boy.

         Oh, it's fine, its my sisters! Go kick his ass!

         Super Jakey saluted, seeing Evil Nacho running toward him. Super Jakey then saw a fire hydrant nearby and started running towards it. Evil Nacho roared, jumping, and when he was just over the fire hydrant, Super Jakey fired his laser, blasting the fire hydrant, followed by a burst of many gallons of water, thus blasting Evil Nacho into the air. Super Jakey watched Evil Nacho begin to obey the law of gravity, hearing applause from the residents of Kingzing City. Evil Nacho landed next to the blasted fire hydrant, completely soaked in water and injured. Unfortunately, a mother and her son were hesitantly walking by when Evil Nacho grabbed them both.

         Mommy, mommy! the little boy cried as Evil Nacho held him by palming his head. The mother was crying and begging for mercy as he held onto her hair.

         Which one, Super Jakey? Evil Nacho yelled. The adorable child, or the beautiful single mother!?

         The mother sniffled. I'm not a single mother! My husband is at home!

            Chapter 6

           

            Evil Nacho rolled his eyes, repeating the question to Super Jakey. Once again, the mother interfered.

         No seriously, asshole, what made you think I was a single mother?

         Yeah, ash hole, the little boy said angrily.

         Johansen!

         Sorry, mommy!

         ENOUGH! Evil Nacho yelled angrily. How 'bout this, Super Jakey: Surrender yourself, or I'll pound these innocent idiots down to the ground so hard, they'll be wearing concrete as Halloween masks! This was getting really intense for Super Jakey. Will he trade his life to save two more? Well, something rather embarrassing happened to Evil Nacho, right at that moment of demanding questions. The single mother happened to have mace in her jacket. She brought it up to Evil Nacho's face and sprayed. The spray had no effect on the monster, in fact he started to embrace the spray in his mouth Mm, breath spray, thank you, madam, Evil Nacho said. You actually think that stuff is harmful to the MIGHTY EVIL NACH--.

 

PEEEEW!!

 

         Thanks to the mother, Evil Nacho was distracted well-enough to get a laser to the face. Evil Nacho was on his back once again, and was finally defeated. It was quiet, and witnesses murmured and chattered, as they admired Super Jakey's heroism. Evil Nacho's face was burnt and distorted. Super Jakey had won his first fight, as a superhero, and people all around him applauded happily, as the mother and son gave him hugs and kisses. Also, news reporters approached the hero and interviewed him. The city will now know him as the invincible... Super Jakey. As long as Super Jakey wore the cape and ninja mask, nobody knew who he really was.

         As Super Jakey was telling the news reporter about the fight with Evil Nacho, he turned around so the camera could get a shot of the defeated

An Abomination

           

         villain, only to see that he had disappeared! Out of sight! Everyone gasped to see that Evil Nacho was gone. Followed by gasps of surprise and the sight of the remnants nacho, a booming voice was soon overheard.

         YOU HAVE DEFEATED ME, SUPER JAKEY, FOR NOW! I APPLAUD YOUR OUTSTANDING PERFORMANCE! WE WILL MEET, ONCE MORE! AND ONCE WE DO, IT BE THE END OF YOOOUUU!    

         The voice could have been coming from anywhere, but Super Jakey just rolled his eyes and looked at the camera. Well, if anyone needs my help, just gimme a 'holluh!' Peace!

         Super Jakey took off flying. The news reporter faced the camera and said, Well, there you have it America, another flippin super hero!

         Jake was not only excited about the whole ordeal, but he was also excited that he had possessed yet another super power! He had the access to stomp his foot on the ground, creating a sonic boom effect. One thing he had to learn was how to use it, without creating so much damaged to himself and what surrounded him. Turns out Jake has to visit the junk yard more often!

         Jake returned home, later that night, around 11:50pm. He kept his ninja mask and cape somewhere safe, flopped on his bed, and had immediately fallen sleep, dreaming of the girl he adored.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 7: Ridiculous Strategy

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

    Monday!!!

         Jake's whole body ached, all from the epic fight with Evil Nacho, and even his toes and finger tips were ached. Thankfully, and miraculously, Jakes physicality was back to normal within no time at all, whereas his injuries would have been fatal if it werent for the Misara Serums efficient healing powers. Right now it was an early Monday morning, a lovely day in March, and it all started with Jake lazily descending down the stairs. His dad, Jared, was sitting at the kitchen table, wearing a coffee-stained t-shirt and boxer briefs, reading the newspaper. Jake weakly made his way to the kitchen and poured himself a bowl of cereal. He was always tired for, let alone of, waking up for school.  Jared noticed Jakes weak walking; he had also been noticing this for the past couple days. Damn, son, you're still sore? Jake nodded and moaned as he poured some milk from a full one-gallon container. Jared took a sip of his coffee, which sat next to his eggs and bacon, New girlfriend?

         What? Jake was extremely tired and weak. He felt like someone repeatedly slammed a brick in the back of his head, during brain surgery. The disgusting taste of morning breath didn't help, either.

 

Chapter 7

        

         Is that why you're so sore? Is your new girlfriend a little frisky?

In bed? Jake shook his head weakly. He was in no mood for his dads notorious, smart-ass remarks. Jake brought his cereal to the dinner table and ate, as Jared continued reading the paper. Ever since Super Jakey's amazing accomplishment, against Evil Nacho, he's been all over the media.

         So, Jared began, this 'Super Jakey' has really made an imprint on Kingzing City, especially his stupid name. Seriously, 'Super Jakey?' Jake was surprised as to how no one AT ALL noticed that he was actually Super Jakey. The name was such a dead give-away, or so he thought, but even his father did not see the obvious resemblance. Jake enjoyed keeping this a secret and he surely did not mind doing it, just for show. Jake had finished his cereal, got ready for dumb school, and was walking out the door when Jared hollered, Good luck with the rest of your baseball season, son!

He felt so bad ass when he saw them both inside his pack and he zipped his backpack shut. He reached in his pocket, pulled out his keys, and unlocked the car door. I would use that money to get a haircut, rather than spend it on drugs! The words spat on the meth head's face. Jake punched him in the gut and left him on the ground moaning. Jake went and picked up the gun and said the meth head one last time, You little scoundrel. Now I'm gonna be late for school!

Jake was not in the mood for a bad day. He tried his best not to think about Evil Nacho and what that cheesy beast was capable of performing. What worried Jake the most was that Evil Nacho knew Super Jakey's true identity. He liked keeping Super Jakey a secret, which also aided him in getting out of trouble. Although, Jake wanted to know, exactly, who the hell this Evil Nacho character really was. He also wanted to know why that ridiculous beast wanted to kill him so badly. For all Jake knew, that monster could attack at any moment. This was not gonna bother incompetent teenager for long, for he had other tasks to accomplish. Which was to dominate the Marsing High school's baseball team in the district game, this Friday! WOO! And also, to get Kyle the girl he deserves, so Jake can try to get the girl that he DOESN'T deserve, all that much.

 

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 7

 

            As Jake parked his truck, once he arrived at Kingzing City High school, he noticed Velouria walk from her vehicle to the school campus. He quickly gathered his things hastily got out of the truck. Walking at a fast pace toward Velouria, Jake hollered at her, Velouria! Hey!

         Your friend, Cale. Cale Omnous.

         Yep, Jake said with a smile. He also really likes boobies.

Chapter 8: Moosey's Frustration

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Area 72, a very secretive place that holds so many secrets. Area 72 could be compared to the Chamber of Secrets for todays modern society! On another note, after they were viciously hunted by a mysterious, governmental force, Preox and Rigs unconscious, yet seemingly uninjured, selves were brought to Area 72, where they are currently being held as curious experiments.

         Agent Moosey17 and Agent Nathan12 walked casually through the hallways of Area 72, both wearing angry expressions on their faces.

         I'm so angry, Moosey said.

         Me too, Nathan agreed.

         I wanted to kill some aliens today, but no, we had to bring them back for some damn reason.

         I guess Captain Derno wants to question the aliens. Moosey shook his head in disappointment, and so did Nathan. Moosey ultimately snapped.

         Could he be anymore clich than that of a science-fiction movie??

Chapter 8

           

         They're hostile!

            The two agents approached a huge, metallic door. Nathan picked his nose and smeared a large wad of snot upon a identification pad, next to the door. The pad disintegrated the snot and the door slowly opened.

         I've been keeping my boogers extra crispy lately, Nathan said happily

         Moosey rolled his eyes. Good for you, Im so glad your DNA is fresh.

            Once the door was open, the moose and the human walked into what looked like a huge exhibit especially constructed for alien-related possessions. Scientists were seen observing a massive, alien space craft, which looked like something anyone would see, from an old 1950s science-fiction movie. More scientists and the agents, of Area 72, were gathered around a certain area. They were mumbling and discussing in excitement, as if Santa put a butt-load of presents under their Christmas tree. It was Preox and Rig inside a huge, six-foot thick glass containment with air holes at the top. They were like a couple, freshly caught butterflies.

         Moosey and Nathan stopped in front of the glass structure, watching the two, mysterious beings. Joining them inside the structure was a TV and a couch. Obviously, Rig was watching the TV.  What was really odd about Rig, however, was that his antennae was surgically removed from the scientists, so he wouldn't be able to electrocute the place. Their (the aliens) disguises were taken, showing their true form. Also, the humans had ceased Preox's damaged Vambit – currently being repaired and kept by curious scientists. His armor was also taken and, Preox, being angry as usual, was throwing a tantrum. He wasnt angry in what anyone else would expect, anyway.

Moosey's Frustration

 

         indicating his nobility bravery from past experiences.

The scientists wanna see what alcohol can do to your kind. Obviously, it's affected you rather heavily; we dare not try it on your special, blue friend. Dear God, no. This also gives us a much better advantage at figuring where you're from and why you're here. Derno was dead wrong about the last part of his speech, because Preoxs light-weightiness would not be an advantage, not one bit. Preox was freaking out, and he had no clue what Derno was talking about, all thanks to alcohol. Dont do it, kids.

Chapter 8
