         Please! English! Captain Derno shouted.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Okay, okay fine, Preox said calming down. You DID say please, after all.     

         Captain Derno sighed. Okay. Will you please tell us why you are here? What made you want to come to Earth?

         Preox stood there, thinking, followed by disturbing belches. When I was a young boy, my father took me to the city to see a marching band.

         Scientists were writing down what Preox was saying. Preox continued his speech. He said, 'Son, when you grow up, will you be the savior of the broken? The beaten and the damned---?

         OKAY! We get it! Captain Derno shouted furiously and exhaled with stress. Derno was bright red; his face could roast an egg in no time, at all. As he listened to Preoxs little speech, he knew exactly what the alien was referring to. Preox was so drunk, he could mistake an alarm clock for a toilet. He also never had any recollection of speaking German, or French, only when Derno had merely mentioned it.

         Derno was undeniably stressed, beyond restoration. The slightest sight of Preoxs drunkard status, and Rigs consistently annoying stature, felt like he was going to have a headache for the rest of his old life. He would most certainly rather take a gun from a nearby agent and put a bullet in his temple.

Chapter 8

 

             Aww! Is Preox making you die, Mister Old Man? Rig asked calmly, now standing beside the Asid.

            Captain Derno ignored the idiot's side comment and hollered, You! Blue man, will you please tell me why you two aliens are here??

         Rig thought for a while. Oh yeah! We're here because we've lost a drinking thingy that can make you go BOOM!

         Gas? asked a scientist.

         No, Captain Derno said, that's stupid. Is it Pepto Bismol?

         Rig shook his head, like a bunny. No. It gives you super powers and such! That's why I can do that cool stuff my antennae! You remember that?! Now I cant do that anymore! Thanks! Heeee!

         The scientists were craving for more information from the Aziquet. Captain Derno and the agents were the only ones who did not believe him.

         Oh yeah? Why do you need this 'drinking thingy' so badly? Captain Derno, who was just full of sarcasm. He had finally given up on the two.

         So we can destroy these other idiots!

         Other idiots?

         MHMM!!!

         Rig wasn't very good at keeping a straight, normal face. His ridiculous grin made him look like he was lying to the humans. Rig couldnt help it, for he's always never known better and always had an act of pissing others off. The agents and scientists observed, as Rig and Captain Derno discussed about everything that has happened, ever since they ended up on Earth's surface: From the crazy hobo in the tunnel, to being chased on the interstate.

         So, this Zjok, Captain Derno said, wants the 'drinking thingy' because he invented it? But you guys stole it after just recently learning of its capabilities? Rig nodded happily. The whole scenario sounded completely ridiculous, since it wasnt told from Preoxs perception. The way Rig was explaining it sounded like he was telling a story, in front of a bunch of little kids in a library.

         The more Captain Derno grew impatient, the more Rig seemed to be happier. Rig never intentionally annoyed someone, but if he did, there would be no stopping him, anyway. You don't say? Captain Derno said. And this 'Adoa Army' could be on their way to destroy our planet, all because we

Moosey's Frustration

 

            possess the 'drinking thingy?'

            Yeppy-yeppo! Rig shouted happily. Preox was standing there, watching the whole conversation. He was still heavily intoxicated.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Captain Derno nodded, then shook his head. Get these two aliens ready for execution, within the next day, they're pathetic. Then, you scientists can have your autopsy fun.

         WOO! Rig yelled happily. The scientists were excited, as well.

         Rig, Preox said laughing, I can't believe you just killed us both.

         Thank you, Preox. I like you when you're drunk.

         I'm just a little tipsy, that's all, silly goose, Preox snapped. Then, he felt sick and vomited all over the floor.

         An agent walked up to a control pad on the glass structure and slid his finger across the screen, then, out popped a little turret from the TV. The turret shot an injection of whiskey at Preoxs head. The alien laughed hysterically, until he passed out completely on the ground.

         I'm gonna go to sleep too! Rig announced and went to sleep.

         The scientists and agents left the area and went back to their normal duties.  Meanwhile, Agents Moosey17 and Nathan12 both sat alone in the official Area 72 cafeteria. Moosey ate ferociously at his little bowl of rice, as Nathan calmly ate his Express Panda. Nathan wasn't as angry as Moosey was, but he could certainly understand Mooseys frustration, about the whole alien ordeal. Moosey was a faithful agent, of the American government, and hed never been yelled at by Captain Derno, before. Poor, poor Moosey.

Moosey growled and started babbling, with a mouthful of buttery white rice.

Chapter 8

           

         Nathan! I've been working for the stupid human government for the past decade, have I not???

         I guess, Nathan replied, taking a sip of his soda. Moosey swapped the drink out his hand. It was quiet.

         You guess?? Nathan! I've been through so much! Well, not really, just dealing with farting donuts and paranormal platypuses, but this alien thing is the biggest moment to ever happen in my career! Nick Fury has been taking everything, with the whole 'S.H.E.I.L.D. Agency' and all that junk! Nathan, our agency doesn't even have a name! People just call us the 'Area 72 Agency.' THAT'S SO LAME!!!

         Moosey, j-just calm down, okay? I just got a text message from Captain Derno! Nick Fury is a fictitious character, remember?

         Moosey went berserk and threw his rice everywhere. Once he calmed down, he sniffled and asked politely, What'd he say?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

 

         Nathan looked at his phone in shock. He's given permission to execute the two aliens, later this week.

         Moosey immediately started wagging his tail. Reallys?? At what time?

         It says 'during the afternoon or something.'

         Happiness erupted from Moosey's face, and cheered, as if the Death

Moosey's Frustration

 

         Star just blew up. The aliens were going to die, at last! All thanks to Moosey, himself, he will be the most famous moose of all time! He had saved the world!

         D-did he mention me or anything? Moosey asked hopefully.

            Nathan felt horrible for Moosey, after looking through Captain Dernos message a second time, shaking his head no. Moosey stopped wagging his tail. But, I'm the one who discovered them! I started stalking them in the first place, back at that stupid beach! RRGGH!

         Look, Moosey, it's fine. I'm sure he knows that you deserve to be credited for finding these aliens, Nathan said, trying to cheer up poor Moosey. The mammal sniffled and started crying. Moosey was a tough, sophisticated agent, sometimes. Moosey continued to cry, then suddenly stopped. His face switched, from sad and depressed, to angry and pissed! He got up and left the cafeteria. Nathan followed him, asking where the deranged moose was going. He was making his way back to the room, where Preox and Rig were being held in captivity.

         Moosey! What the heck-hole are you doing?? Nathan hollered.

         Something I shoulda done almost a long time ago! Moosey answered.      He pulled out his pistol, aimed at Preox in the glass structure, and fired several rounds. The bullets deflected off the glass, barely receiving any damage. Nathan was ducking for cover until a bullet ricocheted off the glass and hit Moosey's horn, critically damaging it.

         Moosey started crying again and threw the gun at the structure. The gun bounced off the glass and hit Moosey on the shin. He cried even harder. Preox and Rig, being brain dead, stared at the poor moose, having trouble depicting exactly what was happening. Nathan came out of hiding and comforted the moose. Scientists and other agents stared with concern.

         You gotta take care of your poor son there, bub, Preox inquired. Nathan shot a look at Preox and the two left the room. Preox and Rig could hear the faint echo of Moosey's sobbing. Moosey wanted to kill the aliens so bad, it made him cry. He had never felt so disrespected, so mistreated in his life. Preox and Rig stood there, for a bit, when Preox collapsed on the ground. Rig looked over the Asid, smiling happier than usual, which appeared to be creepy and uncomfortable to see.

Chapter 8

 

         You okay, buddy? Rig asked sweetly.

         Gnome! Preox snapped, meaning to say no. This sucks graham crackers! This 'alcohol' is ruining the way I think! I keep thinking how

sexy giraffes are! I don't even know what a giraffe is!

         Rig sighed. That's what alcohol can do to you, man.

         We must! Preox shouted.

         We must what, sir?

         Eye-dee-kayy, Preox replied, laughing his ass off, for no reason. Preox and Rig were surely doomed.

Planet Strom

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         The planet Strom was not far from Zjok's and the Adoa's reach. That's what the surviving Asids had little knowledge of, after surviving the epic Adoa invasion, from not so long ago. Eight Asids stood there, stranded on the planet Strom, with no means of communication or transport to their home planet Suzia. Everything was destroyed of what used to be the Asids military structure. Piles of roasted dead bodies laid in several piles, scrambled all over the area. Planet Strom was an empty, mildly-weathered planet, and with the only shelter destroyed, the Asids were left to die. There were eight surviving Asids, along with a particular Asid, who was ranked as an admiral.

 

Moosey's Frustration

 

         His name was Admiral Bxir and he wasn't as pale-skinned and green, like most of the Asids were (His skin was a perfect shade of red). His Vambit was so sick, anyone would want it instead of a car. Not only that, he had a strong, of what sounded like, southern accent. Following Admiral Bxir, there was Zitkir, Drox, Querznem, Oil, Kriket, Rav, and Bunny. Bunny was known for his soft attitude throughout the many Asids he knew.

         The group of Asids sat around a purple camp fire, during an awesome night on the planet Strom. The planet Strom had a perfect view of two beautiful crescent moons, surrounded by many stars and cosmos in the distance. Admiral Bxir was the only one standing out of the camping area, gazing at the beautiful night sky.  Kriket, who was a GIRL Asid, rose up from sitting on the cold ground, and calmly walked up to Bxir.

         Beeeww-tee-fulll, ain't she? Bxir said.

         She? Kriket asked.

         Tha universe! She sure is purty, huh?

         Yes, Kriket answered, gazing at the sky. Um, Admiral?

         Yessum, Common Kriket?

         You think they're okay? Preox and Rig?

         Bxir chuckled. Of course I deeww! Dey flew away in tha only ship dat had light speed. I'm sure they've found a place where tha Misara Serum is darn safe and/or disposed of!

         They left without us, Admiral.

         Yeh? Yer point, Kriket?

         Kriket sighed. The fact that Preox and Rig got away in the only ship in, what used to be, the hanger area, without Bxir and the others, really disappointed Kriket. In fact, she hated them both for doing so, even though she had hardcore feelings for Preox, himself.

         My point is, Admiral, is that those two idiots left us here to die!

         Kriket, Bxir interrupted, I would rather die fer my planet, than let tha Adoa destroy another. Dis damn 'jah-hooky' is really gettin' old, as old as Satans britches! If it's worth tha safety of planets all over tha galaxy, I wood rather die tryin', Common. Kriket was still upset. She looked back at the other Asids, sitting by the purple camp fire, then back to Bxir.

Chapter 8

 

         Well, those Asids wouldn't, Admiral. Preox had enough time to wait for all eight of us.

         Why we fightin'?

kl

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Kriket looked puzzled. I beg your pardon?

         We all know that yew has a crush on meh, Bxir said laughing.

         Wait, what?

         Yew all being like... 'I gone looks at tha stars wit' Admiral and flirts with him.'

         I'M NOT FLIRTING WITH YOU?!

         Yes, yew totally is! Bxir laughed hysterically.

         Kriket stormed off towards to the camp fire, Bxir following her and continuously laughing.

         What's so funny? Rav asked. He had plastic bandages all over his head and his armor was blood-stained, similar to some of the other Asids.

         Kriket must be flirting with Bxir, Oil answered. He was a depressed, young soldier. I wish someone would flirt with me. 

            Oh, you big baby, Kriket snapped.

         So what's up, Admiral? Zitkir asked. He was like Preox: a valiant, noble warrior, other he than the anger management issues. The smell of dead bodies is starting to get to me. How're we getting off Strom, now that all of our transportation and communication is gone? We can't just use our Vambits. We don't have enough lemonade for that kind of distance to

Moosey's Frustration

 

             just fly away.

            Der! Bxir exclaimed. It's space!

         Oh be polite, Bunny said.

         Eye-dee-kayy, Asids, Bxir said with a sigh. Mah Vambit is steel sending off dat signal, in case any Asids happen tah pass by Strom in serch of servivers. Fer now, we can jus' stay here, eat fish sticks, and jus' cheeelll.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

         There was a long session of silence throughout the camp fire, except the sound of the crackling, purple ashes.

         I'm bored, Drox said. He was the youngest.

         Me too, Querznem replied. Let's do something.

         Before anyone could say anything else, the sound of falling iron occurred, making all the Asids jolt from their positions.

         What da hail wuz dat? Bxir said, wielding his rifle, taking the safety off. Some of the other Asids did, also.

         Preox?? Bunny hollered.

         Shut up! They're not here! Rav whispered angrily.

         Well, you never know!

         Shut tha hail up! Bxir yelled, pointing the gun at Bunny, eyeing where the sound had occurred.

         It was silent two minutes, again, until Bxir finally said, Allllright. Deys nothing dere. Mus' be some fallin debris. 

Chapter 8

 

            The Admiral folded his foldable weapon and stored it back into his suit of armor. The others did just the same.

         Admiral, Kriket came in, we haven't heard any falling debris for over a week. Don't you think we should take this more seriously?

         Kriket, just becerz yew is a girly, doesn't mean yer the smartest outta all of us. Por que?

         It's 'comprende', sir.

         There was another loud bang, as if someone or something was thrashing the debris around.

         Okay, there's something out there, Oil said, unfolding his rifle.

         It gone come from over dere, I think, Bxir said pointing to the exact same spot where the first disturbance occurred.

         Should we go check it out? Drox asked.

         No, we can still go to sleep with all this suspicious noise going on, we're fine, Zitkir said sarcastically.

            Jeez, Zitkir, I didnt ask for your attitude! Drox yelled.

         It IS the perfect time ta express attitude, cuz yew won't shut up! Bxir yelled right back. Alright, Kriket, Zitkir, Rav, Oil, Querznem, follow meh. Drox and Bunny, as sharp shooters, cover us, and keep an eye on whatever's comin' to our camping-place-thingy.

         Bunny and Drox saluted and the five Asids quietly made their way to the destroyed base.

         Lights, Bxir whispered and everyone's revealed small flashlights, from each side of their Vambits. They all held their rifles tight, ready to open fire on anything that may be a threat.

         Querznem, gimme an update on our position.

         A small, holo-graphic radar screen unfolded on Querznem's rifle. It was working perfectly, even after fighting against the Adoa from earlier. I'm just reading the five life forms, which a--.

         Holy! Bxir whispered loudly. Men, get ready!

         Admiral, the five life forms are us, Kriket said calmly.

          They entered inside, through a blasted doorway. The ceiling and walls had gigantic holes in them, giving the Asids a bit more light inside from the

 

Moosey's Frustration

 

            night sky.  

         Okay, now I'm reading something else on my radar, except it's not a life form, Querznem whispered.

            Holy tits, Rav said in a voice that showed his fear. We're dealing with ghosts!

         It must be a Probe, Zitkir corrected.

            Dat's what I was gonna say, Bxir said. Kriket rolled her eyes, she knew Bxir was full of crap. As always.

         Whoa, I'm reading three more, Querznem whispered. They're headed our way.

         Alright, Asids, get yer butts ready fer sum whoop ass, Bxir ordered.

         Querznem laughed. I feel like we're on--.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Someone, or something, shot Querznem dead. They weren't Mazers, nor were they Strikers. They were tall, robotic beings, which all wielded a massive weapon for their own right arm.

         Damn! Adoa Probes! Oil yelled in fear, firing his rifle, along with the others. Knowing that Querznem was gone, Bxir took the dead Asids' rifle, folded it, and stuffed it in his Vambit, as they all shot at the Probes. The Probes were strong with thick armor and they shot purple, deadly lasers.

Chapter 8

 

         Go go go!! Bxir ordered and the Asids began to flee from the Probes. 

As they ran, Kriket threw a grenade at the enemies, getting it lodged inside a Probes armor. The grenade exploded, taking out the Probe and the ones surrounding it.

         Oh, God, that's so hot, Oil said, as they made it out of the base. Just then, they realized Drox was fighting off a couple more Probes; Bunny was presumed dead, once he had been seen lying next to the camp fire, covered in his own neon-pink blood. Bxir hated losing his Asids more than anything. He yelled angrily, activated his jet-pack, on his Vambit, and flew back toward one of the Probes chasing them. Bxir grabbed the Probe by the face, shooting the rest of its robotic body to bits with his rifle.

         Rav and Zitkir went over to help Drox, as Oil and Kriket fought off the other Probe that was chasing them. The fighting continued, until the Probes were all destroyed. Kriket was kicking their deceased heads as Bxir announced, Everyone fine and dandy?

         All of the remaining Asids responded that they were fine.

         Querznem is dead, Kriket said.

         I was gonna say dat, Bxir said angrily. He took out Querznem's rifle and displayed it next to Bunny's. Two fallen soldiers from a buncha annoyin' robits. Yew will be greatly missed, Querznem and Bunneh.

         This was an upsetting moment, especially when Rav, Oil, and Zitkir placed the two dead Asids in their own campfire, as a ceremonious form of memorial.

         Admiral, Kriket said, after they all mourned their losses, this situation is far from over.

         Kriket is right, Zitkir said. Adoa Probes are not only troops, but the Adoas know what or who destroys them (They must have been put under ground, for scavenging any survivors from the battle, before.).  The Adoa should be here sometime soon.  Before they knew it, the Asids saw several Adoa Bat fighters arrive from a distance.

         Yeah, I think that's what Probes are for, Drox said to Zitkir sarcastically.

         The fighters were not firing their weapons, but were proceeding for the capture of the Asids. Bxir sighed and said, Well, were screwed.

 

 

Chapter 9: Survivors

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         SO! Zjok yelled at the top of his lungs. You actually think you could survive on MY watch?! Thanks to my Probes, which are programmed to record anything, you mindless bozos were doomed, right from the moment they saw you! He was yelling at the six surviving Asids, who were Bxir, Kriket, Zitkir, Oil, Drox and Rav. They were all captured, once the Bats arrived on the planet Strom and all of their weaponry was taken. They were completely defenseless! At this very moment, they were inside a large prison cell of Zjok's massive Elephant. The Asids stood against the cold hard wall of the interior, not bound or chained, just minding their own business, as they listened to Zjok's lecturing.

         I think we would've gotten away with it perfectly, Drox replied, if BXIR didn't have to let out his 'pet barking spider!'

         Hey! Bxir snapped. I couldnt hold it in, sorry!

         Shut up! Zjok yelled. It's fine! Although the Mazers did hear you fart, but at least it didn't stink.

         It's still pretty disgusting, Kriket said laughing. Despite all of the pandemonium and warfare shes witnessed, farts were funny no matter what.

Chapter 9

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        Hey! Girls give out a little gas teew! Admiral Bxir added, arguing with Kriket.

         Zjok's eyes widened. He completely took his mind off of the main subject. NO WAY! My life has been a lie.

         Yeah, dude!

         How can they make them so quiet??

         Admiral Bxir shrugged. Sometimes they do, sometimes they dont! Zjok was appalled and Kriket was annoyed.

         Okay, back to the main subject, Zjok continued. HOW DARE YOU SURVIVE?! Well, I hope you idiots know that we know exactly where the Misara Serum really is. What amazes me is that Preox and Rig no longer possess the weapon. Heheh, I'm so glad to say that the two are pronounced dead.

         The Asids gasped. Kriket was more distraught than everyone else. Zjok laughed hysterically, Look at you, all being sad 'n' what-not. It's like teasing a little baby. You werent so distraught, when I turned out to be like this! How fair! The evil Asid noticed Kriket sniffing, like she was about to cry. She really did not want to lose Preox, especially. Zjok looked down her, his height towering over hers. He laughed maniacally. Aw, what's wong? You gonna cwy, ya wittle baby? Lemme see those tears, you putrid scum! Cry, you lifeless brat!

Survivors

 

          Kriket was bawling and Rav absolutely had enough. He stood up and pushed Zjok. The Adoa guards were about to blast his head off. Zjok signaled them not to. Oooh, getting a little aggressive, now, are we? Zjok said laughing. What're you gonna do, tubby? Suffocate me with your fattening fat? Rav was quite obese, and that little remark offended him, greatly. He swung his fist at Zjok, Zjok caught his fist and, with great force, bent his fist backward. Rav yelled in agony as the rest quivered at the sound of bone being shattered. Even the Adoa guards reacted negatively.

         Zjok bent Rav's fist further and further as he whispered, Wanna see my new gun? Keeping Rav his place, Zjok pulled out a shiny-looking hand gun, loaded with over-sized needles. He pressed the gun against Rav's stomach and pulled the trigger. What was left, after the sound of the gun going off, was an over-sized needle lodged in Ravs stomach. He fell on the ground, moaning in pain as the needle seemed to be sucking every last drop of his blood, and vaporizing it from the other side. The remaining Asids watched in horror as Rav's evaporated blood lingered in the air, like smoke. Rav's skin was becoming wrinkled, and he died, before all his blood was completely diminished. Zjok aggressively ripped the needle out of Rav's dead, wrinkled body and reloaded it back inside his special handgun.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 9

 

         That was a nice test run, wouldn't you say? Zjok said with a menacing smile.

         You asshole! Kriket yelled angrily, with tears rolling down her cheeks. Bxir stared at Rav, with anger over-flowing his brain.

         Oh boo hoo! Let ME have some fun, for once! YOU, puny little turds, stole what was precious to me! Isn't it fair for me to do the same??

         Not really, Oil said.

         Excuse me??

         The Misara Serum, it's hella dangerous, fool! Whats up in your head, huh?

         Oil just shut the hell up, please, Zitkir whispered.

         Of course, Zjok replied, I WANT the Serum to be dangerous. It's for my revenge and total domination for this filthy galaxy. Its everything the way it should be! I deserve domination! You deserve damnation!

         Oh simmer down, now! Bxir hollered. Just because yew were so socially awkward back before yew betrayed us--.

         ADMIRAL! Would you like to see dead pig innards the first thing you wake up? Zjok said angrily, referring to an incident, which had occurred when he was part of the Asid Military. Bxir DID put a large pile of dead pig guts all over Zjok, as a prank, before he had woken up.

         Yeah but it doesn't mean you should be a brat and invent a super weapon that can destroy not only us, but you as well, Oil replied.

         Zjok was too pissed. He took his fancy handgun and shot Oil in the head. Kriket was quiet and couldn't bear to watch Oil die.

         Ugh! Four deaths in just one hour, Zjok said happily. How unfortunate for you idiots! As a reasonable punishment for you remaining four, you will now work for me. I need a few Asids to keep me company. Being with many Mazers and Strikers can get really old, ya know??

         Zjok ripped the needle off of Oil's dead body and reloaded the gun. Guards, dispose of these bodies. I don't want their rotting stench, stinking up the whole ship. Zjok was a complete psycho.

         Two Mazers walked into the prison cell, from each side, and dragged the two dead Asids out of the area. Admiral Bxir was not only raged, but just as upset as Kriket, and the rest of course. They lost four of the Admiral's  

Survivors

 

         greatest soldiers: Querznem, Bunny, Rav and Oil. It was now Bxir, Zitkir, Drox, and Kriket. Who knew how much longer they were to survive?

         Now, Zjok said in a calm voice, I want you to stay here, like the insignificant, primitives you all are. I'm gonna go set the timer on the kitchen stove and once it goes off, I'll be back to relieve you from time out, and I will assign you some special chores! YAY! Are we clear on that?

         Drox sighed. Finnnne.

         Bxir couldn't help but think about the death of Bunny, Oil, Rav, and Querznem, especially now that they were held captive in a stupid ship. It was quiet and lonely and Kriket was traumatized, beyond measure. She leaned against the wall, breathing silently. Her silent breathing was the only thing she wanted to concentrate on. Although, she failed miserably at doing so and she began to cry, breaking the silence. The loud sound of an Adoa rifle hit against a cellar door, followed by the voice of an Adoa guard. Can you please be quiet? I'm trying to watch Family Matters.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Oh, shove it up your ass! Kriket yelled back.

         What'd you say?! That's it. Guards, cover me! The noise of footsteps came toward the Asids' cellar door. The door unlocked and came in a Mazer, running toward Drox. The Mazer wailed on him, punching him, and beating him with his rifle. Drox screamed in agony, followed by confused looks on Bxir and Zitkir, especially Kriket.

         Ow! Dammit that hurts! That wasn't me!! Drox hollered.

Chapter 9

 

         The Mazer stopped beating him and left the cellar with a few more guards. I know you didn't, the Mazer yelled back, I just don't hit girls! The noise of footsteps occurred once more, and they stopped, indicating that the guards were back to their assigned positions.

         Drox's face was swollen and bruised. Kriket-- what the hell--?

         He began to whimper and cry a little. Kriket felt awful. Drox, I'm so sorry.

         Y-yeah, well, the next time you wanna bitch at a Mazer, let me know alright?

         Zjok entered his lovely cockpit, whistling a wonderful tune, with his deadly weapon in his hand (A box of crackers in the other.). Galg was monitoring radars other activity, as the Elephant patrolled through space at a great speed.

         Zjok walked up to Galg, who was particularly in an outstanding mood.        Galg, I can't help but notice, do we seem to be going faster?

         Hell yeah, Galg said happily. Apparently, when arriving to Strom, we have recovered gallons of this special fuel the Asids had been hiding. It gives our ships, here, a much faster advantage. Our researchers say that this is the fuel used for 'light-speed' ships, Master Zjok. Although the fuel is far too advanced for our models, we can use this fuel to approach our target, much efficiently and quickly. Thank God for orange juice fuel.

         Zjok's eyes widened. Light speed fuel? Galg, our researchers are geniuses, which is a huge surprise!

         We will make it about a day, or two, earlier! Galg shouted excitedly, scaring one of the Mazer pilots. Zjok looked at the image of planet Earth from one of the ship's magnificent telescopes. The live image was displayed, from a projector, on a big billboard, next to the pilots' station. He admired the beauteous planet. He found it quite different. He grinned, as he watched the projector. His facial expressions have always intimidated the Adoa.

         I see that our destination is loaded with water, landscapes, and so much life. If we wipe out all of the dominant life on this planet, the whole planet can be our home. My home. All mine.

         Galg was confused. Zjok, sir, what about Fleek? Fleek is our home.

         Zjok chuckled. His face looked really stupid when he did that. Zjok

Survivors

 

            thought he was so cool. Yes, yes, I know, you silly bastard. But, look how much bigger 'Eeerth' is compared to Fleek. The air is so much cleaner, according to the image displayed here. Just imagine all the facilities, military bases, and ships we can build on this planet. Think of all the food! There are billions of life forms living on that big rock and it's not even close to being over-populated! We have the technology to give this planet the rightful owners it deserves! US!!!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         What about the Misara, sir?

         Oh, we're still retrieving it, of course, Zjok's voice getting lower and deeper. That's why I made this. He showed Galg his weapon, with the massive needle sticking out of it.

         The Steamy Vampire B-105?

         Yessssssss, Zjok replying with a snake-like voice. This is not just a weapon to kill, my friend, but bringing me my wonderful Misara back where it belongs. I have no doubt that something, or someone, has obtained the Misara's incredible powers. Like Rig, for instance. Theres still hope that the Misara has not been drank, or absorbed into one's skin. If that has happened, then we got plan B, right here: Just one shot from the Steamy Vampire B-105 and this needle will drain the blood of the victim, evaporating his blood into thin fog. If I am to shoot the one obtaining the Serum, this needle, here, will recognize the Drokensmur essence, which is used in the Misara Serum.

Chapter 9

 

            All while the victims blood is being evaporated, the syringe will also obtain the liquidity of the Serum itself.

         Galg was almost speechless. That's incredible, sir. So, once we get the Serum, with thousands of our troops alongside us, we will pretty much be unstoppable?

         Indeed, my lovely partner. Whether the Misara Serum has been obtained, or not, we ARE unstoppable. Zjok shoved a mouthful of crackers in his mouth and began to laugh his evil laugh. Galg began to laugh, too. The Mazers and Strikers laughed also, not knowing what the hell they were laughing about.

         Your majesty! Yayvox announced. He had just entered the area. We have located Preox and Rig. Well, we are not so sure, for we have only tracked Preox's Vambit signal.

         But, a Vambit can only be traced if the long-range cloaking device is offline, replied Galg. Unless--

         OH THIS IS GREAT! hollered Zjok. Our alien friends are under a conflict! Maybe some stupid, curious life form took Preoxs Vambit and got curious with it! Pathetic! Well, this will be fun. Galg, I'd like you send out Probes to planet 'Eeerth', and I'd like to see how strong the planet's defenses are, once they reach the Serums' current position. We need to see what were going to be standing up against! Oh, and send Probes to where Preox's Vambit is located. I would love to make sure that he and Rig are truly dead!

         How many do you want me to send, sir? Galg asked happily.

         Hm, as many as you want!

         OH, YAY!

          Zjok laughed devilishly. He was laughing so much, he started to drool. He didnt feel so angry, like he was before. He was happy, happy with what he was doing. Zjok was so sincerely evil, that he took it as a personal gain. Zjok was fully evil and most of the Adoa Military would question why he was. The Adoa have had a long history with the Asids (good and bad), especially long before Zjok rose to power and turn his back against the Asids. The Adoa had no idea what their new leader was capable of and they were unsure as to whether enjoy it, or be afraid at the same time.

            Galg left the area, heading toward the launch station. The Adoa were

Survivors

                                                                 

         approaching Earth within a matter of weeks, and they got an outstanding head start, thanks to the Probes. The Probes travel much faster and more efficiently than the Elephant and the Adoa's other ships. From where the Adoa was designated, the Probes could reach Earth within a matter of days.  

         The echos of Probes launching into space was heard from the four Asid prisoners. Zitkir, Kriket, and Drox were curious as to what the echoes may be. As for Bxir, showing no expression, he knew what was happening and know EXACTLY what was going to happen. The Adoa have made their first official, malicious move on their next target.

         Admiral, what is that noise? Zitkir asked, listening carefully.

         Without looking at Zitkir, Bxir replied, Dey is releasin' the Probes to wherever tha hell we're goin'. Whatever lives on tha planet we're going to, they is doomed ter die.

         Bxir, we need to get out of here, now, Zitkir whispered. Let's attract those guards over here again, and let's pummel them.

         Bxir chuckled hoarsely, Yew kiddin', son?! We're in the depths of an Adoa Armada of thousands. Tha only Asid allies I see are three, defenseless prisoners, including me. That's five, defenseless, Asid prisoners, Zitkir. We is goin' now wheres, unless we agree tah go on Zjok's side.

         Zitkir was searching for a solution, but failed. All four were completely hopeless. Drox was weak and eventually fell asleep in a corner, as Kriket also fell asleep in the other.

         Hey, Bxir finally said.

         Zitkir looked at him. Yes, Admiral?

         Why did tha cheeken cross dah road?

         Zitkir gave a soft laugh. Why?

         Tah get tew a gay man's house.

         Zitkir looked puzzled. Kriket and Drox immediately awoke with the same expressions on their faces.

         Bxir laughed. Hey, knock knock.

         Who's there? Zitkir replied.

         Bxir laughed even harder, Tha cheeken!!!

         The Asids blew laughter from their mouths, echoing the whole prison

 

Chapter 9

 

         facility.

         HEY! shouted the same Mazer guard from before. Will you please be quiet?! I'm trying to watch Family Matters!

         The Asids looked at each other, laughing even harder. Though things ultimately sucked right now, even the smallest things could cheer them up. 

Amongst the upcoming and most certainly threatening events, who could possibly uphold the terrifying Adoa? Super Jakey? Preox and Rig? Anyone can be a hero.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 10: Velouria

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         It was now five o' clock on a gorgeous Friday afternoon. The baseball field was empty, although it was soon to be filled with many baseball fans. The Kingzing High School Rattlesnakes were to face their rival, the Marsing High School Jellyfish in a great game of Americas number one sport. This weeks district baseball game was to take place at Marsing High, and will ultimately determine which team will be the fittest for the state championships. The Rattlesnakes were to take a bus to Jellyfish territory, as sports fans were to provide transport of their own. This was going to be one great night, indeed.

         School had ended for the day and all the students have successfully made it through, yet another terrifying day of learning. Holly had been on Jake's mind all day and what he and Kyle have devised together was surely going to be perfect, in terms of both winning the women of their dreams. Jake was already in his baseball gear, with the name Smithy labeled on the back of his jersey, followed by his lucky number 14. Jake had walked out of the school building, toward the bus, when Kyle hollered for his name. He was in

Chapter 10

 

            the nearby parking lot, standing next to his car, waving his skinny arm like a lifeless rag doll. Jake had the feeling that he and Kyle were becoming friends. Jake had never thought, in his life, this would be possible! Jake walked over to Kyle, with the popping sound of his cleats, smacking against the concrete.

         You pumped? Jake said with a smile. Kyle didn't smile back. You okay, man?

         Yeah, Kyle responded. Just a little nervous.

         Hey, don't worry about it! Just be yourself and dont stare at her chest. Apparently its a rude gesture, of some sort.

         It's not that I'm nervous about actually conversing with Velouria, for the first time in my life, Im nervous about Cale.

         Jake completely forgot that Velouria and his other best friend were together. Kyle was stepping into the deep side of the pool and if Cale found out about the flirtatious acts, which will be done by Kyle, towards Velouria, Kyle will surely suffer an excruciating fate.

         Jake took a deep breath. Oh, yeah. Forgot about that. Dammit. Hmm, well if anything happens, let me know alright? Just yell, or something.

         Kyle looked at him strangely. Not only Jake just admitted that he will protect Kyle, if Cale were to start a quarrel, but against Cale himself. Kyle couldn't believe how different Jake was behaving. Jake was somewhat becoming a good person; finally seeing how much an ass he and Cale have been to poor, poor Kyle. Kyle nodded with a faint smile. He, remarkably, knew he could trust Jake, who was now his ex-rival. This also proves that Jake does not take too kindly of Cale's behavior. On a more unfortunate note, Jake knew what Cale could do to Kyle, IF he so much as see him in public, other than talking to Velouria. Jake let his thought process roam his mind, as he thought about the risks that could come upon him and Kyle. He didnt want to screw over Cale, but he knew Velouria and Cale was not the best fit for her. After seeing the two in school, kissing and holding hands every now and again, Cale is an awful boyfriend. Jake was not just doing this for Kyle, but also for Velouria. When she and he dated, Jake was about as crappy as Cale was, which also raises concern about Jakes pursuit for Hollys heart. Jake had to try for Holly, and he wouldnt allow himself to give up.

Velouria

        

         Hey, Kyle finally replied, hows talking with Holly?

         Jake sighed with frustration. It sucks.

         Kyle gulped. Well, cant say I told you so.

         It's fine, Jake replied, rolling his eyes. I still got this.

         Oh really?

         Yeah, you still gonna invite her to the game?

         Yep. Or, at least, Ill try.

         Thanks, bro! I gotta go! I'll see you at the game!

         Jake bolted toward the bus, just minutes before it left. Kyle, approaching his car, dialed a few buttons on his cell phone and began calling Holly. He was completely unware of Hollys upcoming sass. However, Kyle should always see this sort of trait coming.

         Kyle, you little turd.

         Kyle's stomach sank. W-what? 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            You've been talking to Jake, like all the time now, huh? Holly replied. Her voice sounded cold and stern.      

         What the hell?! N-no of course not! W-why would I do that? He would slam me down to the ground if I was within his sight! Hes a poop.

         Holly growled. Did he force you tell him about me? Cause he's been giving me googly eyes all week! It's driving me nuts. Oh, and he somehow knows all of my favorite things! Are you sure youre not telling him all this? I know I shouldnt be asking that because its obvious you would never talk to him, you know? Im just really concerned. And I want Jake to die.

Chapter 10

 

            Jake was digging a grave for himself, and so was Kyle. Kyle, for the first time, was scared of Holly. Who knows what would happen between their friendship if she were to find out about Jake and Kyle's recent alliance? The unfortunate end of their longing friendship?! Quite the possibility.

         He hasn't bothered me since that day at the Funky Munkey. I think he's just acting like all insensitive jerks do. Hes a poop.

         He told me he liked me, Kyle, Holly said, her voice getting colder. Kyle was talking to Death, herself.

         Kyle, thankfully being a theater student, acted in a shocking manner. That fugly man! Just ignore him, then. He's a l-loser head!

         There was a long pause. A 'l-loser head?' You okay, Kyle?

         Y-yeah! I'm fine! Why you ask stupid question?! Silly Holly, thou talk'st of nothing! Anyway, want to go to the district baseball game with me, tonight at six?

         There was another long pause. Kyle, you never go to baseball games. Plus, Jake and Cale will be there.

         I-I just thought it would be fun. Being a senior and all, I thought it would be fun to spend this Friday evening with my best friend! And, if Jake starts something, you'll take care of it right? My girly, lovely, protector? Kyle felt absolutely pathetic after he had said that Holly was his girly, lovely, protector.

         I cant go, Kyle, Holly responded with a sigh. I got work tonight. Anyway, you've been acting like a weirdo. Ha, you're always a weirdo and that's why I love you. Lets do something soon, yeah? I am also sorry for calling you 'little turd.'

         Kyle spat. It's fine, Holly! I love turds.

         Holly laughed. Love you, Kyle, I'll talk to you later.

         Bye-bye. Love you too!

         Kyle hung up and sighed heavily in utter frustration. He was shaking, for he felt like he was going on some sort of secret mission. He liked Velouria a lot, even though he didnt talk to her as much he talked to Holly. It was time for him to grow some balls of steel. He has the advantage to talk to Velouria like any other normal being, all thanks to his drama class. Despite that advantage, he was scared out of his wits to, most likely, facing Cale.

            Velouria

 

            It was nearly five-thirty, once Kyle looked at the time on his car stereo. The school bus was long gone and he was just about to leave Kingzing High until he saw a face. A wonderful, beauteous face of pure angelic feats. It was Velouria, driving her 1968 Volkswagen Beetle. The beetle purred as she drove past him. Kyle stared at her in awe; she was absolutely stunning. The short, brown, and curly hair hung over the tips of her shoulders, along with the small groups of freckles on her rosy cheeks, made her flourish like a tulip. Kyle was practically drooling, and thank God Velouria did not see that. He watched her drive in the direction of where the bus had gone to Marsing High School, with a faint smile on his face. Once she was out of his sight, he then followed, desperately trying to build up as much confidence as he can before he was going to actually talk to her.

 

 

 

        

        

        

 

 

           

           

            Ever since Preox and Rig were sentenced to an untimely execution, ordered by Captain Derno, the two aliens remained in the glass cell, almost approaching the brink of their demise. Seeing the two aliens were completely useless, according to Derno, today was the day that Preox and Rig were to meet their unfortunate fate. Moosey should be happy about this, though he really wasnt because the credit he thought he deserved was not getting received. And he was depressed about it all week.

         Moosey walked on all fours, his eyes barely open. He had barely gotten any sleep, ever since he discovered Preox and Rig's existence. It was time for him to hit the hay, for once. He walked through the cold, dark facility of Area 72. Soldiers, agents, and scientists were wandering about, working on what they were supposed to be working on, whether it was research, combat

Chapter 10

        

         training, guarding doors, etc. Moosey was undeniably depressed and quiet, which was portrayed no differently than the atmosphere he was in. Everyone took their job seriously and there was rarely any moment to be goofing around. Employees laughed and chuckled silently as Moosey strode through the area. He was was laughed at for his horn, which was damaged by a ricocheting bullet, from earlier. Moosey attempted to repair it back to its original state, with duct tape. He looked absolutely ridiculous and humiliated. Moosey had no idea where his partner, Nathan, had wandered off too. He didnt care, he just wanted to get some rest.

         Moosey, who was on the verge of tears, walked by a room, which was labelled as the Camera Room. The door opened and out came an average sized, six-foot tall agent.

         Oh! the agent exclaimed. Thank goodness you're here, Agent Moosey17.

         Something the matter, Agent Eugene7? Moosey asked, perking his head up, revealing his watery eyes.

         Yeah! I gotta go potty pretty badly. Can you keep an eye on the cameras for me?! I promise I'll be right back, buddy.

         Moosey sighed. Alright. I got nothing else better to do, anyway.

         Moosey watched Eugene sprint to the bathroom, followed by the whimpering noise of anxiety, desperately holding his bladder. Moosey walked into the room, which was full of monitors, alongside the wall. Each room had approximately 120 camera monitors viewing from certain angles of the secret military base. Moosey couldn't help but notice that the monitors of this room viewed all images from the research facility. He could see Preox and Rig in their glass containment from cameras 21, 39, and 42, from three different angles. Moosey stared at the two, lonely aliens (The scientists must have finished their research for the day.), with Preox sitting alone, as Rig watched the television.      

         Curious enough, Moosey took control of camera 21 and zoomed in on Preox. Moosey, full of anger, still believed that he and Rig were the most dangerous discoveries Area 72 had ever collected. If Moosey was going to be happy about anything, it would be the death of Preox and Rig. Mostly Preox.

         How about you zoom in more to get a better look at my face?

            Velouria

 

            Moosey jumped in fear. It was Preox's voice that he heard! The alien must have known Moosey was getting a closer look on him with the camera

         Moosey spoke into the mic. Um, what?

         I'm talking to you, you mindless creep, Preox replied. Moosey was utterly frightened. He was talking to a real alien being. He didn't know what to do. His hatred towards Preox was now with a minor sense of fear.

         What do you want from us? Moosey asked.

         The Asid stood up, his green naked body reflecting the lights shining down on him, staring at the camera. Rig was still sitting in his place, minding his own business, not taking notice of what was going on.

         If you incompetent crabs haven't have drugged me, then you would have found out long ago. If I wasn't drugged, let alone captured, you wouldn't have to worry about a damned thing.

         Moosey gulped. I—What? What do you mean by worry?

         Preox sighed and began pacing back and forth. Moosey began to worry immediately, whereas the alien remained calm.

         Your researchers have something of mine. Something very important. My Vambit. I would like to collect it, please.

         A V-Vambit?

         Yes. The red thing you saw attached to my back when you first confronted Rig and I.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                         

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 10

 

         Moosey took a deep breath. Yes. What about it? It's dangerous?

         Preox nodded firmly. Oh hell yeah it is. You witnessed it yourself. All of my kind has one. It runs on typical lemonade, consists of two auto turrets that shoot deadly fiery bullets, and a jet pack. Not only that, it can track down objects and call for transmissions.  Your researchers have probably fixed the damages, after you guys took us. As we speak, they must have done something they will soon regret.

         Moosey gulped, loud enough for Preox to hear. Agent Eugene7 came back into the room.

         Woo! Cafeteria food, I swear. Hey, what're you up to, Moosey?

         Hello, foolish muskrat, Preox replied.

         Eugene's heart sank, just as deep as Moosey's. Um—Hi, alien?

         Moosey butted back into the main subject. What do you mean?! What would our scientists do that they would regret?

         Preox chuckled for the first time ever. So that's what your researchers are called. Once they turn off the long-range cloaking device on my Vambit, due to certain curiosity of research, the Adoa will be able to track us down and give us a little company.

         Eugene was flipping out. What? The Adoa? Vambit!? Moosey what's going on?!

         So you're not here to kill us all, then? Moosey said frantically.

         You're not even worth my time! Preox shouted in anger. We were minding our damn business, until you idiots came and ruined everything with your fancy blue vehicles! Now that you curious jackasses have access to MY armor, my Vambit, and Rig's bleedin' electric stem, were definitely screwed! Regardless, I might add, we are screwed! You don't even know who and what you're dealing with. Its too late.

         Yeah! Rig randomly hollered.

         I-I gotta go stop the scientists, Moosey said.

         HA! Preox shouted. It's way too late for that, now. You guys have dug a grave in an enormous pile of goat feces!

         Eugene hesitated and spoke. What's gonna happen?!

         The Adoa wants us dead. We stole something from them that should never have been created. Now that they can track my Vambit (most likely),

 

Velouria

           

            they would have sent in their Probes, by now. They can travel faster than any typical ship we have, other than light-speed of course. Once they reach our location, all hell breaks loose. And, if you don't believe me, then adios amigos because we're all dead. Thats if you dont let us out of here, now. Unfortunately, your Captain Derno will not believe anything I say.

         Well, we can just blow these 'Probes' out of the sky before they reach us right? Clarke asked.

         As unlikely as this may sound to you, Preox said, you can't. The Adoa have the technological ability to have cloaking devices, also (similar to my Vambit), and they're untraceable. You need to let us out!

         Moosey was not so sure about anything being untraceable from rador. Nothing can be untraceable from Area 72, according to his knowledge. It was impossible. But, he was still curious about this whole Adoa ordeal. However, Moosey did not allow himself to risk letting Preox and Rig free, as he still firmly believed that they were dangerous and untrustworthy.

         If they do come, the Probes I mean, Moosey replied, we can take them out ourselves. He switched off the mic.

         WHAT!? Preox angrily yelled, as he was muted. YOU STUPID MOOSEY PIECE OF CRAP! YOURE GOING TO KILL US ALL!

         Moosey turned to Eugene slowly. Agent Eugene7, I want you to report this to the Captain. Im not going to let the aliens out, but I believe the Captain needs to hear of this. Can you do that for me, Agent?

         Eugene nodded in obedience. He was quite nervous, hearing about Preox's notification. Eugene was nervous. What if were not capable of defending ourselves against foreign (and maybe advanced) technology?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 10

 

Marsing High School: Home of the Armadillos

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

         Jake felt a little sick to his stomach once he took that first step off the school bus, with the rest of the baseball team. He came to realize that he wasn't sick, but that he was full of affection; He was excited to see Holly, hopefully. As he walked, having a good conversation with Cale Omnous, Hayson Prent, and other baseball players, Jake noticed the Marsing team sitting in their dugout. Their coach was yelling at them, pointing his clip board in the direction of Jake. The coach must know about Jake's greatness, for Jake's coach always loved to brag about his players.

         Alright, ladies, Jake's coach Neilberg Sleeve announced, we are gonna kick some butt out there, right?!The team cheered like a bunch of barbarians, especially Jake. Good! But, hey, even if we lose, at least we made it to districts right? Right? We played great this year, with Cale's fast pace, Hayson's awesome throwing, Gary's outstanding back flips, and Jake's amazing batting. This is probably the best team I've had since 'Nam. So, if we lose, that's alright. It suddenly became very quiet in the dugout. Coach Sleeve grinned. I'm full of crap, if you guys don't win then it's fifty laps around the track for you guys! Now, let's get out there and play some ball!!

Velouria

 

            The Kingzing Rattlesnakes cheered once again with a steady, yet nervous, attitude. It was five minutes before the first pitch was to be thrown. Things were about to get intense.

         Jake sat next to Cale, who was adjusting his baseball cap. Hey, man.

         Cale was frustrated, as he tried desperately to adjust the head size on his cap. He seemed to have no clue how to do so. As he struggled even more, Jake took the cap from him and adjusted it to fit his stupid head.

         Ugh, thanks bro, Cale said with a sigh of relief, placing the cap on his head. Those caps are very not cool.

         I noticed, Jake said with a laugh. He noticed Cale was not keeping eye contact with him, for he was keeping his eye on someone else. It was Velouria, who had just shown up for the game. Cale stuck his arm in the air and flailed like an excited, young orphan. She waved back with a faint smile. Jake couldn't help but barely gag at this sight.

         How—how are you two? You and her? Jake asked curiously.

         Who, me and Vel'?

         No, you and your grandma.

         Cale laughed. We're good! We already made out three times, so I think we're off to a pretty good start!! She has an amazing body, dude.

         Jake forced a laugh out of his sarcastic mouth. Wow! That's awesome, buddy-boy.  

         Hell yeah, Cale replied, raising his eyebrows up and down. She's a nice piece of meat, ya know what I mean? Huh? Cale laughed, elbowing Jake in the side gently.

         In his mind, Jake couldn't help but give Cale the best criticism. You're an idiot. Then, the sports announcer's voice came into the ears of his and many others.

         Alright, ladies and gents, welcome to the High school district baseball game of 2005! Here we have two arch rivals: The Marsing Jellyfish VERSUS The Kingzing Rattlesnakes. We are in for a great game tonight, folks. We are gonna have Jellyfish up to bat first, as the Rattlesnakes will get into the field.

        

         As everyone got into position, for the game was about to start, Kyle had

Chapter 10

 

         finally shown up. He was anxious, once he began looking for Velouria. He went up to the snack station and got a bag of popcorn to help ease his mood. He loved popcorn more than anything. He continued searching for Velouria, when he finally saw her sitting by herself. He was ready to talk to her, for once in his pathetic life. He made his way up the seats, getting closer to Velouria. She turned around, noticing Kyle, who had a goofy smile on his face.

         Hey, Velouria! How goes it—OOF!

         He had tripped on someone's leg and totally biffed it, spilling his popcorn everywhere.

         Oh damn! My food! Stupid kid! yelled an angry audience member, as Kyle struggled to get up.

         Are you okay? Velouria said with a smile. It wasnt faint.

         Yeah! Kyle hollered right away, ignoring the pain in his abdomen.  Yeah, yeah, I'm good! I'm wonderful, actually. I was saying hi t-to that cr-crow over therrre-- he looked happy. Do you like crows? Kyle was on the verge of vomiting from all the butterflies in his tummy.

         Velouria made an awkward look and laughed a bit. I-I never really thought of that. But, yeah I guess so!

         Yeah! Kyle smiled, agreeing. They're pretty cool. I just never really see any—OKAY, anyway, how're you doing, Velouria?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Velouria

 

            Velouria let out another laugh. I'm good. How about you? It's been awhile since we've actually talked.

         Kyle put on a goofy look. Right?! It's been so long! And, I'm pretty good, I guess. After all, I just spilled all my popcorn.

         Damn right you did, replied the angry audience member, Kyle ignored him.

         So, you're here by yourself? Kyle asked. Velouria nodded. Mind if I gave you some company as we watch the game?

         Velouria was about to answer when the sports announcer began announcing some more. Alright, ladies and gents, we're in the first inning and first up to bat is number 76, Kramer Geralds. Let the game begin!

         Hayson Prent stood in the middle of the field, ready to throw the first pitch of the game. His eyes didn't blink for a second as he concentrated on the first batter. He shook his head a few times, as the catcher gave him finger signals, and threw the batter a screw ball. The sound of the ball smacking against the bat went off. Jake, who was in the outfield, saw that ball zip past Hays. He ran toward the ball, remarkably faster than anyone else, and caught the ball in his mitt before it would have touched the ground. The audience roared with cheers as the batter, realizing he was out, stood there scratching his head. There was no way any other player could have caught that ball. Cale hollered from second base, giving Jake a thumbs up. As for coach Sleeve, he looked like he just crapped himself from happiness.

         Damn, did you see that? Velouria said happily. Jake has gotten frickin' amazing this year.

         Yeah, Kyle said with a nervous chuckle. He looked down, not at Velouria's chest, and desperately searched his head for something to talk about. Velouria was so gorgeous, Kyle thought of her as a princess. On a similar note, referring to princesses and beauty, Kyle had finally came up with a subject to discuss about. Hey, Im in the school play!

         Velouria smiled. I love Princess Bride. Thats so cool! Wow!

         Kyle cleared his throat a bit, sticking his chest up. Well, I happen to be Inigo Montoya in the play, not meaning to brag.

         Really? Ah, thats wonderful! Youll do great as him, Kyle. Wanna give me a sneak preview of your character?

Chapter 10

 

            Kyle looked up at the sky, thanked the Lord Almighty, and went back to talking with Velouria, as the game progressed.

Meanwhile. . . Again.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Rig sat in the middle of the floor, whistling along the elevator music that echoed through whole facility. The only lights that illuminated were the ones above the two aliens' heads and above the old alien craft, about a hundred yards away. Preox leaned forward against the glass containment, sleeping and full of anger. All he could think about were the Probes, for they could be on this planet any minute, now.  Preox and Rig were in the same position as Bxir, Kriket, Zitkir, and Drox were in: Preox couldn't call for help and he had no Vambit, weapons, or armor. And if he were to call in for help, anyway, the Adoa would probably have taken over Earth before any reinforcements would show up. Not only that, the only light-speed ship ever made was completely obliterated. There's no way in Hell Preox or Rig could get out of this, unless the humans would get the hint that they were in insane danger.

         Over the intercom, a voice came through in their glass containment. Okay, uglies, shower time! Little sprinklers erupted from the white, clean

 

Velouria

 

         floor and sprayed directly upon Preox and Rig. Rig faced the water and tried to eat it like a dog, whereas Preox just stood there, not moving.

         Preox come play, Rig said happily. We're never getting out of here anyway so come play with me!!

         Preox looked at the annoying thing and shook his head. He was too angry to maul the Aziquet. Then, he heard people talking in the distance as the sprinkler continued to spray him. All, except Eugene, laughed like critical English men, waiting to hear more complete nonsense from Preox.

         Yes, I do have a complaint, Preox replied. You jack-knobs are in serious jeopardy.

         Hehehehe, that's exactly what he was talking about last time! Through the camera! Moosey laughed, followed by other outrageously obnoxious laughs. Captain Derno was the only one who kept his laughs in neutral.

         Was I talking to you? Preox snapped, shooting a stern look at the moose. The agents laughed even harder, except Eugene.

         through the echoes of the facility. The agents stopped laughing immediately, once some electrics were powering down.
