         Cale, in his stupid head, thought Jake was taking his side, and gave a little smirk.

         Hey, Jake, how about we teach this girl a little lesson? Bitches never change, unless theyre forced to. Velouria was shaking her head no, tears bursting out from her eyes. Jake couldn't believe what was happening. Even he would never pull a stunt as sick as what Cale was doing. Even if he was still victimizing Kyle.

         Jake took a few steps ahead of Cale, facing him and his back turned to Velouria. I say that's a good idea, Cale!

         Then move out of my way? Cale said with a confused look. That's when Jake high-kicked him in the stomach, causing him to fly several inches off the ground and landing on the hard concrete.

         Velouria rushed over to Kyle and knelt down beside him, as Jake stood his ground, his adrenaline beginning to take control.

         Dude! Cale gasped. What the hell, man?! That really hurt! And since when were you a cheer leader?!

         Cale, just stay away from Kyle and Velouria, Jake said in a calmly matter. Velourias had enough, and so has he.

         Cale stumbled a bit as he got up, moving his jaw from side to side.

Chapter 10

 

            This doesnt mean you can kick me! Wait, don't tell me you--. He looked at Kyle, Velouria, and then to Jake. Oh, so you guys are all buddies, now?! Don't make me take you down, Jake. This is my business, not yours!

         This was no one's business to begin with, Velouria said, becoming calmer, as she helped Kyle up. He was brutally injured.

         Youre right, Velouria, this is my fault, Jake said, still making eye contact with Cale. I'm sorry, Kyle. Kyle gave a weak thumbs up and Velouria began to realize what was really going on. She remembered, earlier in the morning, Jake mentioning the fact that Kyle really liked her. She smiled weakly, but didn't say a word, as she held onto Kyle's arm.

         Cale breathed angrily and started running to Velouria. Jake, being much faster, tackled Cale like a football player full of testosterone. Cale elbowed Jake in the stomach before he could pin him down. Jake didn't budge, thanks to his powerful stability. Jake thought Cale was finally down, until the fact that he spat straight into Jake's eye. Jake gasped in terror, giving Cale the chance to squirm away from him. They both stood up, facing each other, once again.

         Dude, that's gross! EEEWW! Dah fuh!

         Cale punched him square in the nose, causing Jake to stumble a bit. Now Jake was pissed and he swung a swift upper cut against Cale's boney chin. The hit was so powerful, it landed Cale head first onto the concrete, giving him a bit of a concussion. Cale moaned in pain, indicating he was finished.

         What the hell is going on here?! came another voice. Jake's stomach sunk, realizing that was coach Sleeve.

         Hiya, coach, Jake said innocently. The coach looked around at the scene, as Jake came up with a little lie. Coach, we were just--.

         Don't gimme any of that! Sleeve shouted. I saw the whole damn fight! After I have started looking for you two, the game had started back up, again! Now that I've seen two of my own team members beating the hell outta each other for whatever, I can't help but suspend the rest of you for the rest of the season! Cale gave out a soft moan and began to cry, whether it was the pain done by Jake, or the fact that he was suspended from playing any future baseball games.

Velouria

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Coach, Jake said, as he, too, was about to cry, you can't do this.

         Oh, the hell I can! I'm letting the school know about this, first thing tomorrow! Happy Friday, boys! Getcher stuff an' get out!

         The coach stormed off. Jake took off his baseball cap and scratched his head in frustration. Then, Holly's car pulled up into the parking lot. From what it looked like, Jake was in the deepest pile of poop.

         Holly came with her fists clenched. Her face expressed pure anger and it was quite intimidating. Jake! What'd you do this time?!

            Before Jake could explain what happened, Holly took a hard swing against his hip with her fist. Her punches seemed to be much more ferocious than Cales. Jake screamed in pain.

         Holly stop! Stop it! Kyle shouted, limping toward her, holding onto his beaten stomach.

         Yeah! Stop it!! Jake agreed.

         Kyle, what?

         Jake already beat you to the fighting part, Kyle responded.

         Holly raised an eye brow. Kyle, did Jake and Cale make you stupid? Cause I can do worse than that to them.

         Damn, this girl sure has attitude, Jake thought to himself, adoring Holly's independence. Kyle, finally having the strength to stand up straight, explained the whole ordeal about what had happened since the baseball game had started.

Chapter 10

 

            Holly lowered her fists and hugged Kyle tightly. Kyle screamed in pain as her hugging put negative pressure on his wounds. Holly let go of him, who appeared to look astounded. She looked down at Cale, who was continuously moaning in agony. Wow, Kyle. You punched that sorry S.O.B.?

         He sure did, Velouria said nervously.

         Look, Holly said, touching up Kyles wounds by wiping blood off his face. Let's go to the Funky Munkey, get some coffee, and just have a good time, okay? Ill get you all patched up, too. You can watch my band play, also. I post-poned everything after you called me.

         Oh, Holly, you didn't have to do that, Kyle said with a chuckle. Jake was really excited now. Not only Holly could kick ass, but she played in a band from the sound of it!

         Anything for my best friend, Holly said happily. 

         Kyle smiled and nodded. Okay, let's go. Velouria, you wanna come?

         Velouria sighed, hesitating. She responded with a white lie, for she had different, better intentions.  I can't. I have to go home and, uh, study.

         Kyle made a sad look. Alright. Look, Holly, Im not gonna go, actually. Im gonna go home and rest.

         Holly frowned. Alright, buddy. Hang tight, okay?

         Thank you, Kyle replied. Good luck on your gig tonight, Holly. Maybe Jaaaake could watch you? He did kind of save my ass, after all.

         Kyle winked at her and Holly grew extremely nervous, as she turned to face Jake. His face was completely lit up.

         You wanna come watch? Holly asked him generously. I mean, you did save Kyle, before I could, oddly enough. Jake nodded happily like a cartoon dog. And thanks, Jake. Thanks for helping out Kyle, I-I suppose.

         Jake began to act cool. Hey, no problem, home slice. Let me just go get my stuff.

         Cale grunted and laughed hoarsely. Y-you're s-so whipped.

         Holly, making an angry expression, kicked Cale in the stomach. He squealed in pain.

         Jake's night was turning out a lot better than he thought! After a long, ridiculous day, Jake can now spend it in happiness. What else could go wrong?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Part 3:

Evil

Stuff!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Chapter 11: The Nasty Pen

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

A very long day, indeed, was finally drawing to a close. A lot has happened on this particular day. Other survivors were found, shortly after the Probe invasion, just hours ago and Preox confidently took over, as the leader of the newly formulated group of survivors, for he was the only one who really knew what the hell was going on. Parts of Area 72 were critically damaged, especially the hangar. That place was no longer intact for any means, necessary.

         Captain Derno, his posture at its best, with his uniform burnt and torn, discussed with the president of the United States over his cellular device, in the hopes of further assistance.

         ...Approximately 20:30 was when they attacked, Mr. President.

         The president, whose name is unmentioned, sounded whiny and full of complaints and Captain Derno, personally, didnt like talking to him. When it came to robots attacking Area 72, however, calling the president of the United States seems like the most necessary act. Derno found it unnecessary that the president decided to eat fried chicken during their important talk.

Chapter 11

 

            Well, that's just wonderful, the President replied. Now, I got another issue to deal with. First, I got the credit bubble, then, there's my wife who physically, right over my face, laid the biggest--.

         Do you not realize what's going on, Mr. President?  Nobody has time for your wife! Derno said, pacing back and forth, staring off into the night sky. Behind him there were the surviving scientists, agents, and marines getting themselves situated. Derno couldn't help but notice scientist women swoon over Rig, for some odd reason. The sight shocked him.

         Secrets are stupid, the President sighed with frustration. It makes me feel like I'm in high school again.

 

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         In all honesty, Derno replied, I really don't care, Mr. President. Just get some help here, as soon as possible, alright?

         The President scoffed. He really didn't appreciate being talked to like that. Fine. He hung up, leaving Derno a bit dumb-founded.

         What'd your pathetic leader discuss? Preox asked, who happened to be behind Derno.

         He's sending in back up, I think.

         Good. Well, on another note, we found an aircraft still intact. Its damaged, but it will be up and running, after I have worked on it.

         They began to walk, side-by-side to the large crowd of survivors.       Really now?

The Nasty Pen

 

         Yes. It's that old space-craft you humans have kept for many of your Earth years. It's an old fighter, which belonged to the Asids, to be exact. Remarkable! Especially how it ended up on this spinning ball of poop. I wonder how.

         Once they approached the small crowd of people, Moosey found his way to them. Captain! Sir! Where is Agent Nathan12?! I can't find him anywhere.

         Derno, at first, had no clue what the hopeless animal was talking about, until it hit him. It was true, of course, that Nathan had not been heard from for a number of hours and he was not present during the Probe invasion. Oh, yes, I forgot I sent him on a mission near the coast of Oregon.

         Moosey looked extremely puzzled, as he avoided eye contact with Preox. W-why'd you do that, sir?

         Before those robot things attacked our base, I sent our lovely Agent Nathan12 to go undercover in the urban city of Kingzing, due to some recent disturbances. Wow, I cant believe I forgot about that.

         The name Kingzing impacted Preox's mind like a rock hitting a defenseless duck in the face. The name sounded so familiar!

         What happened in Kingzing? Moosey asked.

         A special news report ran over the media about a teenage kid beating the tar out of two local criminals. They were twice his size. He not only beat them, but managed to lift one of them over his head. The criminal weighs approximately 275 pounds and the kid was able to slam him against the hood of his vehicle.

         You sent Nathan away to spy on a kid who beat up two people? Moosey said, still puzzled.

         There has been a countless reports of red, yet static, explosions occurring throughout the city, Derno replied. Preox gasped. Could these reports possibly have something to do with the Misara Serum? Not only that, there was a fight in the middle of the city between a mysterious masked man and a seriously disturbing mutant. The masked man was seen flying in the air, creating sonic booms, and shooting blue flashes of light from his elbows. Weird, right? Moosey stood there, completely confused. He thought this was impossible, as Preox knew it wasn't. 

Chapter 11

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

              This was all over your human media? Preox asked, his voice was higher and concerned.

         Affirmative. All over CNN, MSN, Cartoon Network, you name it, Derno nodded with absolution. This all happened almost two weeks ago. They call the masked man, Super Jakey. Pretty catchy, ain't it? Anyway, I sent Nathan down there, with a group of other agents, to observe any more activity. If anything out of the ordinary occurs, the A72A has to contain it before anything catastrophic could happen. I hope this also explains why you and Rig are here, in the first place. We sought you as a threat and we had to contain that threat. I hope you can respect that, although we were quite mistaken.

         Preox, deep inside, grew more frustrated than ever. Yeah. Quite. The Misara Serum had begun to affect the world. He and Rig had to get the Serum now and fast. We have to get that air craft up and running, as soon as possible, Preox declared and left Moosey and Derno. Rig, get your teal ass over here! Stop letting those females touch you! That's disgusting!

         Derno raised an eye brow. Damn, he's really persistent.

         Got that right, Moosey agreed. I'm really hungry. We should just

eat.

         I second that. Let's go see if the cafeteria still has any food.

            Kingzing City. Dark alley way.

The only source of light only came from street lights, cars, and buildings, as

The Nasty Pen

 

            darkness roamed over Kingzing City. Streets were busy, everyone was going ready to wrap up a good, well-productive day with a good nights rest. It had been about a half hour since the incident which occurred with Velouria, Kyle, Holly, Jake, and Cale. Jake couldn't be more bummed out in his life because not only he was unable to play in the baseball championships, but he was running late for something extremely mandatory. As mentioned before, Jake was invited to visit Holly at the Funky Munkey Cafe, thanks to his heroism in defending Velouria and a helpless Kyle. Jake believed he was visiting Holly in terms of hanging out, but he didnt realize he was getting his hopes up too high. Holly may have invited her to her concert, but she never said she would hang out with him. Anyway, why was Jake running late? Well, as Jake was following Holly to the Funky Munkey, a distraction immediately caught the attention of his eyes, as he drove through the busy streets of Kingzing City. As distracting as this distraction had become, it was time to bring Super Jakey into play.

         The woman was in her mid-twenties. She was tall and beautiful. Her skin was flawless, like a perfectly roasted marshmallow. As for the four druggies following her, they looked exactly the opposite.

         Hey, babe. Where'd you get that skanky dress? Skank Express?

         The woman was scared. Her walking pace picked up, and so did the druggies. As if this situation couldnt be any more clich. Yeah! hollered a second druggie, following her. How about you show us what's under there, huh? The first druggie sped up to her and stood in front of her. She tried to get around him, but he pushed her back, with the other druggies blocking the other direction.

         Where do you think you're going, pretty little lady? The street was almost empty. There was no one around to witness this.

         Just leave me alone, please? the woman pleaded. The druggies couldn't help but laugh. They're laughs were hoarse and cracked, thanks to their frequent uses of meth. The lead druggie pulled out a dagger and pushed the poor woman into a nearby alley way. He pushed her again, the others still laughing, and she fell against a dumpster. The druggie held a rusted pair of scissors at her.

         Take 'em off, pretty lady. You wanna see what a real man can do?

Chapter 11

        

         The woman began to cry as she began to lower her bra straps.

         Aw, don't cry, pretty lady, the druggie whispered again, forcing the

woman to lay down on garbage bags. His scissors sharp end faintly touched her neck. The other druggies stood there and laughed. Wanna see what a real man can do? There was a loud scream, followed by a thud, which was heard from the pervert's ear. It didn't come from the woman, but from one of the other druggies. The lead druggie stood up and quickly turned to see Super Jakey, leaning against the wall casually, with an unconscious druggie sprawled on the ground. The woman curled in a ball, shaking in fear. The other druggies didn't hesitate to wield their weapons, which were guns.

         Another alley way? Really?! Do show me, Super Jakey said with a chuckle, show me what a 'real' man can do. I'd sure love to see it. I could smell your piss-stained clothes from a mile away. Good thing too, 'cause I was about to miss my cue for this little show.

         Get out of here, pajama boy, the lead druggie replied, his dagger pointing at him. This isn't any of your business.

         Shut up, you fat loaf, Super Jakey replied with a sincere laugh. You pathetic, piece of no one.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

         For Jake, it felt really good to use his bullying skills against felons, instead of Kyle. He felt good, a little too good. 

 

The Nasty Pen

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Shoot him, the leader said without hesitation. A druggie fired, a duo of bullets hitting Super Jakey in the stomach. The defenseless woman screamed with sheer terror. The masked hero was caught by surprise, indeed. The sound of the gun shots rang in his ear, along with incredible pain. He couldn't believe it.

         OW! Jesus! Did you just--?! OW! He felt his cold blood ooze from the wound. Miraculously, the bullets slowly disintegrated inside his body, his entire body building up with more testosterone. The wound on Super Jakey's stomach was fully healed, leaving the druggies speechless. Super Jakey kept a stern look on his face as he slowly walked toward the villains. The bad guys opened fire on Super Jakey, bullets hitting him. Blood spilled, no fatality taking place.

         Stop pissing me off! Super Jakey hollered as he took a thug by his long dirty hair and slammed him onto the ground. The other druggie attempted to hit the hero with the butt of his revolver, but Super Jakey had already kicked him to the curb before he could. The lead druggie began to make a run for it, leaving the alley way. Super Jakey took off into the air and soared over the running criminal. He laughed as he began to swoop down on the attempted rapist. The criminal had never been so scared in his life at the sight of Super Jakey. The hero landed right on his shoulders and began to holler like a cow boy. WEEWW! Let's go little doggy! YEE HAW!

         The druggie tried to get him off his shoulders by cutting him with the dagger. Super Jakey hopped off and socked the druggie several times in the face, before pinning him against the wall by holding him by the shirt.

Chapter 11

 

            Super Jakey pointed his elbow at the defenseless druggie, with a red, blinding light on the tip of it. He was ready to blast the bastard's brains out.

         You have any idea what this can do to you? Super Jakey asked him, now holding the druggie by the throat. The druggie coughed, unable to breathe. He didn't respond to Super Jakey's question. It will blow your mind, buddy-boy! Just then, a local police car came zooming by, blaring its mighty sirens of justice. Super Jakey smiled and patted the druggie on the cheek. Hey, looks like you're going home.

         The police car stopped, followed by an officer exiting the drivers' seat.  He approached Super Jakey casually.

         Hey, you that 'Super Jacey,' feller, ain'tcha? Officer Axtman asked.

         Jakey, the hero replied, dropping the lead druggie on the ground. He tried crawling away, but Super Jakey had kicked him in the gut before he could go any further. It's Super Jakey, officer. Anyway, my little buddy here, he has been pretty naughty this evening.

         Oh has he? Axtman replied.

         Indeed. There are others in the alley way. Oh, and a woman, whom they tried to – to, like, hurt really badly.

         Officer Axtman nodded. That's what the report said: that a rape was about to be taken place.

         Super Jakey snapped his fingers. Got it in one, sir.

         Officer Axtman looked at him. What'd you say?

         'Sir?'

         The officer looked like he was about to cry. No one e-ever calls me that anymore.

         Super Jakey raised an eyebrow. So?

         You're right, wiping a tear away, it's stupid. Anyway, I--.

         The woman, the victim, had ran out from the alley way and gave Super Jakey a giant hug. Thank you! Thank you so much! I can't believe it.

         Yeah, you gotta be more careful, miss, Super Jakey laughed, which was not necessary at all. His entirely cocky attitude throughout this scenario was completely unnecessary.

         I can't believe I got to see you kick ass LITERALLY five feet away from me! the woman hollered excitingly. She ran off, calling her friend,

The Nasty Pen

 

            to tell how she almost got raped and that Super Jakey took about fifteen rounds from pure gunfire! Super Jakey and Officer Axtman stood there, their heads tilted to the side.

         She's gonna be okay, Super Jakey said finally.

         Officer Axtman noticed Super Jakey's bloody new look and asked, You gonna be okay there, sport?

         Super Jakey looked at his stained t-shirt and grunted. Yeah, ugh, I guess. They ruined my lucky shirt. Do you happen to have an extra?

         Yes I do. Do you like Santa Cruz?

         Super Jakey spat and laughed. Who doesn't?!

 

         Jake was back to himself again, he got in his parked truck, and drove off. That's when he remembered something. He opened his glove compartment, and there lay the pistol he stole from the previous druggie he had encountered. He felt cool to have a gun, especially when it he didnt have a license to carry one. In a Super Jakey sense, however, rules did not apply. He wasn't gonna worry about it for now. He closed the glove compartment, and continued to drive to the Funky Munkey Cafe, in a most pleasant mood.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

                                  

                                                                                                                                             

 

 

Meanwhile!!

         Kyle sat in his room with obnoxious bruises on his face. He felt

 

Chapter 11

 

          weary, especially after he got the snot beat out of him. Studying his script in this condition did not stop him from practicing his performance for the school play, as well as studying for any other courses. He had told his mother and father a lie about his beaten face, that he had slipped and fell when he was just released from school. And they totally bought it. 

         Kyle's room was somewhat big, not the average-sized, unlike any other bedroom that a teenager would have. His walls were filled with posters and other things that have to do with Drama and his other interests. As he listened to his vinyl records and mulled over his notes, Kyle received a slight knocking on his bedroom door. The door slowly opened, revealing Kyle's two loving parents, Joanne and Stephen.

         Hey, Stephen said, your mother and I decided to have a night out together. That's right, your mother and I will be going on a date, for the first time in forever!

         Yes, it'll be just like magic, Joanne replied sarcastically. She didn't sound like she was in the best of moods.

         Are you still upset about that? Stephen asked with a long, dragging sigh.

         Kyle did not understand what the hell they were talking about. W-what happened? His voice was still a bit hoarse, due to the many blows to the stomach from Cale Omnous.

         Stephen laughed. I scared the crap out of your mother when she got out of the shower! I went down to the pantry, took the broom, and--.

         Okay, Stephen, shut up. I don't think he wants to hear the rest, he has some studying to do.

         Stephen continued chuckling until his wife elbowed him in the stomach. That's when Kyle started laughing. He loved his parents more than anything else. Well, you two have fun.

         Don't be smoking your hookah, Stephen said, with deep concern and assumption. Kyle was all alone in the house, jamming out to Velvet Underground on his fancy-ass record player. As boring as studying seemed to everyone, Kyle always gave the impression of making it exhilarating. As he pranced around his room, he read a Statistic problem in a most upbeat tone. A tone of which would help him remember his studies in a detailed manner.

The Nasty Pen

 

            'The average number of absences for men is 15, with a standard deviation of 7, for women it's 12 and 6!' Woop-dee flippin' do. Another twenty minutes passed by, before Kyle heard the most annoying noise ever heard: The doorbell. He hastily made it down the stairs of the exquisite home and answered the door. Once he did, he felt like someone had kicked him in the face, once again, though it was a kind of kick that felt good. Very good. Velouria was standing at the front porch, with a smile on her face, revealing her tiny dimples.

         Hey, she said, finally breaking the silence between the two.

         H-hello, Kyle replied, sticking out his arm to shake her hand. They shook, followed by small giggles. Could he be dreaming?

         The first thing Kyle said after that was, How'd you find my house?

         Velouria laughed. I usually see you sitting on the roof of your house when I'm driving home from work.

         Kyle's heart sunk. This was certainly too good to be true! Not only Velouria showed up to his house like a creepy stalker, but she also lived nearby! How convenient! Um, do you need anything?

         Yeah, I do actually. I just wanted to say how sorry I am. I feel worse, seeing your fancy bruises.

         Kyle scoffed, Don't worry. I can't feel a thing. Literally. He couldn't feel a thing. Do y-you, uh... Kyle continued stuttering until Velouria finally finished for him.

         ...want me to come in? Kyle snapped his fingers in approval, making Velouria giggle some more.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 11

 

            Jake was excited, so excited that he almost hit a dog on his way to the Funky Munkey Cafe. Super Jakey was all over the news, once again, after his recent rescue of a damsel in distress. Not only excited, but it also made Jake extremely cautious of what was yet to come. He had to be more prepared when it came to sudden situations like that. For instance, if that Evil Nacho dude were to return again and try to spit in his face.

          Jake parked his pick-up truck (His windshield no longer damaged from before.) to the side of the road when he made it to the Funky Munkey. Then, he put on his cape, wore his jacket over it, stuffed his mask in his pocket, and hid his pistol (From the glove compartment.) in his jacket pocket. Not only way this extremely illegal, at least Jake was well-aware of what could happen.

         The Funky Munkey Caf looked extremely busy. Judging from the outside, it was absolutely packed on the inside. Jake had nearly forgotten that he was there to see Holly's band perform, before he noticed a large collection of posters hung on the outside wall. It labeled: The Funky Munkey presents... THE NASTY PEN! Performing Monday, March 23rd – Friday, March 27th @ 7:30pm. Be there, or be stupid. Featuring... Olivia Moors on acoustic guitar, Zamie Green on Drums, Cody Gadomski on bass, Greggory Stanley on piano, and Holly Ransfield on lead guitar/vocals. Admin: $3.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The Nasty Pen

 

            He proceeded into the Cafe, and everyone seemed to be having a good time, besides the fact that Jake felt extremely uncomfortable, for some reason. Almost everyone in the Cafe had a different style of clothing. There were Converse shoes, skinny jeans, scarves, cardigans, and flannels, even tu-tus, all worn upon those who happened to be at the Funky Munkey. There were many people like this at Kingzing High School, but Jake had never felt so left out, considering he was probably the only one wearing his Lettermans jacket. Anyone could guess that he now felt like an outcast for the first time. He found his way to the front register, where all the drinks and snacks were sold. A tall, gorgeous young woman stood before him.

         Hey, welcome to the Funky Munkey Cafe, my name is Alexa, as you can see on this pretty convincing name tag. How may I be of service?

         Jake selected immediately, I will just have a caramel cappuccino.

         You sure?

         Yes?

         Alexa stared at him for a blank moment. Have you ever tried it with a banana?

         What?

         Alexa looked around, hoping no one would hear. Have you ever tried the caramel cappuccino with a banana?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Jake rose an eyebrow. No?

         Alexa pounded her fist on the counter with frustration. You must be

 new here, I shoulda known. I won't let anyone know. I'll add the banana for

Chapter 11

 

            free, alright? With extra whipped cream?

         Jake sighed. Yeah, sure. I mean, I've been here before.

         Alexa smiled happily and made Jake's beverage and Jake had never felt so awkward in his life. Alexa came back and set his banana cappuccino on the counter, looking quite proud of her creation.

         Alright that will be this much, Alexa announced, as she pointed at the front of the register, where it had the total price. Jake took out his wallet, paid for the stupid drink and before he walked off, Alex announced, You won't regret that banana! Have a good one.

          It was almost too crowded and too difficult to keep his cappuccino safe from getting spilled. There were way too many people! Then, Jake saw it: The perfect spot to sit and watch the concert. There was an open space on a nearby couch, which no one seemed to have the consideration of sitting in! He sat down, his butt finally at comfort, not noticing the man sitting next to him. He had a grown beard, wore a flannel, and looked like he was in his early 30s. He casually drank a mugful of regular black coffee, until he began talking to Jake. Have you seen these guys before? The Nasty Pen?

         Jake looked over, seeing the man for the first time. Um, no. This is actually my first time seeing a concert.

         The man looked shocked. Well, moo.

         Excuse me? Did you just 'moo' at me? One weirdo after another.

         Yeah, dude. That sucks, this being your first concert and all. Well, I'm pretty sure you'll like Nasty Pen. They're pretty bad ass.

         Jake smiled a bit, thinking of Holly. Oh yeah?

         Yeah dude. They've been together for about a year. They already have a record published and a couple tracks on iTunes. Pretty impressive work, I might add. Jake nodded in agreement, even though he didn't sound as excited as the guy. The man smiled and shook Jake's hand. Anyway, I'm Jim.

         Jake, the jock replied. Pleasure to meet you, Jim.

         Jim took a sip of his coffee. You can just call me Couch Jim. Or Couch.

         Why 'Couch?' Jake asked.  Of all names, why would Jim want Jake to call him Couch Jim or just plain old Couch?!

The Nasty Pen

 

         I like couches as much as I like to skateboard. Thats how I got my nickname, Couch. This is my favorite couch, in particular. I could sit on this couch all day. 

            Jake just sat there, nodding in agreement, not really giving a crap. Everyone was having a good time, by the looks of it. The stage was huge, for a small venue, and the instruments were in place, waiting to be played.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

          

        

 

        

         Then, the real excitement began when the band members came up on stage. The crowd cheered and chanted, Nasty Pen! Nasty Pen! Couch Jim hollered as loud as he could, YEEEEEEWWWWWW, scaring the holy cheese out of Jake. Jake's heart sank when he saw Holly walking on stage, wearing a luscious outfit. All the other band members each wore a different style of clothing.

         Holly took her green electric guitar, and spoke into the mic, toward the audience. Hey everyone. We apologize for the delay, I had to help a friend. Thanks for coming to see The Nasty Pen. I also want to thank the Funky Munkey Caf for allowing us to play tonight. This first song is called Ocelots Hunt You. The greeting was plain and simple, nothing more. Jake was stunned and so was Couch Jim. Holly strummed the electric guitar nice and loud, making the audience destroy their throats with screaming, and better yet

Chapter 11

 

            crying with pure happiness. Cody rapidly played the strings of his bass as Holly sang into the mic. Zamie was spazzing out on the drums, Greggory played the piano like a boss, and Olivia played the acoustic like a goddess. Jake's ears were already on the verge of an eargasm.

 

Meanwhile.

         The sun was setting and the weather was perfect, especially if anyone were to sit on ones roof, just to observe the beautiful view and architecture of Kingzing City. Kyle and Velouria sat on the roof of the house, just awe-struck by the beautiful sight.

         We moved into this house because my dad is a photographer, Kyle said, Velouria sitting close to him. He loves this sight. No matter how costly this house was, it was no excuse for my dad to not get it.

         That's awesome, Velouria said with a smile. I'm a huge admirer of art. This sight is something that I would lay on paper, add some extra details, all that good stuff.

         I've seen your pictures, Kyle replied. They're always hung up in the art studio at school. They're amazing, not gonna lie. I can't even draw a stick figure.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Velouria let out a giggle. I mostly paint, or sketch, when I'm listening

The Nasty Pen

 

                  to music; I can't stand silence. Lou Reed has always makes my day better. Theyre great.

            Kyle's eyes widened, captured by surprise. Did you just say Lou Reed? I l-love Lou Reed.

         Velouria smiled brightly. You're the first person I ever met that likes that band!

         Are you kidding?! I have all their records on vinyl! My dad used to take pictures of their concerts, most of them are signed.

         Velouria flailed her arms like a Muppet. WOW! That's so cool! You gotta show me, now! Kyle puked a little in his mouth, but quickly swallowed it back down. The butterfly farm in his stomach was rapidly growing, especially from Velouria's interest for one of his most favorite bands. Velouria was excited also, but she did not almost puke all over the place. We can wait if you want. I mean, if you wanna watch the darkness some more.

         Sounds like an amazing idea, Kyle said happily. They continued to have small talk as they laid back, on the roof, staring up into the clear night sky and gazing at the massive buildings of Kingzing. This was officially the best Friday ever. Amongst the positive atmosphere between Kyle and Velouria, a peculiar event occurred, as something soared through the sky. It was just as fast and visible as a shooting star.

         Their eyes grew in astonishment, as more of them streamed through the night sky. They were so close to the Earth, it looked like they were going to impact its surface. Velouria scooted close to Kyle, her fingers lightly touching his. Kyle's heart stopped working for a few seconds, forgetting exactly how it functioned. He turned his head to face Velouria. Her eyes reflected the streams of the mysterious shooting stars.

         Holy wow, Kyle thought to himself. Chills ran down his spine like the lit fuse of a firework. Their faces drew closer together as multiple shooting stars, by the looks of it, entered Earth's orbit.

         Velouria's hazel eyes looked into Kyle's green eyes as she whispered, Make a wish.

         BOOM!! It felt like a firework went off, as their lips pressed against one another's. Talk about a damn good Friday.

Chapter 11

 

         As one and a half hours passed, night time completely consuming Kingzing City, Jake's couch cushion was about as warm as a freshly-made burrito. He never took his eyes off Holly, as she graciously sang in front of the loyal fans of The Nasty Pen. Jake had often wondered if angels in Heaven sang like Holly. He had hoped for that to be true.

         I wish you were dead, I wish you were dead. You give me a pain inside my head. Its no surprise, that youre really there. I wish I could find a bear without a care.  Its like a never-ending urine sample when youre around. Go away! Go away! GO AWAY! As Holly sang, Jake's banana caramel cappuccino gained more heat, with the power of pure admiration.

         The band had finally stopped playing, the audience cheered with amusement. Holly spoke into the mic, That was Never-Ending Urine Sample, from our new album. Weve yet to come up with a name for it, unfortunately. Anyway, thanks for coming you guys! Love you, Kingzing City!

         I thought Goldfish was perfect, Cody said, scoffing.

         Couch Jim was still sitting with Jake on the comfortable couch, So what'd you think, considering it was your first concert, you loser?

         Jake rolled his eyes. It was pretty good. In truth, Jake actually wanted to say, It was freaking awesome!!!!!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Couch Jim left Funky Munkey, leaving Jake all alone on the couch; the whole venue was cleared pretty quickly. The cafe going to close in a matter of minutes, considering that it was midnight. Deep inside his thoughts, Jake had seen the best concert, ever. He waited for Holly to pack her band stuff away, even though he wasn't invited to stay any longer. Jake had the feeling that he and Holly were legit now and everything was gonna be smooth

The Nasty Pen

 

         sailing from now on. He couldnt be more wrong.

         Holly entered the venue once again, not noticing Jake sitting on the couch. A few of the audience members hollered at Holly, congratulating her of the remarkable performance. Cody, Olivia, Zamie, and Greggory, also followed. They all approached the stage quietly, gathering their amps, instruments, speakers, etc. Holly hoisted her guitar over her shoulder, looking over at Jake in the distance. Jake smiled and waved with glee, Holly thus rolled her eyes.

         She casually walked up to Jake with a most splendid greeting. Hey, asshole. Pretty nice of you to show up, I guess.

         It felt like she just punched him in the face with those words. Though, he did deserve that insult, due to past purposes, Jake stood up from the couch and replied, Well, thanks. That was a pretty good show.

         Eh, it was alright. I had worse. I just can't wait to go home. Um, I can't believe I'm saying this, but thanks for coming.

         Jake nodded. Hey, no problem. You guys rocked it. He raised his hand in the air, willing to give a high-five. I'm a fan!

         Holly looked at him, giving out a soft chuckle, and lightly slapped her hand against his.

         So, um, Jake began, you wanna stick around, or something? The cafe doesn't close in another half-hour right?

         Jake felt the nerve that Holly desperately wanted to say no, after he had asked that question. He felt incredibly stupid.

         Before Holly could answer, Cody approached her from behind. Hey, we're loading everything into my car tonight. Good show, Holly.

         Holly smiled, giving the guy a hug. Jake felt slightly jealous because he wanted to be the guy to hug her. You too. Take care of my guitar, please?

         Okay, will do, see ya. The rest of The Nasty Pen left the cafe, leaving Jake and Holly alone once again. Holly turned and looked at Jake, her eyes glistening with the dimmed lights illuminating the venue.

         Jake finally broke the silence. Look, it's cool if you don't want to, you know? Uh, yeah.

         I have stuff to get done anyway, Holly replied immediately. Maybe, some other time, maybe. See ya.

Chapter 11

 

            Jake felt like he had just been totally burned, as Holly left with the negative force of darkness. At least she said thank you, however. It was time to go home. His dad, Jared, probably knows all about what happened, with Coach Sleeve and the District game. Jake sighed, once he had realized he had more explaining to do.

 

         Not a lot of street lights illuminated the area where Funky Munkey was designated. It was dark and calm, a little too calm. Jake approached his truck, unlocked the drivers' seat, and got into the massive vehicle. He stored away his Super Jakey gear and pistol. He was actually really grateful that nothing out of the ordinary, for he was definitely too tired to be doing anything at all. Oh, the typical characteristics of a blossoming teenager. He let out a long, tiring, yet frustrating, yawn as he stuck his key in the ignition. He heard two large drops of liquid impact his car, as he had his head down. Was it raining? When Jake looked up, his stomach quivered, along with adrenaline rushing through his body. This was no rain that hit his windshield, it was small drops of (what appeared to be) nacho cheese.

         Dammit, not this again, Jake thought as he quickly starting up his car. As the nacho cheese was smeared off from the windshield wipers, Jake took out his pistol, after storing it back into his glove compartment. Hopefully he was going to get home at a decent time, tonight. Although, Jake knew something cheesy was about to happen and he made sure he was ready to bring Super Jakey into action.   

 

Chapter 12: Purple Shooting Stars

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 Kyle John Manning never processed this through his fat head: CDs were the hot tickets in receiving music in such a collaborative and convenient way! As of the current year of 2005, humans have made it possible to not just listen to music in a more convenient way through a CD, but through the single click of a computer mouse button. Thanks to iTunes and the possibility of downloading music onto a portable device, similar to that of the Walkman, listening to favorite music was just a few clicks away! As for Kyle, however, being as hipster as he possibly could, took a liking for vinyl records more than any other music medium. Every time Kyle would listen to a great record, he could always relate to its distinctive, intriguing sound of originality and purity. Vinyl records have always had something special, other than a typical CD and Kyle enjoyed that. It kept his mind at ease and his emotions at bay, even when his days were absolutely terrible. Velouria too was enjoying Kyles record playing, as music from Lou Reed echoed throughout his room.

         After Velouria took the opportunity to kiss Kyle, right on the LIPS, Kyle was shaken up like a strawberry-banana smoothie. Afterward, the couple had gotten off Kyle's roof and went into his room. INTO HIS ROOM! The two listened to Kyle's record player, just chillin' and enjoying the better sound of vinyl. Velouria laid on his bed as he, Kyle, sat in the middle of the carpet, as they discussed random stuff.

         I guess if you really wanted to use your socks as earmuffs, or if you 

Chapter 12

 

         really had to, I wouldn't think of you less, Velouria said with a giggle. Kyle laughed. They were in the middle of a deep conversation.

         Well, that's good. I don't have any earmuffs. But I have socks. So that's a positive outlook for our topic.

         Velouria rolled over on her stomach, facing Kyle from the edge of the bed. Kyle played with Legos to the beat of the music, protruding out from his speakers.

         Are you okay? Velouria asked, referring to the Cale incident from before.

         What? Oh, yeah, I'm just fine and dandy, miss.

         I'm really sorry about that.

         Oh, the kiss was great, Kyle replied with a smirk. Velouria laughed.

         It was quiet once again, the beautiful sound of music roaming throughout the evenly-spaced bedroom. Then, it hit him: Kyle was going ask Velouria out on a date! They has kissed already, so it was pretty doubtful that she would say no.

         Hey, he asked, Velouria looking up, do you want to--.

         A bright light soraing through the night sky, caught Kyle off guard. They both looked out the window to see, yet another shooting star. It was extremely close, similar to the others that were seen before. About as close as seeing an airplane, preparing to land. They watched the object head straight toward Kingzing City.

         Holy Mary, Mother of God, Kyle exclaimed, his breath was clearly taken away by the sight. So was Velouria's.

         Pretty creepy, yet gorgeous, she replied. Now, what were you saying, Kyle?

         Kyle didn't even blink. I'm sorry – what?

 

 

 

 

 

 

Purple Shooting Stars

 

            Meanwhile.

            He was tired and he was ready to go home. Although, rest would have to wait, once Jake saw a shooting star stream overhead. Jakes eyes grew wide as he followed its direction, paying attention to traffic at the same time. What the hell?! Whoa! WHOAA! Was that a--?!

         He heard a small explosion close by, within a small distance from the city. Jake knew that, whatever it was, had impacted the ground and it was time to investigate as Super Jakey. On another note, Jake was about to hyperventilate, for he had seen nothing like that. He was eventually driving on a bridge, the Dansko Bridge, which was close to his house. Jake couldn't believe what had just happened! It was as if he were in some sort of science fiction movie. Some thing, possibly from outer space, had crash-landed somewhere in the Kingzing area! Jake saw people pull to the side of the road to admire the sight of thick smoke left from the falling object. The smoke was blue, with a mix of pure white, which seemed to really astound Jake and the locals.

         Something else caught Jake's eye, as he continued to drive, a white Volvo change lanes in front of him. It was Holly Ransfield who was the driver of the vehicle! If Holly was driving on The Dansko Bridge, this could only mean that she lived nearby! Happiness overwhelmed Jake, who was completely forgetting the fact that Kingzing City was just hit by a meteorite. Jake soon focused on reality, other than imagining Holly with no clothes on, as a mysterious splash of nacho cheese hit the front of Holly's car. Jake gasped, like a little girl, as he watched Holly hesitate her driving and calmly pull over to the side of the road. Ugh, what?! Holly yelled at the top of her lungs, as she tried to get all the cheese off with her windshield wipers. The cheese was steaming with heat and was too thick to be rid of. No one else was in sight, except Jake who had just pulled to the side of the road behind her. As quickly as possible, Jake had transformed into Super Jakey, which only consisted of a poor excuse for a superhero costume. Thankfully, Holly did not notice Jake had parked a few hundred yards behind her, for she was too busy trying to be rid of the nacho cheese. Holly watched the cheese ooze her windshield and into the hood of her car. Oh dammit! More cheese mysteriously poured onto her car, absolutely from nowhere.

Chapter 12

 

            Holly began to freak out, as her car slowly began to die from all the hot nacho cheese. How the hell is this happening?! Is this some sort of sick joke? Holly revved her car some more to get it started and had absolutely no luck at all. SPLAT! Holly almost suffered a heart attack when her side window was suddenly covered in more nacho cheese. She exited her car quickly, getting a full view of the blanket of cheese she had been sitting under. There was no one in sight. She even noticed Jake's truck, but saw no one in there. Instead of feeling optimistic about this strange coincidence, Holly only focused on the conflict she was currently facing. She was ready to kick whoevers ass to the curb for completely damaging her car.

         Her stress began to rise, once taking out her cell to call for an emergency. Eerily enough, the Dansko Bridge was completely surrounded by emptiness and darkness. Holly had to get help fast. Then, before the phone began to ring, she heard a most evil, sinister voice slither its way into her ear. Boo. She screamed, making herself drop the cell phone onto the concrete. She hesitantly turned around, screaming again after she finally saw Evil Nacho, who was standing no more than a foot away from her. His posture, his deformity, his evil towered over the independent young lady. He grinned devilishly. I do like orange. My favorite color. Your automobile looks nice.

 What's a sweet, gorgeous, young morsel, like yourself, driving alone at this time of night? Partying like some crazy animal?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         I-I was just getting home from w-work, Holly stuttered. She couldn't believe what was witnessing. She had never seen anything like Evil Nacho. He was gross and it was horribly disturbing to see, what looked like, nacho

Purple Shooting Stars

 

            chips attached, if not in-grown, to his built body.

         Oh were you? Evil Nacho replied. Did you have fun? He reached out to touch Holly's arm and she willingly pushed it away, immediately. Like any person facing peril would possess, Holly remembered that she held onto a bottle of mace in her jacket pocket. A little resistant? Rrrgh, you should be aware of my irrational thoughts, you pathetic bug.

         Excuse me? Holly's voice raised She was now growing angry, rather than becoming scared.

         Accept your fate, overly-confident brat, the villain spoke. He took another step and Holly took out her bottle of mace. Evil Nacho was far too quick for her to attempt her next move. He had already grabbed her wrist, and tossed the mace aside. Mace, again? Surely someone has a better weapon to attack me with! Holly threw her fist and punched the monster in the face. It barely had any affect, against Evil Nacho's stability. He laughed and shoved Holly, causing her to stumble and hit her head against her nacho cheese covered car. She quickly got up and began running down the street, away from the monster, and Evil Nacho began to chase her.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Come on, sunshine! Don't you like nachos?! Evil Nacho hollered as he threw his deadly nacho chips at Holly, until one eventually drilled into her calf. She screamed in pain and struggled to keep running. The nacho chip's sharp tip seared pain throughout her whole leg, causing her to bleed immensely. As anyone would say, this was not nacho average night. Hollys speed was decreasing and Evil Nacho was gaining up on her.

Chapter 12

 

         Chuckling victoriously, and just when he was about to grab her hair and rip every single root off her scalp, a bright blue flash was seen in front of Evil Nacho. The flash slammed into Evil Nacho's stomach, sending him flying and landing onto the concrete. Holly had stumbled once again after the bright, red light had occurred. She laid there on the ground, examining her injured leg. The nacho chip had broken into pieces, once she collapsed, only leaving one sharp chunk inside her flesh. She ripped it out, followed by a cry of pain and desperately tried to get up and begin running once again. She noticed Evil Nacho getting up, smoke escaping where he was hit. He groaned angrily and in agony. What just knocked Evil Nacho on his bum?

         Stay away from the lady, Macho Nacho, Super Jakey announced, landing onto the concrete. Holly couldn't believe it, it was Super Jakey! The lone superhero everyone was talking about. Super Jakey casually walked up to Evil Nacho, who was now standing, with an angry expression on his rotten face. Super Jakey had his elbow, and a pistol, pointing at Evil Nacho, ready for shooting another laser and/or bullet.

         It's EVIL NACHO! the monster roared angrily.

         Whatever, stink breath, Super Jakey replied with a smirk.

         Evil Nacho stood there, grinning, with his nacho chips retracting through his skin. It's been awhile, 'Super Jack-Ass.' Last time we met, you shot me in the face with that fancy laser of yours.

         And I'm about to do it again if you don't lay off.

         Oh, I knew you would say that. I also knew you would come and save this damsel, also. Cocky brats like you deserve to be diminished and I know that for a very special reason. It's time that I've gotten rid of you once and for all.

         Super Jakey gulped, for he was ready for another fight with this jerk. He looked over at Holly, noticing of her traumatic leg injury from a simple nacho chip. He smiled and realized that this was his shining moment to completely impress the girl of his dreams. The thought of getting her somewhere safe from Evil Nacho did not come to mind, at all. Lets go, buddy-boy. Holly raised one eyebrow. She thought she had heard someone say buddy-boy, numerous times before. However, she could not put her finger on exactly who would say that word in that specific tone.

Purple Shooting Stars

 

            Evil Nacho didn't hesitate to stomp his foot onto the concrete, causing the bridge to shake, thus giving Holly a more difficult time to get herself standing. To avoid stumbling, Super Jakey leapt, landed and bounced again, creating a sonic boom, intentionally sending himself into the air. As Super Jakey prepared himself for an aerial assault on his opponent, Evil Nacho cackled, leapt into the air, and grabbed the hero by the leg. Super Jakey struggled to shake him off. He shot a few rounds at Evil Nacho, bullets hitting his torso, and it seemed like it did no damage, whatsoever.

         Evil Nacho laughed, and threw Super Jakey straight to the ground. The bridge shook again once Super Jakey hit the concrete. Um... ow. He quickly got back on his feet to avoid any more obstructions from the monster. Holly was simply stunned. A flying ninja dude fighting a nacho guy?

         Alright, time to blast this guy to oblivion, Super Jakey whispered to himself and shot a laser at the ongoing Evil Nacho. The laser hit him on his right shoulder, knocking him to the ground. That was easier than I thought? The hero hesitantly walked up to Evil Nacho, who seemed to be wounded. Look, ass douche, I'm really getting sick of your mayhem. Just goooooo awaaaayyyy! Evil Nacho laughed, looked up at Super Jakey and gagged. Wait. What? Why was he gagging? Super Jakey looked confused, as did Holly, who decided to stay and watch the fight, other than making another attempt to flee the scene. Evil Nacho opened his mouth, with gallons of nacho cheese spewing forth

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 12

 

         Nacho cheese completely dominated Super Jakey, who was screaming because the molten cheese caused severe pain. Evil Nacho could throw up steaming hot cheese, just like Super Jakey could puke lava!

         Really!? Really?! Super Jakey shouted, desperately trying to get rid of the cheese that covered his entire body. Holly started laughing and Super Jakey immediately pointed at her. Not funny!

         Evil Nacho stood up on his feet. You really are pathetic and very fun to fight, you know that? He rushed to Super Jakey and grabbed him by the throat. Now, it time to put you out of your mis--.

BANG!

 

 

         The loud sound of unknown fire-power rang in Super Jakey's ears like an on-going telephone. He took a few steps back, seeing that Evil Nacho had been hit once again. What was going on this time?! He then heard some odd chatter beside him. Is that the guy? He looks ugly. There they were, Adoa Probes joined in a group, pointing their massive rifles at the hero. Holly was about to crap her pants, as was Super Jakey. The Probes were much taller than Super Jakey and Evil Nacho, and they appeared to be more intimidating. Evil Nacho stood there with a confused look on his face. He was angry, full of rage, though confused as well as the teenagers were. They had never seen anything this before.

         Must be him, a Probe said. Zjok told us that he had that he would be flying and all that funky stuff.

         What about the other one? another Probe asked, referring to Evil Nacho.

         The Probe sighed. Idiot, would Zjok create the Misara Serum to make you puke cheese?! Does that sound appropriate?!

         No, sir.

         Good. Just shut up and let's take these guys out. Zjok either wants the Super Jakey either dead or alive. I suggest we just him off – why the hell are they staring at us?

         Super Jakey's expression on his face told the Probes how confused and

Purple Shooting Stars

           

            shocked he was. There was silence until the hero defiantly, and loudly demanded What the hell is a 'ZEE-JOCK?!' A vehicle, driving on the opposite side of the street came passing by. The leader of the Probes fired multiple rounds from his rifle, causing the car to lose control and crash. The driver, who was hurt, weakly got out of the car. The Probe was about to shoot the innocent man, until Super Jakey called him a douche mongrel. The Probes gave immediate attention, unintentionally giving the citizen a chance to escape. Holly, who was hiding behind her car, was sick to her stomach. She couldnt just leave without getting blasted to death.

         The first Probe sighed. Just kill the two bastards.

         Super Jakey booked it as the ten Probes opened fire, shooting what seemed to be of massive purple bullets, which coincidentally matched the smoke that was noticed lingering in the sky, before. Super Jakey realized that the falling meteorites were no ordinary meteorites at all. They were robots from outer space! Super Jakey scooped up Holly in his arms, the Probes still shooting their rifles, and took off into the night sky to avoid any more injury. Evil Nacho, apparently, had disappeared once more

         What is going on?! Holly shouted in Super Jakeys ear, her voice being much louder than the sound of fire-power.

         Well, could you be any LOUDER?! the hero snapped. He turned his head to see that the Probes were flying after them, continuously firing their guns. Look, cutie, I gotta take you somewhere safe before you're blown to smithereens.

         Well, I certainly do NOT feel safe, at all! There are robots after us! I just got stabbed by a nacho!

         Duh, you think so?! Super Jakey fired his pistol at the Probes, knocking one out of the air, before he had ran out of ammunition. They flew through an urban neighborhood, where people had come out of their homes to see what the hell was happening outside. Super Jakey had to keep his high school crush from any harm. Then, it hit him, he saw a dumpster up ahead. Look Hol-- I mean, pretty girl, I'm gonna drop you off in that dumpster up ahead. You keep your head down, got that?

         Wait, what?!

          He flew as fast as he could, quickly dropping Holly, safely, into the

Chapter 12

 

            dumpster. Never realizing that what he did for Hollys safety was actually a terrible use of strategy, Super Jakey was really ready to kick some robot booty. He had already taken one Probe out, so this shouldn't be a problem at all. The Probes were catching up and Super Jakey had already made his way back at them, ready to tear their heads off. He also had to keep the innocent residents of the neighborhood safe from any mayhem that was yet to approach. He was flying, toward the Probes, who refused to cease fire. Already sick of your crap, guys! He dodged several shots before grabbing a Probe by the head, ripping it off. Sparks flew as the other Probes scattered, trying their best to blast Super Jakey out of the sky. The hero threw the Probe's dysfunctional body, knocking another Probe out. Come on, freaks! Gotta do better than that!

         With pleasure, the first Probe replied and fired a swift shot, hitting Super Jakey in the chest. Oh, how the pain seared throughout his body. The pain was more affective than the average bullet and it felt like he was just smacked by a thousand cattle prods. Super Jakey groaned angrily, as he felt the pain immediately cease and the Misara Serum healing his new wound. Just before Super Jakey was going to attack his new enemies Evil Nacho.

         The monster tore apart a couple Probes, resisting the pain of purple fire power, impacting his body, from their rifles. Did you actually believe you wouldnt see me again?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Super Jakey came back into battle. He had to learn to take pain like that

Purple Shooting Stars

 

            without ducking for cover. He was lucky no one was hurt, a little too lucky, and why the hell was Evil Nacho helping Super Jakey defeat the Probes?! As Evil Nacho took care of most of the Probes, two others got in Super Jakey's path. The hero blasted one apart with his elbow laser and decided to tear the rifle off the other one. Once detaching the Probes weapon, Super Jakey began using it against the others STOP SHOOTING AT ME!! He felt pretty bad ass, being able to use such alien weaponry. It took him a while to get the hang of using the advanced rifle, as he blasted away the remaining Probes. Evil Nacho tore their robotic parts with deadly nacho chips.

            The duo stood in the middle of the street, full of energy. The fight was over, at last. Residents of the small neighborhood were scared, yet some were excited. Super Jakey's shirt had numerous blood stains all over, causing him to sigh with frustration. Dammit, I just got this shirt, too. Evil Nacho laughed and punched Super Jakey in the face, when he was least expecting it. It was a pretty hard blow to the jaw, and it caused Super Jakey to fall and drop the rifle he had stolen from the one Probe.

          Now that is all well-done, Evil Nacho announced, it is now time to put you out of your misery.

         Freeze! Stop right there! shouted a voice. Evil Nacho roared angrily, giving Super Jakey the opportunity to blast him away with his laser. He did. The monster screamed in pain, as unidentified men also shot him with recognizable weaponry.

         Evil Nacho was pissed, as he ran away in cowardice. The men stopped firing and Super Jakey quickly got up on his feet. The group of people were dressed very casually, wearing dark blue (and some dark red) uniforms. Some even wore sunglasses, even though it wasn't bright outside. The first thought that came to Super Jakey's mind was the FBI. Of course, the FBI would be here but that wasnt the case. The neighborhood had practically turned into a war zone. Citizens were absolutely terrified. Some stayed in their homes and some were brave enough to stay outside and record raw footage of the whole scenario. Super Jakey was the complete opposite of exhausted. He was willing to take on more robots, if necessary. He now understood the difficulty of protecting innocent bystanders. Thank God no one was hurt.

Chapter 12

 

            Stay where the hell you are, one of the men ordered, his pistol, pointing at Super Jakey. He must have been the leader of the group, but he looked awfully familiar. You're Super Jakey, correct?

         You read the papers, bitch? he replied, with a smirk.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Well, I was just checking, jeez, the man replied. He took a few steps toward Super Jakey, as the other well-suited people kept their guns pointing at him. The man looked around. Alright, residents! Everything is cool now! Go back into your homes! The civilians didn't budge. They were too stupid and curious, and they all wanted to see what was going to happen next. The man turned to one of the others and said, Fire a warning shot, Agent Jon43.

         The agent nodded and fired several rounds into the air. The civilians gasped and screamed as they hurriedly made it back into their homes. The leader turned back at Super Jakey.  

         They're my fans, what can I say? Super Jakey said, winking.

         I am Agent Nathan12, of the 'A72A.

         Super Jakey blinked. The what?! Aren't you Greggory Stanley from The Nasty Pen band?

         Shut up! Nathan snapped and lowered his voice. I was undercover.  We are 'The Area 72 Agency.' Perhaps you've heard of us?

         The masked teenager shook his head. Not that I know of?

         Course you haven't. Anyway, we've been watching your every move.

Purple Shooting Stars

 

            Super Jakey looked around, looking at the destroyed Probes. You mean, you crazy turds created these?

         No, Agent Nathan12 replied. He looked around, quite amused with Super Jakey's and Evil Nacho's work. We are not sure who, or what they are, but they seemed to take a liking of you.

         No der!! Super Jakey snapped. This is crazy! Where did these robot things even come from?!

         Yeah, I do not know, Nathan replied. He sounded very frustrated, even though the real reason why he was on Captain Derno's top secret mission was to keep a close eye on Super Jakey and his capabilities, not dealing with robots from outer space.

            There was silence until Super Jakey finally said, I'm tired, I wanna go home. Sooo, yeaaaahhh, See ya.

         Before Super Jakey flew off Nathan hollered, We'll be watching you!

         Weirdo! Why?!

         We have our orders. We want to keep this city safe, safe from space robots and your recklessness.

         Gee thanks for rubbing that in, dude!

         You got crazy space robots to follow you into a suburban neighborhood, moron, Nathan said. Be more careful, eh?

         Super Jakey had no idea that he had that much responsibility on his shoulders. Everyone in Kingzing City, maybe even the whole United States, knew who he was. Nathan was right. Super Jakeys strategic methods were very unprofessional. Tomorrow Saturday and he couldn't believe that because today felt like a week. He had to deal with Cale, he got suspended from the baseball team, he realized that Holly still disliked him, and fought robots and Evil Nacho all while protecting the one who despised him and hundreds of innocent lives. JEEZ! Super Jakey took a deep sigh of distress and took off, with Nathan calling him a jerk under his breath.

         As Super Jakey flew off, into the sky, he had totally forgotten about Holly, for she was still in the dumpster, looking up at the sky and watching him fly away. She began to limp home, her knee stinging in pain. Jeez, leave me in the dumpster, will he? Some hero.

 

 

 

     Chapter 13: Don't Bring Milk

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

     Kriket had drifted off to sleep once again, having no food in her system. The Adoa barely fed their prisoners and the only food that was given was consisted of stale crackers. Today's crackers were classic Goldfish, which was never opened since its expiration in 1991. Oh yes, they were awful. As Kriket slept, Admiral Bxir was busy eating the stale fish crackers in the palm of his three-fingered hand; Zitkir just sat there, like a lonely bad ass; Drox did the same, except blowing bubbles from his own saliva. I wonder where we're going Drox finally said. It was the first time anyone had said anything in the past week. It seemed almost unfamiliar to the Asids that either would talk, whatsoever. Being prisoner in a crummy cell, there really wasnt much to talk about. The ship hasnt stopped since we got here.

         I don know an I don care, Bxir replied.

We got to get out of here somehow, right? Drox asked. He began to whisper. I mean the Adoa was not always that smart, you know? Theyre violent, but they lack intelligence.

Chapter 13

 

         The best thing we can do is wait is hope for the best, Zitkir said. He couldn't help but feel hopelessness. The Asids had no weapons, no Vambits; Oil, Querznem, Rav, and Bunny were all deceased.

         Wail than, Admiral Bxir said to Zitkir. Yew think we is jist gonna seet here and wait tah die?!

         We have no means of communication, Admiral. What else are we gonna do? Just sit here and scrub the restrooms? Thats all weve been doing!

         It's a start. To escape, we can think of somethin.'

         But, if one of us messes up, all four of us will wind up dead. It's over, Admiral, we're done! Its hardly a doubt that Preox and Rig are dead, also. They were very decorative soldiers and I proudly salute them.

         Kriket had barely woken up when Zitkir talked about Preox and Rig dying. Shed always had feelings for Preox, and she always had the best of times training with him, back on the planet Suzia. She cringed a little. She wasn't used to this much violence and this much brutality. She's only seen so much, including the four Asids that were just recently killed right in front of her very own eyes. She was not only traumatized by the unfortunate events that have taken place, but her emotions were completely overwhelming. She couldnt tell the difference between reality or if this was all a constant nightmare. She wasn't proud of what Zitkir was saying. Zitkir was a 2nd Class Envoy, and just to hear him say that about Magnate Preox, as well as Rig, and that they could never escape this trash heap, tore a hole in Kriket's heart.

         Bxir was silent, as were the rest. Kriket's face was partially hidden from her short and disgustingly scattered hair and she started to tear up, as she sat upright on the cold, hard wall. The only other sound being made was the sound of Adoa Mazers walking about and their frequent chatter. The four Asids didn't know exactly what the Adoa was up to, though they knew they were after the Misara Serum. Whoever was in possession of it, he or she would receive most dire consequences.

Don't Bring Milk

He was perfectly bald, just like Preox, before he had fallen victim to the Misara Serum. Screw teeth! Cavities all the way!

Chapter 13

The rest of the Asids were in a seemingly large training room, partying it up like it was 1999. For the Asids, they would find any possible way to enjoy the positive attributes of life. They were in the middle of a war conflict, and this was the best they could do for themselves to ease the insane amount of anxiety, stress, and trauma. The Misara Serum was displayed on a hovering, metallic podium and soldiers gazed at its majestic, curious appearance. A simple object, containing less than a liter of dominating destruction, just sitting there. It was exhilarating to be in the presence of it and also extremely intimidating. No one even bothered to touch it, because they knew of its powerful status. Preox and Rig had successfully stolen the Serum, several years after Zjok had betrayed his own kind. After stealing the dangerously awesome weapon from the clutches of Zjok, on the planet Fleek, Preox and Rig successfully delivered it back to the planet Strom. Planet Suzia would be an obvious choice of storing the Serum in a safe location. Planet Strom was empty, a lonesome area, and being almost completely uninhabited, keeping the Serum there was most necessary. Weeks after Preox and Rigs outstanding victory, none of the Asids have heard from the Adoa. As angry as Zjok became of his precious weapon being stolen, he decided to give the Asids a silent treatment, a deadly one, and Preox did not enjoy this silence one bit. Deep down in mind, he knew that the Adoa could unexpectedly attack at any moment. This celebration of victory caused him to become overly paranoid, even though he was also sure that the Adoa could never find them on Strom. Unfortunately, of all of Preoxs sureness, the Asids did not know that they were being tracked down at this very moment. A simple war tactic, and the Asids seemed to have completely overlooked it.

Don't Bring Milk

Chapter 13

What's wrong, you guys?

Milk splashed everywhere, causing one more Mazer to slip and fall on his ass. Zjok's blood was boiling, as he approached the Mazer who had brought the milk.          Soon, sir, sooner than Christmas!

Oh Galg, my lovely Galg, the moment we reach Earth, it will be better than Christmas!  In the meantime, I wish for our four prisoners to be scrubbing our toilets, once again. Yayvox, I'm pretty sure, has been having irritable bowel problems. He's been in there a lot, recently. I actually hope he's alright. In conclusion, the toilets need extra scrubbing.

         Affirmatory, Galg replied, giving a salute and marched off.

Chapter 13

Admiral Bxirs breath stank like old fish crackers, the motivation was pure.

Chapter 13

Chapter 13

         Area 72: The Next Week

        

            Preox, calmly and casually, began to work on the old space-craft, which had currently been kept in Area 72. The ship was almost in perfect condition, considering its age. According to Preox, this space craft was known as a Retriever ship, formally used three-hundred years ago. Preox found it remarkable to find such a Retriever in such mint condition. He just had to make a few modifications, especially if he were to go up against modernized Adoa war-mongers. Preox distinctly heard an unpleasant scream of utter terror, causing him to look up with a most concerned expression. It was Moosey, frantically running like a complete maniac.

         As Preox watched the disturbed moose approach him, Moosey hollered, MR. PREOX! Big meteor thing in the sky! It coming down! Preox didn't hesitate when he wielded his rifle, which was being kept safely on the back of his Vambit. He activated his jet-pack and soared through the facility, following Moosey along with soldiers and agents. More combat was surely yet to come.

        

         Kriket! Get the hell down now! Preox demanded at the top of his lungs. His voice was raspy and barely heard, as he and the female Asid were under heavy fire. Asid soldiers were falling before them, dead, as they took cover behind massive debris, set by a recent explosion. Adoa fire-power soared over the two Asids' heads, as they kept their heads down. The area was cramped, almost impossible to escape without getting shredded to pieces. Preox and Kriket had no way of returning fire, in the hopes of wiping out the several Mazers that had the easier advantage of killing. Then, as all the Asid soldiers surrounding the two had been wiped out, the Mazers ceased fire. It        

Don't Bring Milk

 

         was quiet in the Asid facility; the Adoa had invaded the Asid base on Planet Strom and Preox was in possession of the Misara Serum (He also wore the Vambit he was more familiarized with, though it was brand new at the time.). The horrible stench of torn Asid flesh was beginning to fill the whole artillery room. The Mazers seemed to have taken notice of the two Asids who were both still alive, as the two of them blended in with the many dead bodies.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Preox and Kriket listened, not making any movements of any sort, to the Mazers laughing with pure evil slithering through their tongues. Well damn, they is all dead now! Shall we rendezvous with Zjok's group now? This was all occurring on the same day Preox became a Magnate, and when Rig was being tested for the symptoms of the Misara Serum.

         Well, duh. Come on, Mazers, let's go kick some more ass. It was quiet, once again. Preox couldn't decipher if all the Mazers had left or not. The fact that Zjok's name was mentioned shocked him. He couldnt believe that his best friend had betrayed his own species. As a Magnate, he was surely not expecting any of this to happen. Magnate Preox also knew many of the Asids who laid dead around him and Kriket. His head hurt, almost like a migraine, and he just couldn't bear to lay around here any longer. The cold, hard, ground was covered in neon-pink blood and the ultimately deceased.

         Preox looked over at Kriket, her face was beaten, and she was much more out of shape than Preox was. She looked back at him, her eyes were innocent and full of fear. Preox counted his fingers, slowly, down from

Chapter 13

 

         three, signaling Kriket when to jump out from their spot. He counted down to one and they both immediately rose to their feet, their guns pointed to where they could hear the Mazers speak. They were gone alright, except for one. He was immediately caught by surprise, cursing at the top of his lungs. Preox rushed over, with a most angry expression and grasped the Mazer by the throat, lifting him off his feet. Kriket stayed in her position, keeping her eye on the entrance, where the Mazers originally intruded.

         Preox took the Mazers rifle away from him, keeping ahold of his neck. The Mazer gasped, as he desperately attempted to scream for help. He tried to hurt Preox with his free arms, but the Asid was quick enough to snap it into dislocation. The Mazer gave out a raspy scream of agony, Preox's anger heightened. Kriket couldn't help but watch Preox slowly torture his enemy, without making any sound... She kept her gun pointed to the doorway, but kept her eyes on the Preox. Preox grabbed hold of one of the Mazer's teeth with his free hand, tearing it straight from the root.

         Grey blood oozed from the Mazer's mouth as he choked and gasped in pain. Preox dropped the large tooth, clattering on the ground, as he tore out another tooth. The Mazer's blood sprayed in Preox's face, but he didn't care, this Mazer was reaping what he sowed. Kriket felt indisposed as she heard, let alone watched, Preox tearing the Mazer's teeth right from their roots. All of the Mazer's teeth were gone, looking like a Muppet. Preox shut his mouth, causing the Mazer to slowly drown in his own blood.

         Breathing heavily from anger and adrenaline, Preox kicked the Mazer's head in, once he was dead. Kriket saw flames in Preox's eyes, as she kept watch of the doorway. It was continuously silent, except for distant explosions and fire-power that was happening throughout the bases interior and exterior. Preox wiped gray blood off his pale-green face and made his way across the room, where he found extra ammo cartridges. He motioned Kriket to follow him and ordered her to load her weapon. Its going to get even more hectic out there, Common Kriket, I suggest you prepare yourself. He faced Kriket, her face was still beautiful amongst the brutality, but well innocent, and defiantly said, Let's see how these asshole like getting blasted by their own weaponry. Come on, Kriket, let's go find Rig, and have ourselves our very own slaughter festivity.

Don't Bring Milk

 

                     Kriket was now worried. She felt as though Preox was turning into a war monster. She really couldnt blame him, however, being the fact Preox knew Zjok well. Chapter 13

 

            gathered to see the astonishing site of an illuminating object, hurdling toward their destination. They all stood in awe and discussing in excitement.
