         Okay, since I am an Asid and I know what has been going on these past few days, Preox announced, we will approach this object. By the looks of it, it looks like a mere launch pod from a space craft. Could be Adoa or Asid, I'm not exactly sure.

         Hey! Rig shouted. I know stuff like this too!

         Then what am I wearing, right now? Preox immediately questioned, referring to his armor.

         A coat?

         Preox sighed. Armor, you jackass! Okay, let's move out! Derno, Moosey, you two come with.

         Moosey gulped, as fear took over his mental state, and switched his pistol off the safety feature. Captain Derno did the same. Several marines followed as they jogged towards the object, which was sending purple smoke into the sky. Preox kept a stern look on his face, as Rig kept a ludicrously happy expression on his. Rigs enthusiasm made the entire group look much less intimidating. They approached the fallen space craft, which created a forty-foot deep hole, with a forty-foot radius. The group surrounded the area, their guns pointed at the craft, ready for anything to jump out. It was quiet, except for the sound of fire rising from the massive object, as well as the static electricity cracking from Rig's dangerous antennae. Preox took the liberty to descend into the crash site to examine the ship. He gripped his rifle tightly once he saw Adoa symbols and colors on the launch pod. He kept his rifle pointed on the doorway, as his free arm slowly opened the--

                  alien planted her lips against Preox's, making everything more questionable than it had to be. Preox expected more kisses from Kriket, but he knew that Kriket was facing troubles dealing with this whole war conflict.

         Move outta mah way, Prex, Admiral Bxir demanded as he crawled out of the launch pod. He stopped dead in his tracks, once he saw all the guns pointing at him. Zitkir was carrying an unconscious Drox over his shoulder as he pointed an Asid pistol at the humans.

         They're allies! Preox shouted. For tit's sake, lower your weapons! They're Asids! Zitkir, I order you to lower your weapon, now! What the hell happened!? Rig and I thought you guys were dead, once we left the planet Strom! Are there any others?! I thought I would never see any of you again, not since we were ultimately separated from that battle on Strom.

His Vambit was also heavily damaged, with the same facts applying to Zitkir and Drox. Its just us, Magnate. We is all dat is left, from the planet Strom. Chapter 13

         No. We were gonna crash, so I ended up blowing it to bits so no enemies could trace us. However, and thanks to these incompetent humans, my Vambit was eventually traced from the Adoa. Thats how the Probes got here. Anyway, I propose--.

                  A deafening sound rang in everyone's ears, once the ship had finally self-destructed. They all stumbled and fell, as the ground shook, with flaming debris falling from the sky. They quickly got back up, continuing to run back to base. Once they were far away from the destruction, everyone was bunched up into a massive group.

         We gotta think of a plan to get the Adoa away from this planet! They can't even get the Serum, now that Super Jakey has possessed it! The Serum just doesnt SIMPLY RUN THROUGH HIS BLOOD LIKE A TYPICAL DISEASE! URRG! Preox shouted, now carrying Kriket over his shoulder.

Don't Bring Milk

 

            What an ass! Seriously, I hate him so much.

We has to act fast! But first, I must have some food. I is getting' sick of stale crackers. Admiral Bxir excused himself, after a disgusting belch.          Now what? Moosey asked.

         We need to get to Super Jakey's location, as soon as possible. This planet is in more danger than I thought. We need all the transport we can get, to get the hell out of here. The Adoa sent Probes here because they were able to track Rig and I, and I wouldnt be surprised if they had a lock on our position to send more. We must act quickly.

         Were in a remote forest in Quebec, Canada. We're not going to have enough transport within the next week, Captain Derno added.

         Did I hesitate, Captain? You want the Adoa to rip you limb from limb, or drink a mocha with me after we annihilate them? Come on, Rig, were going to finish up that old Asid ship.

         WOO! We goes to war! Me so excited. Rig began fist pumping, as Preox started walking away from Captain Derno and Moosey. Now it was time for the good guys to use the Adoas slower pace to their advantage.

Meanwhile

                  Jake was getting ready for school on a fine, blissful morning. Super Jakey had been all over the news, ever since the Probe incident, which had happened in a suburban neighborhood a few days back. Even the fact that alien robots from outer space in the presence of humans was raging all over the media. Today was going to be, yet another, miserable day of high school education, however. Ever since Super Jakey entered his life almost too unexpectedly and positively, Jake had been doing better in school than he ever has. It was if his mysterious symptoms also developed him to become

 

Chapter 13

 

            more efficient in terms of smartness. Besides that, Jake had not heard from Holly very often, ever since the whole robot ordeal. He had seen her throughout school, but never really had the chance to talk to her. He was nervous. He has never been nervous around a girl before in his life. He was also often regretting the fact that he left Holly, who was injured at the time, in a random dumpster just to keep her from harm. Even Jake himself thought that was pretty low. It was.

         You alright, sonny? Jared's voice was heard, causing Jake to look up from his bowl of cereal. He had been zoning out.

         Y-yeah. Erm—yeah I'm cool.

         You're 'cool?' Jared replied a smirk. No, really, what is it? Is it work? School? The baseball districts? Look, I'm not mad about that, as long as the guy you socked ultimately deserved it. Which teammate was that, by the way? Your coach never really told me, just gave me a bunch of deep exhales from his frustration.

         Jake took a spoonful of cereal and began to munch. Cale. It was Cale Omnous.

         Not really, but yeah. Dad, I gotta go.

         Alright, skippy, I'll be working until midnight again, selling more houses and what-not. So, help yourself to anything when you get home.

Don't Bring Milk

 

            Jake nodded with a forced, faint smile and made his way out of the nice apartment complex. Just before he started up his truck in the parking garage, his phone began to blare off. It was Kyle. Jake answered the phone.

         Yesss?

         Bro, I never asked you, how did that thing go with Holly? I know thats been over a week ago, but the high school play and Velouria have been keeping me occupied.

         Jake gulped and sighed. It wasokay.

         She still givin' you that attitude, huh? I'm sorry, man. Maybe, it's just not meant to be, ya know?

         Jake hated hearing those words. Yeah, I guess. How are you and Velouria?

         Pretty good! Going on a date after school tomorrow so that should be exhilarating. I wanna thank you, by the way, for helping me out.

         Jake laughed. Even though you pretty much did all the work! Twenty-five percent of me kicking ass, the other seventy-five percent of you doing all the sweet talk.

         Kyle giggled like a little girl, and he thanked Jake sincerely. They both ended their little discussion and Jake proceeded to make his way to Kingzing City High School. Today was wet and dreary, due to the weather's most recent rainstorm.  Jake was jammin' out to the radio, just waiting for the traffic light to turn green. He looked at his rear view mirror, adjusting the baseball cap he wears daily on his head. Once he adjusted his hat to a more comfortable size, it was already too late for him to notice a speeding vehicle headed toward the rear of his truck. Oh. Jake's body jerked forward, once the car slammed into the truck's tailgate, causing the airbag to burst from his steering wheel. Jake moaned in pain, but could feel his body heal immediately. W-what--? The car behind him now had a demolished hood, which was revealed as it backed up and began to drive off. Jake tore the airbag apart in total anger, as he watched that damn car drive away. The hell, man! Oh, no he didn't! Then, police sirens were heard from behind. Jake turned his head and watched police cars drive past. By the looks of it, the KCPD was in pursuit of a heist. Jake sighed at the top of his lungs in frustration. This looked like a job for, ugh, Super Jakey.

 

Chapter 14: Afterwards

 

 

 

     

 

 

 

 

 

Stuart was a middle-aged, hardworking man. His husband, Kevin, was just the same. After getting together, both becoming the first married homosexual newlyweds in the history of their families', Stuart and Kevin decided to elope in the beautiful city of Kingzing. Their goal was to celebrate their honeymoon, with their fabulous wealth, which was yet to be obtained. How were they to become a wealthy couple, as anyone would ask? Well, they had to pull a few a strings, of course. On a positive note, Kevin was a pro bank robber, who was still in his prime. As for Stuart, heisting eventually became a new hobby of his, thanks to Kevin. However, Stuart was becoming a bit unstable because, at this moment, the two lovers happen to be in pursuit by the KCPD. For the pro heisters, this was pretty clumsy of them to be in pursuit by the police.

         Damn! Are you okay? Kevin asked frantically, for he had accidentally slammed his car against the tailgate of Jake's Smithys truck. Stuart's forehead began to bleed, as he cried in agony. Wh-why isn't there an airbag in the dashboard?!

         It's been used before, Stu, I'm so sorry! As Kevin drove, Stuart loaded

Chapter 14

 

            a pistol, stuck his arm out the car window and began shooting at the law enforcement.

         Well, Kevin! Could you at least pay attention to what is on the street, whilst being chased by the local police?! I want my dream wardrobe, not a concussion!

         I'm hurt, too! Kevin yelled back frantically.

         Is your head bleeding, Kevin?!

         No--.

         Then shut up and drive, cause theyre catching up to us!

         Kevin groaned angrily, as he floored the acceleration pedal. You put the money in the trunk, right?

         Stuart laughed his ass off and replied sarcastically. No, Kev, I left it back at the bank! I felt we could come back later, after we got a bite to eat!

         I was just asking, Stu, jeez! You never know! Ugh, we gotta lose these cops, now. I'm getting all sweaty!

         Kevin reached in his jacket pocket, as an opposing bullet pierced through his side mirror (he shrieked frantically), and took out a grenade.

         Stuart gasped with astonishment. Oh, you sneaky devil!

         Kevin smiled, Love you too, baby. He tossed the grenade out the window, exploding once it hit the ground. Police cars flew and crashed, along with other vehicles, crashing into one another. The couple laughed, having watched the destruction they had caused.

         Oh, GAWD! We're so nasty! Stuart laughed hysterically. We're rich, Kevy-poo! All was well for the exceptionally dangerous, gay couple. Well, for only about another minute.

         Looks like we lost 'em for good, Stu, Kevin said happily.

         Im thinking we could flee to Tahiti with his money! That's when a clenched fist slammed through the roof of the car, causing the two to scream and Kevin to crash into a nearby tree. Kevin ignored the new pain, loaded his pistol, and hastily went out the car door. Who the hail did that? Sersly?! I'm gonna blast anyone's head off, if y'all don't tell me!

Afterwards

 

            honey! Get the money, the car is done-for.

         Good! Make it easier for me! a voice coming from the tree, which Kevin had recently crashed into. The two robbers frantically shot into the branches of the tree, causing the civilians to panic.

         Come out, faggot! Stuart yelled angrily, reloading his shotgun.

         A fist slammed against Kevin's face, knocking him out instantly. Stuart turned to see Super Jakey standing before him. Stuart squealed, trying to put more bullets in his shotgun. It was too late. Super Jakey punched Stuart in the nose, knocking him out cold.

         Super Jakey opened the trunk of the couples' car, took out the duffle bags of stolen cash, and set them by the car. The civilians cheered for him and attempted to grab him and touch him, just like any person would do when in the presence of a famous super hero. Super Jakey hovered in the air, so the civilians couldn't reach him. More cops had stopped by and gathered the bags of money, along with Kevin and Stuart. Keep paying your bills, citizens! And... Yeah! Have a good day! Before Super Jakey flew off, he had noticed a dark green 1993 Buick that was waiting at the stop light. It was Kyle driving Holly to school. Holly's car was probably still damaged from Evil Nacho's hot, molten cheese. Kyle waved at Super Jakey frantically. OH MY GOD I LOVE YOU! YOU ROCK!!

         Super Jakey found it frustrating that Holly didn't wave and scream, like a little girl, for his heroism. He did deserve it anyway, especially since he left her in a dumpster with an injured knee, as a form of saving her life. Super Jakey felt really guilty about that. However, when he saw her give him a smile and a little wave, he was no longer disappointed. That was the first time Holly had ever smiled at Super Jakey, but sadly, not at Jake Smithy himself. Super Jakey didn't care! He was too excited! Now, it was time for school.

 

         Jake walked across the school campus, feeling like he was actually going to make it to his first class on time. He felt rather peculiar about that. Ever since Super Jakey became a part of his life, Jake Smithy felt smarter, nicer, and responsible. Moral thoughts ran through his head, which seemed to give him a headache. He had other, more concerning, subjects to think about, other than how his moralities have become more positive than usual.

Chapter 14

Kyle waved, as they both walked towards him. Holly had a stern look on her face, and was not as enthusiastic as Kyle. Afterwards

Jake made a frustrated look.

The principal shook his head awkwardly (Kyle and Holly stood nearby, watching the conversation continue). Course you haven't! We're an agency that has to deal with paranormal activity of any sort. Activity such as, aliens, Bigfoot, the Loch Ness Monster, the planet Krypton, the last of the Time Lords, you name it.          Why, yes, the principal replied, but that's all rubbish.

         I'll bet, Jake replied, feeling guilty. 

Chapter 14

           

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            It was scary because I didn't know what was happening half of the time, you know? she laughed a bit. I also found it strange and hilarious, when that man, in the fancy suit, totally punched you in the face. He was one of the guys that arrived, shortly after Super Jakey and that monster destroyed all those robot dudes. I cant believe Greggory Stanley, from our band, was involved in that sort of thing. Jake pretended to react in shock. I'm fine, now. Once I reached the hospital, I got some gnarly stitches on my left calf. Holly rolled up one side of her pants to show a most disturbing scar, made by Evil Nacho himself.  The sight almost gave Jake a heart attack.

         Are you gonna be alright? Jake asked frantically, thinking of Holly's leg a hug, which would be completely unnecessary.

         Yeah, I'll be fine. Just a gnarly scar. It didn't even get infected, it just smelled like nachos for a while. You should have seen the dude that got me! He was about eight or nine feet tall! He also had these nacho chips growing all over his body! He was beastly. Oh! And Super Jakey was pretty badass, beating the tar out of the monster, too. Don't even get me started with the robot things!

         I think I've heard enough from the Kingzing City news team, Jake laughed. Turns out there were citizens recording me—I mean Super Jakey- on their mobile devices. The fights all on video!

         Yeah! It was really crazy, Holly laughed as Jake felt warm inside. Um, so I wanted to thank you for coming to my gig the other night. We raised about $500.

         DAMN! Jake hollered. That's amazing. Your outfit, by the way, was totally awesome.     

Afterwards

 

            With that leather jacket? That thing made me scorch up last night.

         You looked great up there. The whole band did.

         Holly laughed and smiled, looking up at Jake. He wanted to kiss her, but he knew she would beat the crap out of him in doing so.

         You've really changed, these past few weeks, she said. What is it?  Is there something youre trying to do?

         Jake shook his head, shrugging his shoulders. Not that I'm aware of. The only thing that's in my head is making amends with Kyle, after all I've put him through. Especially you, Holly. And Im sorry.

         It's 'cause you like me, huh?

         Jake started laughing nervously. Pffft! No! Course not!

         During school, one day, you told me you liked me, Holly said, crossing her arms. Busted!

         No I didn't, Jake insisted.

         Yes you did.

         Ha, kay.

         Holly laughed. Jake was actually keeping that easily-tempered tigress amused. Well, I better get to class.

         Oh man, same here. You want to talk later, maybe?

         Holly flinched when Jake asked that question and took a deep breath. She took out a piece of paper and pen from her pocket and wrote on it. Here. I can't believe I am doing this, but here's my phone number. I have another gig tonight with the group, so I cant hang out. Hopefully Greggory, or Nathan, will make it. Hes been unavailable a lot, recently. Well, now that I know what hes actually been up to, getting ahold of him shouldnt be hard.

         She gave the small piece of paper to Jake, who held it like he had just found the Holy Grail. He was about to shat all over the place. Um—tah dah, okay! Well, good luck tonight.

         Thanks. Hopefully that eight foot tall monster will stay the hell away from me. That's why I'm gonna be carpooling with Cody Gadomski, the bassist. My car is still in the shop. Its going to take a while. Thank God for insurance! It really sucks, though. Oh, did you hear about that? That nacho dude damaged my car with hot melting cheese? Ridiculous right?! Chip-throwing douche.

Chapter 14

 

         Well, I hope things really work out for you, Jake replied, stuffing the phone number in his pocket. That sucks about your car.

         Oh no, it's cool. I can just take the bus or get rides from people. I'm sorry about you and the baseball districts. Speaking of that, one more question, before we part.

         Jake looked at her. Yes?

         When you beat up Cale, your best friend, just to protect Kyle and Velouria, was that worth getting suspended for the rest of your senior baseball season?

         Jake nodded. I know Cale. He will put a lot more harm on people than I ever could. Of course that was worth it. I gotta make it up to Kyle, somehow, right?

         Holly looked at him, not smiling. Thank you, I'll see ya later.

         Jake watched her walk down the hallway, catching a few glimpses of her butt. See ya! Have a good one. He turned the opposite direction, staring at Holly's phone number. He felt like he was going to wake up from a wonderful dream, any minute now. He began making cheerful, loud, and obnoxious noises of happiness, as he ran through the empty halls of the school.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Just as he went around the corner, he saw Cale and Hayson Prent.

Afterwards

 

             Jake immediately stopped making the loud noises and carried one with his business. He could tell Cale and Hayson were staring him down. Jake felt guilty, even though the Kingzing City Rattlesnakes won the district game on the very same night when Jake was suspended for the rest of the season. Cale and Hayson were probably just as furious as Coach Sleeve was, however. They all passed each other, awkwardly, through the school hall, and Cale and Hayson walking the opposite direction. Jake had made it out of the hallway and made his way to the gymnasium. He had to talk to Coach Sleeve, in his office, to actually discuss what happened over a week ago, in full detail.

         He walked into the office, expecting to see Coach Sleeve. Someone else was sitting in the coach's chair. It was a girl, with perfectly platinum hair. She looked up at Jake, Can I help you?

         Yeeeaaaahhh, Jake replied, you're not Coach Sleeve, are you? Well, obviously, but where is he? You're his second substitute.

         The girl laughed. Heaven's no, I'm not Coach Sleeve. I'm his niece, sadly. He asked me to cover this class before he comes to the school.

         Um, why?

         I'm not sure. I asked him why and he said he didn't want to see a certain student, due to some circumstances from the baseball state districts the other night.

         Jake felt horrible. Could his favorite coach be avoiding him? Well, what are we going to do in class?

         I don't care, the girl laughed. Play dodge ball or something. Teaching a fitness class has nothing to do with life, whatsoever, so knock yourself out in doing whatever the heck you want to do. But hey, if it gets me $150, I'll do it. You can never go wrong with money, but, I'd rather much be rehearsing in my band.

         Damn, you play in a band, too? Jake asked surprised. A friend of mine plays in a band called The Nasty Pen.

         Someone from The Nasty Pen goes to this school?! the girl shouted. Who is it? Is it Cody Gadomski, the bassist?! He's such a babe!

         Um, no, Holly Ransfield. She goes to this school.

         The girl looked disappointed. Shiiieeettt. Well, that's cool, too. Holly's sure talented, but that Cody  MMM! Delicious.

Chapter 14

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Jake really couldnt care less. Well, that's nice. I'm Jake, by the way.

         The girl shook his hand. I'm Nikki. Nikki Wolf. Nice to meet you.

         Jake walked out of the office with a farewell and, since Coach Sleeve was gone, and Nikki didn't care what the students did, Jake decided it would be nice to shoot some hoops in the basketball court to think over some things. He went into the men's locker room to get his gym shorts on. He was alone in the locker room, once again; alone like he was when mysterious nacho cheese splattered onto the floor. He was no longer afraid of Evil Nacho, on another note. Jake only saw him as a dangerous monster, with signs of schizophrenia. Jake pulled down his pants, then he heard, Oh! Don't mind me, I'm just here to watch. Did your mommy teach you how to wipe?

         Jake squealed and turned around. It was Agent Nathan12! How the hell?! He stood there in the corner of the locker room, chewing on bubblegum.

         What the hell, dude?! Jake shouted, suffering from a minor heart attack.

         Just snoopin' around. It is my job, you know, Nathan replied. Just to snoop, snoop, and snoop. Like Snoopy, the lovable, mischievous dog. Although, he doesnt just snoop, he flies on his dog house. His dog house! Anyway, your name was Jake, right?

         Jake was stared at him blankly, with deep concern, and nodded. Can you leave, now? You're seriously creepin'.

Afterwards

 

            Oh, you'd love that, wouldn't you, Jake?

         Yes, I would love for you to leave. Would you like it if a random stranger, wearing a suit, just watched you change into your gym shorts?

         Nathan was silent. Touch, I best be on my way. Oh, and one more thing, Jake, I've got my eye on you.

         Nathan was gone, giving Jake the impression that the A72A Agent knew that he was Super Jakey. Great, Evil Nacho knew Super Jakey's true identity and it was quite possible that Nathan knew the same. Might as well tell the whole world, right?

Nathan went as far away from the school campus as possible, as he dialed a phone number on his cellular device. He held it up to his ear, he casually walked on the sidewalk, with heavy traffic passing by. A lovely, welcoming voice was soon heard on Nathan's phone.

         This is Captain Derno of the Area 72 Agency, we are temporarily closed, due to certain circumstances. But, if you would like to make an appointment, please press 'one.' If you would like to report any paranormal activity, please press 'two.' Pizza delivery? Press three.

         Derno, I know that's you! Nathan shouted. It's Agent Nathan12. I have a report about Kingzing City High School.

         Oh? Whatchu got? I really gotta save people's phone numbers.

            Uh, yeah, anyway! I haven't found anything, which had to do with space robots, out of the ordinary; especially no word from this Evil Nacho character. However, I have reason to believe that this 'Super Jakey' seems to be attending the high school, as a student. Captain Derno, sir, I think the powers of this Misara Serum have been embedded in the body of a normal teenager.

         Give me that! Preox's voice was heard, followed by the sound of a struggle, giving Nathan the notification that Preox had control over Derno's cellular device. A teenager?! Agent Nathan, are you sure about this? Super Jakey is a stupid, insignificant minor?!

         Im pretty sure, Mr. Alien.

         Don't call me that, cat face. This human teenager must be pretty stupid and what makes you believe that he's what we and the Adoa are looking for?

        

Chapter 14

 

         Hes got the same hair color, same body tone as Super Jakey. Oh, and his name is Jake. Agents are trained for identification of the body; like identifying if someone is in disguise or not. Say, for example, if we were assigned a mission to look for abominable snowman, we would be able to determine if its just a guy in a costume or if its the real deal. Anyway, Ive applied these feats upon the teenager and his posture is more than plainly obvious that hes actually Super Jakey.

         Preox gasped. Did you get a picture of him?

         Nathan blew a bubble with his gum. I did. Took it just before I punched him in the face, for having the suspicion that he was gonna detonate a bomb. I wish I could send it, but it seems you are all lacking communication, except for Captain Dernos old Dorkia phone. Seriously Captain, this is 2005, get a phone that can receive pictures!

         Before Preox could reply, another voice was heard. It was Rig. LET ME TALK TO NATHAN! I MISS HEEEEMMM!

         No! Rig, screw off! Preox shouted. More sound of struggle was heard. It was the sound of Rig trying to grab the phone from Preox.

         Listen, Nathan, never mind the picture. This dolt wont get off my leg.

         Affirmative, Nathan confirmed, I am glad I could help.

         GIMME THE PHOONNNE! NATHAN! I LOVE YOUR CO--.

         The phone conversation had ended, just before Rig said he loved Nathan's collar. The A72A was onto Jake Smithy, for sure. Nathan dialed on his phone, once again, and started to call. The Agent was now walking through a remote zone of the city, where there were hardly any urban inhabitants. The streets were old and ruined, the buildings were sad and abandoned. Where was Nathan going? If he were observing any suspicious activity, a remote area seemed to be applicable by the A72As standards.

         Ass face? came a voice through the phone.

         With French toast, Nathan replied. The phrases were a part of a code greeting.

         Agent Nathan12, said the voice, how was today's inspection at the high school?

         A little too well, Agent Jon43. We will discuss more, once I return to

Afterwards

 

            our temporary safe house. This place is as sketchy as it is.

         Sounds good, Agent Jon43 replied. Well, hurry back. We made a casserole. Nathan stopped walking and paused. YOU SERIOUS?! I'm on my way!!

         Nathan began to pick up the pace by going on a slow jog through the remote section of the city. He was sincerely craving a nice meal of casserole.

 

Meanwhile at Area 72.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

 

         Rig was feeling delightful, as he and Preox worked on the old Asid aircraft; the aircraft of which was surprisingly still intact, even after Adoa Probes attacked Area 72. Anyway, as for Rig's upbeat attitude, he decided to sing a song. When I said, 'I needed yoouu.' You said you will always staaayy. It wasn't me who changed, but you, and now you've gone awaaayyy. Don't you see that now you've gone, and I'm left here on my ownn, and beg you to come hooommme? You don't have to say you love me, just be close at hand. You don't have to stay forever, I will understand. BELIEVE ME, BELIEVE ME! I CAN'T HELP BUT LOVE YOU--.                                                      

Chapter 14

 

            Oh why can't the Adoa have better aim and just kill you already?! Preox shouted, harshly. Rig, I've put up with you long enough, especially since the day we fell into the ocean of this planet, weeks ago! For the love of GAWD, just please calm yourself?

         Come on, Preox, he's just trying to have some fun, Kriket came in with a smile.

         Yeah! Rig snapped. You is just jealous that I can sing Dusty Springfield better than you can!

         Kriket, don't encourage him, please? I'm not in the mood.

         Kriket spat, You're never in the mood.

         Preox looked up, shortly after connecting a few wires to one of the Retrievers guns. He activated his jet-pack and flew towards her. Oh, sister, I'm always in the mood. You think this is all for fun? In case you hadn't noticed, Common Kriket, a massive Adoa fleet is on its way to this planet; the humans have zero intelligence of what's happening; we are but five Asids, with no reinforcements, and one stupid Aziquet!

         Kriket looked at Preox, his eyes were full of anguish. Preox, I'm just messing with you. Im clearly aware of whats going on, but that doesnt give me any reason to be a hard ass about everything.

         And that's how the Adoa slaughtered so many Asids that day, Preox replied. We were too busy 'having fun' and we were almost annihilated by Zjok's unexpected attack. What makes you think we could have 'fun,' right now?  

         Kriket was silent. She only wanted to enjoy herself with others, as much as she could. After all, she did just escape Zjok's Elephant ship of terror, let alone the fact that she saw Oil, Rav, Querznem, and Bunny die, right before her eyes. I'm sorry, Magnate Preox.

         Common Kriket, bug off the both of you, while I work on this ship. It will be one of the only chances we got to reach the Adoa, in time.

         My, my, Admiral Bxir said as he walked into the picture. He had a cookie in his hand, which caught Rig's eye.

         Where you get that?! he shouted.

         Bxir laughed, finishing his cookie. In dah cafeteria, yeh spaz.

         Rig ran off, with Kriket slowly following. She was unhappy, indeed.

Afterwards

 

                     So when wheel human reinforcements git here? Bxir asked Preox.

            Within the next week, according to Derno, remember? Preox replied. This is ridiculous. The Adoa Probes attacked a few days ago, and your escape pod only just crash-landed here. The Adoa must be close, depending on their speed. They must be planning how theyre going to invade the planet, as we speak.

         Got dat right, Magnate, Bxir said, taking a bite of his cookie. I've heard so much, comin' from Adoa Mazers, as I scrubbed their rest areas. I sure hope we can git to Super Jakey, before thay do.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         I think it's nothing to worry about, Preox replied immediately. We will get there in time. If not, I'm pretty sure that super human can slaughter the hell out of the Adoa, with the deadly symptoms of the Misara Serum, of course.

         I wudn' be so sure, Admiral Bxir said with confidence. Tha fleet is substantial. Theyre familiar with these symptoms. They even have weapons in dealing with that matter. Super Jakey will need help. Also, Zjok army is massive, much more massive than it has bin.

         Preox closed his eyes and took a deep breath. Don't remind me that our enemy, the enemy we've been at war with for several years with a massive number, is about to invade this planet.

         Well, this ain't all abou' fun, right? Yew said that yourself tew the one you once loved. Am I right?

         Preox paused, thinking of Kriket. I still love her, you know that. It's something that I cannot concentrate on right now.

Chapter 14

 

            Well she has, boy, Bxir snapped. She bin thinkin' abou' yew ever since tha Adoa attacked tha planet Strom. She wonderin' if yew and Rig left tha planet wit' tha Serum just to abandon her, especially us. That bein me, Zitkir, Drox, and the others who culdn make it. And I know yew dun it fer tha war, but she was torn apart after you two got separated and yew left! If yew still luv her, Prex, then start showin' it. She needs someone to look up to, shes still an inexperienced soldier; not as experienced as you and I. Accordin to her, you seem tah make dah days go better when you is around. And I totally mean this in an offensive way, but seriously, shes crawling for you and you know that no other female would.

         Preox sighed. Affirmative, Admiral.

         Gewd. In tha mean time, try talkin' to Kriket, will yeh?

         Preox nodded. He had to admit, he did miss the hell out of Kriket. Over the past several years of his first war with Zjok and his Adoa Army, Preox had become more angry and moody, along with becoming more emotionally detached. He really needed to focus on what makes him happy. Admiral Bxir was one-thousand percent right about no other female falling for someone by the likes of Preox. Hell, Preox could admit that himself. Whether Preox had a pole up his ass, or wanted to play the serious game, no other Asid girl would be attracted to him. Bxirs harsh words made the Magnate realized how much of an ass, a lucky ass at that, he was really becoming. However, for those who knew Preox and his mode of portraying his personality, no one could really blame him for always having a temper. Kriket was completely devoted to Preox, like a desperate school girl, anxiously waiting for him to turn his stupid fat head to her attention. After becoming ultimately separated from each other, during the battle of the planet Strom, Kriket had hoped for Preoxs safety more than her own. Preox was paying too much attention to the war, not towards what made him truly happy. In doing so, this was slowly turning Preox into a raging war-monger. Kriket was not only concerned for Preox and his temper, she also did not want him to go completely overboard, which was as similar as Zjoks story when he betrayed the Asids. What Kriket really wanted to do for Preox was to just hold him closely and tell him everything was going to be alright. Preox would agree, of course, but there was more worry in him than everyone else.

Afterwards

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

           

 

        

 

         Derno's office was still on fire, which disappointed him. He took a fire extinguisher and sprayed out the remaining flames, which had lasted for a few days. His desk was split in two, papers and files were nothing but ashes, or just loose scraps of trash, and were roughly scattered all over the floor. Captain Derno set the extinguisher down and observed the room, taking slow steps.

         I worked hard on this office, he said to himself. Lots of decorating had been done. He took notice a picture, in a broken frame, which revealed him and a girl together. He picked it up, glancing at the photo. And those stupid robots had to ruin it all. Oh, how I miss you, Linda.

         Captain! came a voice, causing Derno to jump. It was a marine, holding his rifle and everything. Someone has been looking for you. Then, there was Agent Moosey17, his face with a blank expression. The marine was gone, once the talking moose approached Derno's office. He had certainly been through enough, which was through intense combat and being put down by everyone's harsh words. Nobody really listened to Moosey, especially when he had something important to say, even when he was actually right.

         What is it, Agent Moosey17? Derno asked. 

 

Chapter 14

 

         Just wanted to talk, Captain, the moose replied. He was emotionless. It's just that-- do you think it's the end of the world?

         Derno looked back at the picture he was holding, muttering Linda under his breath.

         'Kinda?' Moosey thought he heard. I sure hope it's not. I mean, we just made a discovery of many generations to come. A scary discovery.

            That's not what I said, but I get what you're saying. It's not gonna be the end of the world, Agent. We're just in for a bumpy ride, is all.

         When things get bumpy, I tend to throw up.

         Derno sighed. Moosey, please don't puke on my floor.

         Moosey raised an eyebrow. But, it's all burnt and torn--.

         I don't wanna watch you throw up. Can you do it somewhere else?

         Moosey groaned. Ugh, I'll try! 

         Derno watched Moosey wander off, walking on his four legs. I guess he really had to throw up, Derno thought to himself. He took another glance at the picture and quickly stuffed it in his pocket. His phone began to ring, once he had set the picture aside. He took it out and answered. Hello?

         Captain! came Nathan's voice. There was heavy gun-fire in the background, followed by a few screams. There's another one of those robot things, here! Must have missed out on the fun, from earlier, and now hes pissed! There was a loud blast of a Probe's laser, followed by the groan of an agent getting shot down.

         Damn! Everything alright, Agent Nathan12?!

         Not at all! Nathan hollered. Agent Randy39 is down. This robot is really starting to--. The phone had hung up, Nathan was gone. Derno's stomach sunk and his back shivered. Could that have been the end of Agent Nathan12?

         What was that? Moosey asked, returning into Captain Derno's office. Derno immediately turned to face the curious animal.

         Nothing, it was nothing. Some teenager making prank calls.

         Moosey spat What a fart, and left the room again. Captain Derno couldn't do anything to save Nathan. Area 72 was in Quebec, Canada and Nathan's location was in Kingzing City, Oregon. If Moosey knew about Nathan, he'd probably wail like a baby. Agent Moosey17 and Agent

Afterwards

 

            Nathan12 have been through everything together, starting from their first mission, as they both attempted to fish out the Loch Ness monster.

         Captain Derno managed to keep his cool and make his way out of his office, never to return, again.

            Meanwhile, in an abandoned warehouse.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            You shot my cell phone! Nathan yelled at the top of his lungs, as he took cover, behind a gross couch. I hate having to get a new one!

         Good, the Probe replied. A72A Agents fired at the alien robot, barely causing any damage to it. It's time you are rid of the information known!

         Well, that's not fair, we don't even know much! Agent Jon43 hollered.

         To me it's fair, the Probe replied, shooting its purple laser. Nathan took several deep breaths, as he inserted another magazine of ammo in his pistol. He heard the Probe had finally stop shooting, which made him a bit puzzled. It was dead silent, a little too silent.

         Um, Nathan? came a voice.

         Yes, Agent Sarah22?

         Take a look at this.

         Nathan arose to his feet, where he could see three dead agents surrounding the Probe. The Probe stood still, not moving and inch. The agents pointed their guns at the robot, making no hesitant movement. The Probe twitched its head and began to talk very slowly. Its voice was different, let alone clearer, than its original.

Chapter 14

           

            You think you know everything? the Probe said in Zjok's voice.

The agents stood there, dumbfounded. Nathan soon realized that someone else was in absolute control of the Probes.

         We certainly know a lot, Zjok's voice continued, especially when we can 'see.'

         What? Sarah blinked.

         Zjok grew frustrated. We have cameras in our robots, so we can see everything and I just wanted to let you know that, stupid humans.

         Sarah started laughing. Zjok made the Probe blast Sarah in the chest, sending her across the room. Nathan took a shot at the Probe's face-camera, destroying it instantly.

         Jeeezz, Jon exclaimed. Agent Sarah22 was gone, after Nathan checked for a pulse.

         Jon, do you have your cell on you? Nathan asked.

         Jon was shaking, traumatized. N-no. Moosey ate before we left.

         Nathan sighed. Well, whoever that was, he only gave us nothing but a warning. I don't like this one bit. Jon, keep an eye out for local media or law enforcement, I'm gonna look for a cell phone from the deceased agents, here. Jon nodded, taking a step outside the back door of the old, abandoned warehouse. There were destroyed software near where Jon was standing, software that was used for spying on Jake Smithy or any other suspicious activity. The Probe that was firing purple lasers earlier, seemed to have risen from the ground, according to the newly dug hole in the center of the interior of the warehouse.

         These bastards just love to surprise us. Nathan wasn't lucky enough to find a working cell phone from any of the dead A72A agents. All phones were damaged from the little incident that had just occurred. This was all over-whelming for Nathan, for he had never put up with anything this serious in his whole life, even when he had been with the Area 72 Agency for a number of years.

         Everything looks clear to me, Jon announced. What do we do now?

         Clean up this mess, Nathan replied. Get rid of everything. We don't want another one of those things tracking us down. And we certainly don't want any panic in the city if this gruesome scene were discovered. Help me?

Afterwards

 

            What're we gonna do with them? Jon asked, referring to the dead.

         Dump the Probe and the damaged software in the waterfront, nearby. As for the bodies, eat them.

         What?!

         Nathan laughed. I'm just kidding'! I actually have no clue what we're gonna do with the bodies. We're gonna have to bury them, or something. Come on Jon, help me out here. This robot must be, at least, over five-hundred pounds, in case you hadn't noticed.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Part 4:

New Discoveries

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 15: NO WAY!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

   

    With city lights, illuminating the streets of Kingzing City, the sun began to set over the distant horizon. Jake couldn't help but experience the calm weather, on the balcony of his father's apartment. He leaned over the balcony, observing the beautiful sunset over the city and the beach, which laid beside it

         Isn't that a great view? Jared asked, who was now standing beside Jake. Got it at the best bargained price any resident could ask for.

         You scored, Jake replied with a smile. You scored big time.

         Jared laughed. What's with you?

         I'm sorry?

         You've changed, buddy-boy. A couple weeks ago, you're a hormonal brat. Couple weeks later, you're a kid with moral values. Is life finally kicking you in the ass, son?

Chapter 15

 

         Jake shook his head. Nah, just learned to appreciate things more.

         Oh yeah? Like what?

         Well, you work hard to keep this place, to pay for the bills, to keep your car and my car (I will pay for the damages on my tailgate, by the way). You busted your butt to raise me for years, especially now that Mom is probably in a camp trailer with some white-trash loser, in Mississippi.

         Jared chuckled, smiled, and put his hand on Jakes shoulder. I think raisin' you is about half-way finished, then. Come on, I gotchu a little surprise.

         Aw, dad, it's not Valentine's day, yet, Jake laughed as he followed his dad back into the apartment.

         Watch it, zippy.

         They both walked into the kitchen and there was a clean plate of steak, waiting for Jake on the dining room table. Jake gasped with a low, frog-like mutter. Yew got meh STEEAAAKK?! Oh, Father!

         Its steak night, Jared replied with a smirk. They are the best steaks I could find. Theyre so rich, they might as well be illegal. Jake made another disturbing exclamation.

         Duuuudde!

         Jake gave Jared a big hug. He felt like he was celebrating his 19th birthday! Jake had never felt so good about himself, before. For the first time in his life, he felt like he was a good kid. Even before he was a total jerk, Jake had always thought of himself in that way, but this time it was with a different emphasis. Jake had never felt so good in his life, other than having sexual intercourse for the first time (That's another story). He immediately thought of Holly, whom he had hoped to—OH NO! Jake had Holly's phone number, now! He took it out of his jacket pocket and flashed it in the air, in front of Jared, laughing.

         Hey! There you go! You got a girl number! The old fashioned way, too, rather than asking for it online. Way to go, son. Ask her out, over the phone, now! Jake nodded, with the most ridiculous grin spread across his face.

 

 

NO WAY!

 

         But, for the love of God, Jared finishing, don't take a girl out wearing that expression. He smacked his son's cheek and walked off into the kitchen.

         Aren't you eating anything? Jake asked.

         Jared spat, as he took out his steak from the oven. Duh! It's a special night!

         Jake laughed, sitting down at the dining room table, taking the fork and steak knife beside his plate. Jared took a seat across from his son and did the same. How's everything, besides school?

         Jake already had a good portion of steak wolfed in his mouth, he was barely able to talk. Wellf. Ivf been finking aboutf somewun.

         Jared smirked. Oh, yeah? Who is it this time?

         Jake made a stern look. Her name's Holleef. She's diffrant.

         'Diffrant,' eh? How so?

         Jake swallowed his steak. She plays guitar, shes independent, shes cool, and she hates me.

         That's new, Jared said sarcastically.

         Jake gave him another look. I thought you were supposed to be nice, tonight?

         Jared laughed. I know, I know. Okay, keep going.

         Merrr... I'd rather not, Dad, thanks.

         Oh come on! Don't be a pansy.

         It's fine, Dad. She's just another girl, alright?

         Jared swallowed more cereal. Alright, Harold Hormone.

         Jake ignored that. How's work?

         Well, if you must know, it's certainly a lot better than being an elevator technician. You know how I'm afraid of heights. I like the house saling gig' a lot better.

          Jake laughed and took another bite of his steak. He looked outside, gazing at the beautiful city, lighting up the night. He could see a billboard with Super Jakey on it, in a combat pose.

         That dude, Jared said, referring to Super Jakey, is actually not all that bad. Did you hear about him taking down those two homosexual bank robbers? Heavy stuff. No one knows how Super Jakey does it.

Chapter 15

 

            Jake grunted. Uhh, maybe he has super powers?

         Watch it, bozo, Jared replied, pointing his finger.

         Jake laughed some more. I was there when it happened, Dad. Thats the main reason why my tailgate is all jacked up.

         Damn, you alright?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Yeah, Im fine, Im not in the hospital, am I? It was very startling, thats all.

         Well good, that means I dont have to pay for any more bills. You got that tailgate covered, right?

         Jake really wished he wasnt paying for his cars repairs, though he had plenty of money to splurge, thanks to his job. He was used to Jared taking care of everything. However, he did feel the need to be responsible, for once Jake nodded and drank his glass of milk, which was placed next to his dinner.

 

The Next Day!

         It was a lovely Thursday morning in Kingzing City. Men and women were ready to conquer the day, as others were ready to get their

NO WAY

 

            griping children ready for school, in a most positive attitude. Not really. Although, even the homeless were feeling the confidence that they will earn a decent amount of change, from the generosity of others. Thursday was going to be a great day for everyone, including Kyle. He was particularly in a fine mood, today. This was not just because he had a new, smoking hot girlfriend, but his public performance in Princess Bride was about to arrive! Kyle had woken up early, gathering announcement posters to post all over the school.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Chapter 15

 

            He would hang posters on doors, walls, in the bathrooms, on the urinals, you name it. This was Kyles final high school play and he wanted to make it very special. Although, other cast members of the production went around to hang up posters, also, but Kyle took this more seriously than they did. Kyle had just hung up a poster in the school cafeteria, when his loving girlfriend approached him with a bright smile on her face. If Velouria was here, that meant that classes were about to begin.

         Hey cutie, Velouria said sweetly, giving a tender kiss on Kyles cheek. Kyle started blushing and exclaimed like a penguin. Velouria laughed, as she gave him a gentle hug. How long have you been here?

         Kyle, as energetic as he could, replied, Ive been here since six in the morning. Im so excited for this play. The cast, Archibeque (the director), and especially me, not meaning to brag or anything, have put so much work into it. You better come! Friday, at 7pm!

         Velouria giggled. She was always giggling. Of course Im coming! I just cant come on the first night, sweetheart.

         Kyle began to pout and began to speak in French for no apparent reason. Pour quoi?! C'est la premire nuit, Velouria!

         Velouria giggled. I didnt know you spoke French.  And I know its the first night of the play, but I have to babysit my cousins. I will be at the next one, for sure. I promise. Tu es un drle de garon.

         She kissed Kyle on the lips, making him smile. Yes, but Im your funny boy.

         Youre such a dork.

         Yes, but I am also your dork.

         Velouria giggled again, as they kissed. How cute.

         Yeah, came a voice. It was Cale, walking by. He can be dork. As in, a whales penis. Ha! Cale snorted up laughter, as the couple stared at him, in disgust. They saw Holly walk into the cafeteria, in Cales direction. Her face was emotionless, as usual. Cale, as stupid as ever, decided it would be fun to pick on her also.  

         She began walking up to Kyle and Velouria, as Cale solemnly said, Hey, and Ransfield, you lookin good.

 

NO WAY!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Holly sarcastically giggled and completely ignored the buffoon. She approached Kyle and Velouria, as many other students came pouring into the cafeteria.

         Hey, lovebirds, Holly greeted with a smile. Kyle carried his posters around, as the trio went to get some of the cheap breakfast their school had to offer. They soon found themselves a tolerable area to sit and hang out.

         Did you see the posters? Kyle asked, full of glee.

         What posters? Holly replied, pealing an orange.

         Kyle scoffed and took a bite out of an apple. The play?! MY last play? The play of which I am in?!

         You guys are done with that already? Holly asked, shocked.

         Kyle shrugged. Its only been about a month and a half since I last told you about it.

         And you expect me to remember that? Just like you remember your lines, within a month? Holly laughed, taking some French toast covered in syrup.

         Kyle rolled his eyes. Well, will you be there? In the theatre on Friday? At 7pm?!

Chapter 15

 

            Holly sighed, as the three of them sat down at a table. I have band rehearsal every Friday night. You know that.

         Kyle whined out loud, along with Velouria giggling. You cant come either?!  You two are, like, my only friends ever. Ever.

         Velouria took a bite of her cinnamon roll. What about Jake?

         Kyle slapped his forehead with his palm. Of course! JAKE! Where is that lovely bowl of pasta, anyway?

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Holly shrugged. I was about to ask you the same thing. Kyle and Velouria both reacted suddenly, then looked at each other.

         Kyle, with a raised eyebrow, felt concerned. Uh, you okay Holly? Is there something in your French toast?

         No, Kyle. Im serious.

         Oh, wow. Thats sooo surprising.

         Holly laughed. Kyle, stop. I mean it. Have you seen Jake recently, Velouria? Ive been needing to talk to him.

         Kyle choked on his food. What?! Did you just say need?! You need to talk to Jake?! I mean, I love the guy, dont get me wrong, but, Holly, this is Jake Smithy youre talking about.

         Holly nodded. I know.

NO WAY!

 

            I havent seen him since baseball districts, Velouria answered, with a shrug. Im sorry, Holly. I havent heard from him, at all.

         Holly thought for a bit. Where could Jake possibly be and why does Holly need to talk to him?

         This is weird, Kyle said, after a few seconds, taking a sip of his chocolate milk. Are you planning on killing him?

         Its nothing, Kyle! Holly said, raising her voice. Forget I brought it up. And Im sorry I cant make it to your play. I promise, I will be there the next time it shows.

         The next show starts at the same time on Saturday, Kyle replied. Why cant you just skip rehearsal? This is my last play!

         The Nasty Pen is something I get paid for, Kyle. Im sorry.

         Kyle frowned. He was so excited for the play tonight. Not even my parents can make it. They both went on a business trip for the weekend.

         Velouria gave him a kiss on the cheek. Kyle, Im sorry. Ill be there Saturday, I promise.

         Kyle smiled. Thanks, hun.

         Holly smiled at the lovely couple, before she saw a familiar face in the distance. It was Jake, walking by himself. He was wrapping his up his headphones and inserting them in his backpack when Holly excused herself from the table.

         Kyle and Velouria watched Holly approach Jake, both filled with deep concern. Holly tapped Jake on the shoulder, causing him to immediately turn around, and jolt with surprise. Kyle and Velouria laughed out loud.

         Hes so nervous, Velouria said with a giggle.

         Look at him, Kyle said with a laugh, you can see him shaking from here! Hes about to faint. Okay, Hollys talking to him. Jakes already sweating, I can tell. Shes still talking. What a blabber-mouth. Okay, now Jakes talking, with a few nods. Huh, this is interesting.

         I wonder what theyre talking about, Velouria replied, holding Kyles hand.

         Okay, now Hollys leaving for class, I guess. And now Jake is just standing there with a blank expression.

 

Chapter 15

 

         What just happened? Velouria asked. Jake was, indeed, standing in one spot, his face as blank as a plain, white wall.

         I dunno, Kyle replied, lets find out.

         The couple hollered for Jakes name, as they waved their arms frantically. Jake looked up and saw the two and hastily walked to their table. He sat down, across from Velouria and Kyle, wearing the same expression on his face. He looked like he had just seen a ghost, if not something else totally horrific, other than Holly herself.

         Jake? Kyle said, feeling worrisome. You okay, bro?

         What happened with you and Holly, just now? Velouria added.

         Nothing too bad, Jake responded, with a sigh. She just asked me a question, I answered, and she went on through her day.

         Kyle was not convinced. Then why are you as white as my bed sheets? Are you okay?

         Jake looked down, his face was not visible. He looked like he was desperately refraining to start sobbing. What happened?!

         Are you okay, Jake? Kyle asked again.

         Jake looked up at the two of them, not crying. He faintly smiled, saying, She asked me out.

         And at that moment, when Velouria was drinking her chocolate milk, she spat all of it out, from her mouth, all over Kyles shocked face. Kyle calmly wiped the milk off of Velourias lips, and proceeded to wipe the milk off his face.

         Are you serious? Kyle asked, lowering his voice. Dude. What the hell did you do to get Holly Ransfield to do that?!

         Jake started laughing like a mental patient. Thats the thing! I did nothing! She walked up to me, asked me out, and left.

         What was your answer? Velouria asked, blankly.

         YES! both Kyle and Jake answered.

         Jeez, sorry. Just checking. Thats so awesome, Jake!

         I thought she hated me, Jake said, with pure happiness.

         Right on, my brother, Kyle replied. This is wayyy better than anything else, other than the play. Oh, go to my play, please!

         Jake was so excited, yet confused. Exactly, why did Holly ask Jake                

NO WAY!

 

         out to a casual date? Alright, bro, Ill be there. I got nothing going on Saturday night. Ill be there.

         Kyle squealed happily, so did Jake. Velouria couldnt help but laugh at the two goofballs.

         Where are you two going for your hot date, by the way?! Kyle asked, his smile growing.

         Jake responded, as if he were just dreaming. The Dookoran.

         Velouria and Kyles eyes widened.

         T-the Dookoran? Kyle stuttered. It was the first time he had stuttered in a long time. Jake, you do realize that The Dookoran consists of reservations that are backed up, from weeks to months?!

         Jake smiled brightly. She made reservations for tomorrow, almost a week ago.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Velouria felt like she was the guy of the group. She felt like she was watching two girls getting excited over a marriage proposal. Kyle and Jake screamed at each other excitingly, causing other students to stare at them strangely. This day felt so surreal, that it was definitely worth screaming for.

         Kyle shook Jakes hand, as the school bell started ringing. Well, sir, I wish you luck on this remarkable journey youre about to embark.

Chapter 15

 

         Jake nodded in agreement. With substantial gratification, my good sir! Well, I got Fitness class. You two have a good day.

         And YOU have a fantastic Thursday evening! Kyle shouted back. Jake began walking to class, with Kyle and Velouria walking in the opposite direction, together. Jake walked in a fast-paced motion to his class. He walked by the gymnasium and by Coach Sleeves office, whom was still absent. Jake finally concluded that Coach Sleeve was probably never going to show up to class again, especially once he saw the same substitute sitting at his desk. Nikki Wolf sat at the desk, watching crappy horror flicks, until Jake casually walked in the office.

         Hello, again, Nikki greeted. Jake couldnt help but giggle, like a child on Christmas morning. Whats that all about?

         I gotta date! Jake replied immediately.

         With Nasty Pen girl?!

         Jake nodded happily, as he let out a fart. Nikki started cracking up with laughter.

         Jake, who was ultimately embarrassed, calmly said, Thats just the happiness.

         Nikki nodded in agreement, continuously laughing. It sure sounds like it!

         Ha, yeah.

         Nikki finally stopped laughing. Well, I wish you luck, buddy. And if the dating continues, help me out with Cody Gadomski, alright?

         The bassist? Alright! No problem.

         Alright, Ill hold you to it, bro!

         Jake left the office and he couldnt stop smiling. Today just couldnt get any better than this. Well, for most people, anyway.

 

Three hours later- Kingzing City Clockwork Hotel

 

            Agent Nathan12 had just exited the shower when his co-worker, Agent Jon43, had changed the channel to the local news. The two agents were currently staying in a hotel in Kingzing City. It was better than staying in an

NO WAY!

 

            abandoned warehouse. Since the mission of spying on Jake Smithy was foiled, thanks to the Adoa Probes, Agents Nathan and Jons only resort was staying in the Clockwork Hotel. Nathans head was swirling, like a malfunctioning dish washing machine. He had just fought off one deadly enemy, which ultimately took down three A72A Agents. Now Nathan has been in combat before, but never has he seen so many people die in one day. It had been a day since the incident had happened and there was no questioning how Nathan, or Jon, had been feeling about the whole ordeal. They were both quiet, calm, and focused on leaving Oregon to get back to Quebec, even though Area 72 was currently a complete mess. They not only focused on getting back to Area 72, but to keep their lives from getting deceased, as well.

         I wonder why theyre not sending anymore of those robot things, Nathan said, as he dressed up in a new suit. It was a red tux with a black bow tie.

         Jon shrugged. Maybe its just a heads up.

         What do you mean by that, Agent?

         Well, maybe this Adoa sent those robot things to this particular destination to see what they could be up against? Before they actually invade?

        

        

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 15

 

            Nathan thought for a bit. Jon was actually onto something. You do have a point, but if they plan on invading the state of Oregon, do you think they could be invading Canada, also? Thats where Area 72 was attacked, also.

         Possibly, Jon said with a shrug. They, the Adoa, could be looking for something, also.

         Preox and Rig, Nathan replied.

         Im sorry?

         Ever since those aliens, Preox and Rig, showed up, all this nonsense started to happen. First, there was those two, then this situation with Super Jakey, and next thing you know, were getting attacked by hostile robots.

         You think they, Preox and Rig, have something to do with this? Jon asked.

         Im pretty sure. I dont know much. I left for this Super Jakey mission, before Captain Derno reported that Area 72 was attacked.

         Jon stood up from the bed he was sitting on. I know what we can do! Lets Skype them! Captain Derno still has his phone! SO LETS SKYPE!

         Brilliant idea! Nathan shouted excitingly, giving Jon a high-five.

         Jon reached into his backpack, which sat next to the bed, and pulled out his laptop. The two agents both sat at their table, calling Captain Derno on Skype.

         Its not working, Nathan said, with disappointment.

         Ugh, I gotta sign into Wi-Fi, first.

         Nathan laughed. Were so unprofessional.

         Jon began the Skype call, once again, and Captain Dernos face was on the screen. I didnt know I had Skype. This is new. Are you guys alright? The last time I heard from you guys was when you were in the middle of combat, I presume? I thought all of you guys were dead.

         DEAD?! came Mooseys voice in the background.

         Indeed, Captain, Nathan replied. My phone was shot at the moment I called you. We lost three A72A agents, sir. Its just me and Jon, now.

         Dammit, Derno simply said. Well, on the brighter side, were getting back up on our feet. We got Preox and Rig working on the space ship, and other Asids working on our communication systems. Yay.

NO WAY!

 

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Well, thats good, Nathan said with a smile. I just got back from swimming in the pool. I left there because the hotel has this event called Family Time, where they would play movies while the children would swim and the parents would chill in the hot tub. It got packed way too fast. It sucked.

         At least you got to swim, Derno replied.

         Anyway, we plan on returning to Area 72.

         Yeah, Derno laughed, dont do that.

         Why not?

         Derno sighed. Well, obviously, Area 72 is a mess and we will be arriving to you very soon.

         Jon smiled. Really?! Awesome! Does that mean the president is giving you guys more evac?

         Derno laughed painfully. Nope! He isnt able to until the next week or so. Were all going to be cramped in Preoxs ship.

         Nathan slammed his palm on the desk. But those Adoa dudes could be here any day, hell, any hour even!

         Derno sighed once more. I know, but Preox believes that the invasion will happen within the next two days, or so. In the meantime, I suggest

Chapter 15

 

            you two to have weapons ready. I believe wont have enough time to warn the mayor of Kingzing City, actually. So, prepare yourselves, Agents. I gotta get going.

         Nathan grunted. Alright, be careful out there, Captain. Well see you soon, hopefully.

         Derno laughed once again. Cross your fingers!

         Cross your fingers!!! Mooseys voice was heard again. The Skype call ended, leaving the two Agents unsure of what was to happen next.

         Well, Nathan finally said, wanna go get geared up?

         Jon shrugged. Sure. Lets go get some ammunition. Lots of it. Oh, lets go get something to eat, too.

         Nathan pat Jon on the back. You just read my mind, good sir.

 

         Five Hours Later – Smithy Apartment

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Maybe Im just going crazy, Jake said to himself. Ever since school started and ended today, Jake had been doing nothing but feeling nervous, talking to himself. He felt silly! He would talk to himself about why Holly would, without hesitation, ask Jake out on a date. Not just any date, however,

NO WAY!

 

         but a date to the fanciest restaurant in Kingzing City, The Dookoran.

         If Im not going crazy, Jake continued, as he paced back and forth in the living room, then this must be a wet dream come true! A powerful dream, at that! Ackpthablahahahaha! I gotta date. Oh, yes you do, Jake. You know why? Why Jake? Cause you is so handsome! Oh yes you are, mah boy! Mah buddy-boy!

         Jake was absolutely, undeniably, going insane. Never, in his life, did he expect this to happen. In all honesty, Jake felt like it was best to give up on Holly. To stop trying to win her over. It was rather intriguing, because the one moment Jake wasnt trying for Holly, the unexpected actually happened. This not only surprised Jake, but this absolutely confused the hell out him. He thought he knew all about Holly Ransfield. He couldnt be any more wrong.

         Jared walked in through the front door, taking off his jacket. He had just gotten off work. Hey, son. I got off work early today. Sold two houses in one day! If only your mother could see me now. Too bad that heartless wench wont be able to, ya know what I mean?

         I got asked out on a date, Daddy! Jake hollered. Jared stared at Jake, once he took his shoes off.

         Son, whats wrong?

         A girl asked me out, today at school.

         Jared flinched and closed his eyes, thinking that he was hallucinating. Arent YOU supposed to do that part, buddy-boy?

         Jake giggled, like a little girl. I know it sounds farcical, but she just randomly walked up to me and asked me to a date at The Dookoran. THE DOOKORAN, DAD!

         The Dookoran?!

         Yes!

         Jared approached Jake and gave him a huge hug. Oh, son! Oh, my wonderful boy! Do you have her number?

         Jake knew the answer to that, but he also found it quite coincidental that Holly also, and willingly, gave Jake her number without hesitation. This was way too good to be true, but Jake didnt care. He sat back and enjoyed the ride. Yeah, of course I do! Were going, tonight! Which reminds me, I gotta call her.

Chapter 15

 

         Do it, my boy! Jared shouted happily, as he made his way upstairs to his bedroom leaving Jake, in the living room, alone. Jake took out his cell phone and started calling Holly. His heart was racing, as if it were running a marathon.

         After a few rings or so, Holly answered, What?

         Hey! Jake shouted, not realizing in doing so. Um, exactly what time were you expecting our um

         Our date?

         Jake blushed. Yes, I was gonna say that. Ha!

         Want to pick me up around eight? My car is still in the shop. I can pay you back for the gas.

         Why?! This is a date. Youre not paying for anything, alright?

         Holly laughed a little bit. You sure?

         Jake smiled. That was the first time he had ever heard Holly laugh, without forcing it out of her mouth. Yes, Im positive.

         Perfect, Holly replied. Ill see you later, then.

         Jake was about to die with sheer affection. He was so happy and he wasnt exactly sure why Holly was doing this. Sounds great. Ill talk to you later.

         Bye, Jake.

         Jake had never really heard Holly call him by his name, either. Hes more used to her calling him an asshole, tool, or a monkey f*!&@*%ing c#$#%@ lover. This was it, Jakes dream was finally coming true.


 

 

 

 

Chapter 16: An Unsettling Start

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


   Zjok was a ferocious, dictating, and a most ambitious leader of the Adoa Military. His war tactics were merciless and demanding. Zjok, as far as most know, always had the thirst for dominance and power. Although, thats not how Zjok was always referred to as, not when he was enrolled in the Asid Military, so many years ago. Zjoks way of living was always difficult. In fact, some certain events that have occurred in his life have actually, and ultimately, pushed Zjok to a point where he betrayed the Asids and built an army of his own. Zjok wasnt always a ferocious, dictating, and a most ambitious leader. In fact, he always had a heart of being happy and the enjoyment of being who he was, similar to the characteristics of Kyle Manning. He was a happy, a most intriguing, yet determined asset to the Asid Military. That was until he was finally pushed over the edge, causing his anger to break loose and become the heartless ruler he is now.

Chapter 16

 

 

Planet Suzia – Almost 30 years ago

 

         Preox, Ive waited one-hundred years for this moment, Zjok said, with a smile spread across his face. He and Preox, both looking much younger than they are now, were standing in front of a massive structure before them. The structure was built out of pure comet, made to look like it was built from glass. There was foreign, Asid, language in carved letters, which was translated as The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building.

         Preox stood by his best friend, who happened to be carrying dome-shaped containers, which carried his belongings, and pat Zjok on the shoulder. Here we are, old chum, The AKBHE Building.

         This building would be the center of Zjok and Preoxs first years serving the Asid Military. It would take Preox and Zjok another 20 years before they would voluntarily serve as The AKBHEs service Team Leaders.  In easier terms, after training for 20 years, the two Asids would become drill sergeants, before they were to actually become Privates. Not as similar as how the human army would function, but anyone with a low IQ should be able to understand that.

         Zjok, in his younger years, was skinnier than Preox, who happened to be more masculine and active. Zjok had always wanted to not only serve the Asid Military, but it has been his passion to command and create new ideas for warfare. For Zjoks lack in body mass and intelligence, he was often ridiculed and harassed by other Asids, alike. Preox, on the other hand, was passionate for defeating the enemy, which most Asids took a liking for. Asids always appreciated direct heroism and super soldiers. Preoxs mindset was always persistent. However, during his early years, Preox could actually maintain his anger. Of course, this was before Rig entered his life.   

         The younger Asids (Ranging from 100-150 years old.) would camp inside The AKBHE, where they would spend a number of years training for combat, commandment, and piloting. The Asid students would be sleeping in

 

An Unsettling Start

 

            an empty room with one small trapdoor to store belongings. Inside that room, during resting hours, Asids would have to sleep through different environmental weather conditions. Weather such as colder temperatures with rain, snow, or ice, and weather such as hotter temperatures with droughts, sand, or just plain dry humidity. Its a unique strategy to train Asids to sleep through environments, which they may face if they were to rest outside, during a conflict of warfare.

         Preox and Zjok made their way through The AKBHE, where they were escorted, with other young soldiers, by Asid Team Leaders. The room was massive enough to store over a hundred Asids. The room was obviously empty, due to the fact that no climate had been activated. About a hundred of young Asids made their way in, what most would call, The Storage in search of an appropriate place to store their belongings.

         Welcome to The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building,

you Klondikes! shouted one of the two team leaders at the top of his lungs. In your trapdoors, once you brats get all situated, you will find a used Vambit, which you will borrow (You will not earn your own customary Vambit, until your twenty years of education is complete.)

         You will also find, in your trapdoors, a blanket, a pillow, a storage container to store personal belongings, food, and water. Do not, and I repeat, DO NOT wolf down all of your food within one day. Your food is limited to last for a month and we will NOT give you food, until that month is over! If a fellow Asid is starving, help him or her out. Reserving food is also another tactic of training you, especially if supplies were to become scarce. Write that down, kids. The Team Leader turned to the other. Is that all?

         Our names, the other Team Leader responded.    

         Oh, right. You ugly Klondikes will be calling us by Ravoc Ritnop and Ravoc Frit. Im Ravoc Ritnop. Do I make myself clean, ASIDS?!

         All the Asids responded, ALWAYS, RAVOC RITNOP!

         Uh huh! On another note, you are all expected to get five hours of sleep and prepare to be sleeping in the rainforest, within the next hour. You are dismissed.

        

 

Chapter 16

 

            The two Team Leaders left The Storage, allowing young Asids to get themselves situated. The Storages floor was perfectly constructed out of aluminum, until blue grass was growing out of it.

            Zjok knelt down, examining the grass, with sheer fascination. Wow, its really turning into a rainforest. Preox, this is great!

         Preox grew frustrated, as a tree began to grow within seconds, in front of him. Well, I was going to sleep here, but this stupid tree had to start growing. Did you open your trapdoor yet?

         Zjok shook his head, as he proceeded to open his trapdoor to find food and other supplies, which Ritnop had mentioned before. Zjok pulled out a granola bar and started eating it. He was quite satisfied with the current position that he was in.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         The two best buddies had set up their rest areas, as The Storage was looking more like an actual, exotic rainforest.

         Preox, who camped next to Zjok, took out his container full of water and faced his friend. A toast, my dear friend, to a new beginning. Not just a beginning, but an amazing start.

         Zjok smiled, and clinked his water container next to Preoxs. Cheers, buddy. They took only but a sip of their water and stored it back their trapdoor. The Storage was not as empty as it was before. The climate began to feel as real as ever, the was getting colder, there were over a hundred

An Unsettling Start

 

         Asids fully occupied, and the entire room was filled with wet grass, trees, and dirt. The sky was very convincing, also.

         It looks like were really looking at Suzias night sky, Preox said, with a chuckle. Then, actual rain began to fall from the ceiling of The Storage.

         Wait til they start using the much colder and hotter climates, came a voice. It was an Asid, who happened to be camping in front of Zjok and Preox. Theyre just letting us off easy because its our first night in The AKBHE. Im Oil, by the way.

         Preox and Zjok shook his three-fingered hand and introduced themselves.

         Before they could talk to each other any further, as it really began to pour heavy rain, several other Asids came walking by. They were larger in muscle-tone, larger than Preox himself. They began to laugh, as they pointed at Zjok. Since when did they start recruiting pencil-shaped-type, here?

         As mentioned before, Zjok has a history of constantly being ridiculed and being made fun of. Zjok didnt say anything, though Preox did.


Chapter 16

 


            Oh why dont you get off and kiss it?

         One of the bullies approached Preox, who was standing before him. The Asid was much taller than Preox, though that didnt intimidate Preox one bit. What was that?

         You heard me, Asid, Preox replied immediately. His glare towards the taller Asid was angry, but respectable by Zjoks standards.

         The Asid laughed, Preox could tell that he offended him regardless. Do you have any idea who I am?

         No, Preox said, keeping his glare, and I have no interest in knowing, just like you shouldnt have any interest in calling my friend names. Now, either you apologize or screw off, with your buddies, and never talk to us again.

         The Asid laughed again, followed by his posse. What if I dont?

         Ill have your knee caps.

         The Asid scoffed, like a spoiled, rich school boy. Is that a threat? Hows about you repeat what you said to me earlier, after I called that freak friend of yours a pencil?

         Preoxs anger began to rise. At this point in time, it was rare to see Preox in a higher temper. It was almost too unnatural, in fact. I said, Oh why dont you get off and--. The Asid threw a punch at Preox, but he was able to catch it in the palm of his hand. Did I offend you, Asid? Just like you offended my friend, Zjok, here?
