         Oil was looking up at Preox, his eyes were wide, unlike Zjok. Zjok was silent, for he was quite used to this sort of conflict. Preox held the Asids fist in his palm, as he tried to let it free.

         Now, Preox began, I want you to leave.

         The Asid let his fist go and laughed. You can call me Setil. Come on, Asids! The group of Asids left Preox, Oil, and Zjok, with Preox standing in the exact same spot.

         Wow, Oil simply exclaimed. Uh, Preox, do you have any idea who that was?

         Whoever he was, he was Pissing Me Off.

         Thats Ravoc Ritnops younger relative.

         Preox did not react. So? He was picking on Zjok, I wasnt

An Unsettling Start

 

         going to just sit there. Asid Military Text of Fine Respect, chapter eighteen, section three-point-five, paragraph three: Bullying is absolutely not tolerated, under any circumstances. Those who are caught in these acts are a disgrace to the Asid Military and must be replaced, immediately. Rising up against and self-defense is highly suggested.  I know my stuff, Oil.

         Zjok was already sleeping when it began to constantly rain. Preox knew that Setil was not going to be a friendly asset, during his and Zjoks military journey.

 

Five Hours Later

         Ravoc Ritnop and Frit burst into The Storage, banging pots and pans. WAKE UP, ASIDS, YOUR FIRST DAYS OF TRAINING ARE NYE, STARTING TODAY! YOU GOT THREE MINUTES! LETS MOVE IT! GO, GO, GO! AGGHHHH! GOTTA LOVE THE ADRENALINE; I THINK I JUST POPPED A BLOOD VESSEL!  

         YEAH! Frit added. She rarely spoke.

         Young Asids were hesitantly rummaging through their things for what to bring for the day. The rainforest began to dissolve, making The Storage look like a massive, aluminum, empty, container once again. Today was going to be extremely productive for Preox, Zjok, and Oil. They were going to learn the basics of combat.

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chapter 16

 

            Do you think well get to use our Vambits? Zjok asked Preox.

         Indeed not, came Frits voice, she was taller and covered in armor (Young Asids mostly wore neon-pink clothing) You will be working on basic fighting skills, such as punching things and all that.

         Setil, whom of which was walking by with his things, pushed Zjok. Yeah, retard.

         Preox was about ready to charge at him, but Frit stopped him. Asid, were not going to be having any of that, are we?

         Negatory, Ravoc Frit! Preox shouted.

         At rest, Asid. Setil is a meat head who doesnt understand what we do here, yet. I know you follow the text, but please leave Setils actions up to us.

         Zjok didnt hesitate to ask, Is all of our training going to be intense like this?

         If youre not exactly ready for it, Frit simply answered. The hardest moments of your life will take place in this very building. Zjok gulped. He was so passionate about what he was enrolled with, though he wasnt so sure if he was exactly ready.

         Preox pat Zjok on the shoulder, You got this, Asid.

         Zjok smiled weakly.

         Zjok, in his younger years, was always full of assumptions. Assumptions that other Asids were always against him, if not simply paranoid. He was also often depressed. Its something that always came natural to Zjok and he had moments where he absolutely could not take it anymore, moments that were certainly unvoiced. In other words, whenever Zjok had a problem, he would never talk about it with others.

         Zjok, Oil, and Preox were to train in a room, with four Probes. Thats right, Probes. Although, this was a time before Probes were used as deadly weapons, by the Adoa. During this time, they were often used as target practice when training to fight against the Asids enemies. The Probes were all situated in a line, facing a group of twenty Asids, including Preox, Oil, and Zjok, of course. None of the Probes were equipped with deadly rifles, though with typical robotic arms.

          

An Unsettling Start

 

            Today, came in a voice of another fellow Asid. It was Admiral Bxir. Yew unlikely Klondikes wheel be trainin against these Probes to practice yer close combat skeels. We know this is yer first day trainin at Tha AKBHE, so we wont be surprised if yall suck at this. If you suck from here on out, thas okay, yew wheel most likeleh be moar efficient with commandin ships or even flyin a ship! So dont bitch an moan, please? Now, getcher filthy selves out dere and kick some bootang!  

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Four out of twenty of the Asids were assigned to one of the four Probes to begin their training. Zjok, unfortunately, was assigned with Setils Probe, as Preox was assigned to a different one. Zjok watched Setil and Preox practice their basic fighting skills against their Probes, doing a remarkable job at doing so. Everyone else seemed to be doing exceptionally well.

         Once Zjok had went up to his Probe to fight it, he didnt do as well. The Probe actually ended up slamming its robot fist against Zjoks jaw. All the Asids laughed, other than Preox and Oil. The Probe was set to Level Lamna, the lowest skill set programmed on a Probe. Level Lamna, in other words, was the easiest setting to fight a Probe, which made things more embarrassing for Zjok. Level Ion was the highest skill set.

         He cant even dodge a hit, Setil laughed. Zjoks jaw hurt horribly after training with Probes for the first time. The rest of the day didnt go so well, either. Zjok, as skinny as he was, was completely out of shape and wasnt as fast-paced as the other Asids. Especially when it came to running through the obstacle course. Although, there was one shining moment for

Chapter 16

 

            Zjok that not all Asids got to experience. This occurred about a couple months after his first day in The AKBHE.

         Zjok was alone, with another Asid Magnate. Zjok sat in front of a massive table with holo-graphic ships. There were two teams of ships, both representing an opposing army, on either side. There were also holo-graphic dots on the table, indicating holo-graphic infantry.

         Alright, Zjok, said the Asid. I am Magnate Claknibox and I welcome you to your first day in commandment training. You will begin on Level Lamna, where you will be competing against another young Asid, like yourself, who is also in the other room next to us. You will know who your opponent is, until the training is over. You will be commanding the opposing fleet, as the other Asid will be commanding the other. For motivation, your goal is to get your infantry past your half of the board, in order to dominate your opponent. Remember, you only have a limited number of ships and troops to command. This session will end, until there is a winner. Good luck.

         Zjok nodded. My thanks, Magnate. His face was scratched and beaten from all the times he had been training. He has failed numerous times and he wasnt in the mood to be a failure again. Or so he thought. He felt like crying because he was so upset. Just before he was going to think more negative thoughts, he saw opposing fighter ships attacking Zjoks holo-graphic fleet. Under the surveillance of Claknibox, Zjok took the controls of his fleet and began attacking blindly. Then, something sparked inside of Zjoks head. A spark which consisted all the anger, sadness, happiness, and determination in his head. Zjok knew exactly what to do now.

          The training session consisted of gaining points and the more points a trainee would receive, the more power-ups the trainee would get. Sort of like a video game. Zjok concentrated, sending in a number of ships to drop off more infantry to keep the opponents from crossing Zjoks side of the board. Zjok noticed that opposing fighters were wiping out Zjoks infantry. Zjok sent several fighters on each side of the board, taking out the opponents. This resulted in Zjok gaining more points and his opponent losing more points. He smiled with intentness, once he realized that his infantry was getting closer to his opponents side of the table.

An Unsettling Start

 

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

            Zjok was enjoying this all too well. The loud dinging of a bell occurred and the board revealed holo-graphic text labeled, Power Up! He tapped on the text, showing a holo-graphic mother ship. Zjok heard Magnate Claknibox gasp in surprise. Zjok activated the mother ships weapons, which resulted in purple laser blasts and purple lightning. Before Zjok knew it, his infantry had crossed to the other side of the table and the training session had ended immediately. Confetti rained down on Zjok, with a robotic voice shouting, Congrats! You won! Please take your winning tickets!

         We dont give out tickets anymore, Claknibox said. Anyway, congrats, Zjok. Impressive work, I must say. Not many Asids can activate power-ups on their first training session. Splendid work, Asid. You are now dismissed.

         Zjok left the room before he would grin, like an idiot. Before he could give himself a personal celebration, he saw Setil walk out of the other room.

         You, he said. How the hell did you do that, cheater?

         I didnt cheat, I just played by the rules. I beat you. All is fair.

         Nobody beats me, Setil stated, approaching Zjok. Especially not from a scrawny, little cheater like you. You got that, buddy-boy?! Setil pushed Zjok, which made him back up a few feet. The bully laughed. You

Chapter 16

 

         weigh lighter than a moose! Whatre you gonna do about it? Zjok didnt say a word. Huh?! Come on, you pansy!

         Zjok was getting more than just upset. He was getting pissed, just like Preox would. Knock it off.

         Setil laughed and before he could say another word, Zjok decked him in the face. His punches wouldnt be as effective as what Setil had. Setil continued laughing as he slammed his fist into Zjoks gut. He gasped for air, but couldnt once Setil kneed him right in the forehead. Zjoks flailed body went backward on the floor, with Setil laughing at him. Youre so pathetic. Might as well kill yourself now. Look at yourself! Setil left Zjok, laying in the empty hallway of The AKBHE Building. Zjok coughed up some neon-pink blood. Then, he began to sob. His negative thoughts of being worthless came back to him, once again, pulling him deeper of his deadly mindset.

 

Five Minutes Later

 

         After a dreadful moment of sobbing, Zjok made it back to The Storage, where it was chilly and full of snow. The environment was set to a forest in the winter season. All the Asids were looking up at the sky, where a television screen illuminated the whole portion of the room, with a dim. The television showed as to why the Asids had a longing for protection, domination, persistence, and destiny, all of that crap.

 

         Zjok wandered through The Storage, his mouth still bleeding. Some of the other Asids had noticed the disturbing sight of Zjok, though decided not to help him. Zjok felt worthless. He succeeded once today, but the fact that he had failed yet again poisoned his brain. Zjok found Preox, Oil, and the recently acquainted Zitkir, at their little camp site. A green fire was blazing, keeping the Asids warm, just like all the others. Preox took his eye off the massive television screen, looking up at Zjok. Done with training? Took you a while. Whered you get the wounds? Preoxs face was beaten also, but that

 

 

An Unsettling Start

 

            was due to the fact that he was training in the combat zone for today.

            Ah, its just from all the training this week, Zjok said quietly. Before he could sit down, Preox stood up and approached him. Your mouth is bleeding, Z. What happened? I know you werent doing any combat training today, so dont lie to me. What happened? Zjok coughed, getting a few drops of blood on Preoxs suit. Zitkir and Oil were looking at them.

         Are you sick, bud? Zitkir asked.

         Zjok didnt say a word, just took deep breaths. Preox stared at his eyes and immediately made an angry expression. He knew exactly what happened. I thought I told that Setil to back off.

         Seems like he hasnt for the past two months, Oil replied. Look at him. Zjok was blank and emotionless. Preox started marching his way to Setils camp, with Zitkir and Oil hesitantly following him.

         Uh, Preox, I wouldnt, Zitkir said, trying to stop his buddy.

         Oh, come off, Preox scoffed, if someone messes with Zjok, that someone is messing with me.

         Preox found Setils camp and kicked over all of Setils things. Asids around them became startled. You had to do it again, Asid?!

         What the hell, Asid?! Setil shouted. He decided to play stupid. Whats the big idea?!

         Preox shoved him. Oh, shut it, you blithering cretin. I told you to back off from Zjok.

         Setils group of Asids stood up, ready to bring Preox down to the ground. No, dont, I got this one.

         All the others exclaimed, as the Preox and Setil stood in front of each other, their fists clenched.

         You shouldve backed off, Setil said, giving Preox a grin.

         Shut your fat-ass mouth and throw a punch, already, Preox replied with disgust. Setil went to tackle Preox. Wrong move, moron! Preox swung his fists, clenched together, and slammed them in an upper-cut motion on Setils face. Setil moaned and quickly got up, trying to trip Preox. Preox hopped and kicked the bully in the chest, sending him backward in the snow. Some Asids were chanting for Preox, as they watched him beat Setil over and over. No matter what move Setil made, Preox owned him.

Chapter 16

 

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         Setil had been beaten, by the time Ravoc Ritnop came and pulled Preox away. The hell you doin, Asid?! This is MOVIE NIGHT, not FIGHT CLUB! What makes you think its okay to wail on my younger blood, Asid?!

         Preox broke loose from him. RRGH! He will not stay away from Zjok! I dunno if you noticed, Ravoc, but his face has been beaten for as long as I can remember!

         Youre supposed to have wounds, Asid! hollered Ritnop. Its all a part of the training process! Its a sign of achievement. And who cares about what condition Zjok is in?! He hasnt said a word about it, has he?

         You cant expect hes okay if he doesnt say anything! Did you not read your copy of Asid Military Text of Fine Respect?!

         Ritnop scoffed. Youre supposed to be helping other Asids out, not beating them! Thats what it says in the text, right?

         I was helping Zjok! Preox shouted. Your idiot brother should know this too. Oh, but wait, he cant read can he?!

         Ritnop swung his fist, knocking Preox down to the ground. Thats two days in the Detention Precinct, Asid Preox. Preox barely got up, before  

 

An Unsettling Start

 

            Ritnop took him by the arm and began escorting him.

            Preox looked at Zjok, his face was beaten more than it was before. Zjok, the next time Setil taunts you or hits you, fight back dammit! Kill him if you have to!

         When Preox said to kill, he meant in a sarcastic way, to boost Zjoks momentum, for once. Oh, and did that boost Zjoks momentum, indeed. According to Zjok, actually killing Setil sounded like a most vigorous idea.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Planet Suzia – 22 years After the Preox and Setil Incident

         Zjoks first decade attending at The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building has been real hell. The constant battle of fighting his overwhelming emotions made it difficult for him to focus on his pursuit of becoming Magnate Zjok. Alas, Zjok had made it possible to overcome this, once he had become a Private. Once Zjok became a Private, Setil been moved to a different section of The AKBHE Building. Thank God.

         After another 2 years, and eventually fighting in a couple battles against common enemies, Preox and Zjok had become 2nd Class Envoy Officers.

Chapter 16

 

            Now, it is 22 years after Preoxs conflict with Setil, which is also almost a year before Zjoks unexpected uprising.

         Today was a very special day for Preox and Zjok, for today was their first day serving as Team Leaders for The AKBHE. Zjok, in particular was thrilled about this event. For the past 22 years, Zjok had been getting stronger, faster, and more efficient in his military status. Today couldnt possibly go wrong. Newer, and younger, Asids entered The Storage, which was completely empty.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Preox, who was in a full suit of armor and was wearing his very own certified Vambit, hollered at the young Asids to grab their attention. Welcome to The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building,

you Klondikes! Preox shouted at the top of his lungs. In your trapdoors, once you brats get all situated, you will find a used Vambit, which you will borrow (You will not earn your own customary Vambit until your education is complete.). You will also find, in your trapdoors, a blanket, a pillow, a storage container to store personal belongings, food, and water. Do not, and I repeat, DO NOT wolf down all of your food within one day. Your food is

 

Chapter 16

 

         limited to last at least a month and we will NOT give you food, until that month is over! If a fellow Asid is starving or facing ANY OTHER CONFLICTS, help him or her out! You are all a team! If you fail to do this and youre found guilty, I promise I will beat you and send you to the Detention Precinct! You will also call us Ravoc Preox and Ravoc Zjok! Do I make myself crystal-clear, Asids?!

         The young Asids responded, ALWAYS, RAVOC PREOX!

         Good! Expect The Storage to transform into a rainforest, within the hour! You are all expected five hours of sleep! See you tomorrow, you are dismissed!

         The new Team Leaders began to exit, as Zjok noticed some of the Asids looking at him. Some were even smirking at him and giving soft laughs. Zjok gave them a sharp look to cease them from smirking. Zjok was not going to be made fun of, any longer.

         Ravoc Preox! came a voice. It was a more feminine voice, innocent. It was the first time Preox had ever heard Kriket call his name.

         Yes, Asid Kriket? Preox responded. Kriket looked at him in a way that she would look at him forever. From this moment on, Kriket had a huge crush on Preox, despite the fact that she was 100 years-old and Preox was 121.

         I-I cant find my water container, Ravoc, she stuttered. She knew exactly where that water container was. Zjok knew she was up to something insidious.

         Preox sighed. He didnt seem to show her any affection, at the moment. Asid, its in this trapdoor! I assume that this is your trapdoor to store your belongings, am I correct?!

         Kriket had paused, gazing into Preoxs eyes. Uh, yes, Ravoc.

         Zjok started laughing a bit, causing Preox to face him. Whats so funny, Z? Zjok shrugged and kept quiet, looking around at the other Asids that are getting all situated. Preox knelt down Krikets trapdoor and opened it. What the hell, where is it? Zjok laughed silently because he knew Kriket was messing with Preox. As Preox stuck his head inside the trapdoor, looking for Krikets stupid water container, Zjok watched Kriket write down the code

 

An Unsettling Start

 

            embedded on Preoxs Vambit, on her hand. She looked at Zjok, with a gleaming smile (The code embedded on Preoxs Vambit was his communication code. It was basically as similar as having a phone number.) Zjok kept quiet for her, trying his hardest not to laugh his ass off. Preox rummaged through Krikets trapdoor for another few seconds before he finally found the water container.

         It was almost as if someone just decided to deliberately hide it in there! Preox hollered frustratingly and gave it to Kriket. Remember, we have a neat fountain to refill your container with.

         Kriket laughed. I know, Ravoc, thank you.

         Preox laughed a bit, also, with a smirk. Youre dismissed, Asid, we will see you tomorrow.

         Kriket bit her lip as she watched Preox and Zjok leave, beginning to get more situated, before the rainforest was activated. Preox went to a control panel, next to the entrance of The Storage, and dialed a few buttons. There we are, Zjok, the rainforest is now activated. Lets head back to our rooms. What was so funny, earlier?

         Zjok snickered. All I know is that youll get a surprise, sooner or later.

         I hope so, Preox replied, laughing. I need a break.



 

 

 

Chapter 17: Everything is Fine

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Preox found it quite peculiar about Zjoks silly behavior, after they had stumbled upon Kriket. He didnt let that bother him for too long, until about three hours into his sleep duration. Preox slept in the same room as Zjok, sleeping in luxurious beds. Much better than sleeping through environmental changes in The Storage. The two Team Leaders kept their Vambits stored in their very own high-security cabinet, which also contained their full suit of armor and weapons. Although, the cabinets werent exactly sound proof.

         The sound of an obnoxiously loud rock tune alarmed Preox from his bunk, awakening immediately. This made Zjok wake up, as well.

         What the hell is that? Zjok said weakly. He did not want to be woken up.

 

Chapter 17

 

            Rrrggh, Preox grunted. Its my Vambit. What does Admiral Bxir want now?

         Preox weakly approached his high-security cabinet and opened it, after swiping his index finger in a crisscross motion. The rock music got louder, once the cabinet opened, causing Zjok to cover his face with a pillow. Preox set his Vambit on his bed and activated its main controls. The rock music stopped, finally. A holo-graphic screen appeared before Preox, as he stood in front of his bed. A small selection of holo-graphic buttons was on the screen, asking whether to answer the incoming call or ignore. Preox found it strange that it wasnt Admiral Bxir, who actually wasnt calling him. Full of curiosity, Preox selected answer the incoming call.

         It was Kriket. Her young face filled the screen. Preox was surprised, gasping in shock, as he whispered. What?! Asid Kriket! Whatre you doing?! Youre not supposed to be using your Vambit, yet! Im gonna have to report you.      

         Kriket laughed. Preox could see that The Storage had completely been transformed into a rainforest. We both know you wouldnt do that, Ravoc Preox.

         Oh?! Dont test me, Asid. I am your Team Leader. You either hang up now, or spend two days in the Detention Precinct! How the hell did you figure out to use a Vambit, anyway?!

         Have you ever had relatives who once served the Asid Military? Kriket asked with a smirk.  

         Preox shook his head. Im one of the first of my relatives to attend The AKBHE.

         Wow, really? Well, Im the second Asid to--.

         Yeah, yeah, I get it, Preox interrupted. Now, how did you learn to use a Vambit, considering its your first night at this facility? I want some answers, Asid.

         Kriket sighed. Well, since Im the one who called you, one of my ancestors was Kranzir Blorton and my other relatives have kept his Vambit, since his death. I learned to use a Vambit, based off Blortons.

         Preoxs eyes widened. His attention was completely caught. Nuh uh! The Kranzir Blorton?! The savior of our race?! Youre related to him?!

Everything is Fine

 

            Kriket nodded with a smile. Yep! And my relatives used his Vambit for everyday use. Of course, the Vambit is a much older model. The one Im using now, Im still getting used to.

         Preox gasped again. Your family is naughty!

         Kriket laughed. Yeah, all of my relatives, including me, are kind of rebellious.

         Kind of?! More like A LOT REBELLIOUS!

        

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

        

         Preox controlled his voice, he had completely forgot Zjok was trying to sleep. Look, Kriket, you gotta get off the Vambit. Now. Its really awesome that Kranzir Blorton happens to be an ancestor of yours, but Im gonna have to report you if you dont deactivate that Vambit.

         Kriket pouted. Aw, come on, Ravoc. Just a little longer?

         Preox gave her a frustrated look. He was going to disapprove, until Zjok butted in. Preox, talk to her. When was the last time you even talked to a female?

         Preox, in his head, answered not for 15 years, but he didnt want to say that in front of Kriket. He looked back at Kriket and sighed out loud. It wasnt only a sigh of frustration, but a sigh of slight affection also.

Chapter 17

 

         I wont tell anyone else about this, Preox, Zjok said, raising a thumbs-up.

         Preox looked into Krikets eyes. They were dazzling in the holo-graphic light. Alright, Kriket, howre you doin?

         Zjok listened to the two of them talk and talk, keeping his focus on falling asleep. Then, these thoughts of negativity started taking over his brain, again. He wished that a beautiful, young female Asid would pay this much attention to him. In fact, he had wished he didnt have to feel so alone, all the time. He had Preox as a best friend, but he couldnt help but feel this way. He felt a little sad, now, and he was just about to drift into a deep sleep until he heard someone say his name. Zjok, wake up. Youre sooo cooool.

         Zjok lifted his head up. Preox, was that you? Preox was asleep. Two hours had already past, since Preox stopped talking to Kriket. It would be about an hour before they all had to wake up and start the first day of training the young Asids. Zjok grunted and laid back down. Not funny Preox.

         Im not Preoooxxxx, the voice came again, scaring the holy hell out of poor Zjok. He just wanted some sleep!

         Okay, Zjok responded. Then who are you? Zjok got up and checked his high-security cabinet, expecting his Vambit to be the cause of this mysterious voice. Then again, Vambits arent programmed to talk. Zjoks Vambit was completely silent.

         Nor am I your pretty thingy, the voice came again, referring to Zjoks Vambit. Come outside of this land mass and seeee meeeee.

         Oh, shut it, Zjok replied. He felt pretty silly that he was talking to himself, or at least he thought he was. Stop messing with me, Admiral Bxir. Im tired, I want sleep! Enough with the pranks!

         Im not Admiral! roared the voice, making Zjok jump. He was surprised that Preox hadnt woken up from all this. Was this all happening in Zjoks head? The voice continued, Meet me outsiiiddde.

         Zjok immediately thought of the Adoa. Could they have hacked into The AKBHEs main communications? Zjok wasnt so sure, though he went ahead and put on his full suit of armor along with his Vambit. It was time to go investigate!

 

Everything is Fine

 

            Zjok decided not to use the buildings elevator systems, for he didnt want to cause too much commotion. What if he was caught? On top of it all, what if he got caught following a voice that probably did not exist?!

         Zjok, curiosity taking over his brain, opened a nearby window in the hallway. He activated it with the swipe of his index finger and jumped out. He was free-falling over 2,000 feet in the air, which was only half of The AKBHE Buildings maximum height. Zjok activated the jet-pack installed in his Vambit and soared through the air. The weather was rather blissful, warm, and no wind was detected. The view from thousands of feet in the air was magnificent and unforgettable. It viewed masses of blue grass and its beautiful exotic trees, which was all illuminated by beauteous stars and the several moons, which rotated around planet Suzias orbit. 

         The curious Asid wasnt so sure where the mysterious voice wanted to meet him, until the voice occurred once more. Over heeerrre. This spooked Zjok a little too much. It was as though the voice was all coming from his head and yet he knew it wasnt coming from his head, at all. He made it to the surface of Suzia, stepping on the cool, freshly cut blue grass. He was surprised that he did not see any Asid guards patrolling the area. It was silent, a little too silent. Zjok didnt like this one bit. He stretched his armor-plated arm out, where a rifle unfolded itself from the armor. It was rather an interesting feat.

 


        


Chapter 17

 

            Zjok gripped his rifle tight, feeling anxious. He was now efficient when it came to combat training, but when it came to the real deal, the ordeal was slightly different. Alright, you crazy, wack-o voice, either youre making me insane or youre a crazy demon that I shall avoid.

         Over herrrrreee, the voice said. Swirling amounts of red smoke started rising out of the blue grass. Zjok pointed his rifle where the smoke was coming from. Before he knew it, the red smoke formed an over-sized figure. It did not look like an Asid, nor did it look like it was any enemy he had ever seen. It was at least twelve feet tall and it left Zjok speechless. The figure appeared harmless, yet intimidating. I am the last of the Drokensmur.

         Zjok could barely speak a word. He was the first of many Asids to see a Drokensmur, alive. For a little background information, the Drokensmur were a superior race on the planet Suzia. They roamed the planet thousands before the first Asid was born. The Drokensmur were known for using telepathic abilities and evaporating themselves to avoid threat or when travelling. The Drokensmur were a powerful and demanding race. They were never hostile, however, they were just about as peaceful as a typical dolphin.

         H-how? Zjok stammered. He lowered his rifle from pointing it at the legendary beast.

        

           

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Everything is Fine

 

            I have been traveling for centuries and centuries, the Drokensmur replied. You can tell, I no longer have flesh on my bones.

         Zjok nodded. He was a little scared. Y-yeah, I can see that. Why have you been calling me?

         The Drokensmur coughed hoarsely and Zjok took notice he was dying. The Drokensmur calmly sat on a rock nearby and began to explain. Ive been wandering around this universe, looking for someone worthy, someone worthy of carrying on the Drokensmur legacy. Without the power of the Drokensmur, our legacy will be forgotten. So, Ive been looking for a worthy, healthy, and passionate being. Someone who is able to extract my blood and create a concoction. A concoction so powerful, that it will protect any planet from any harm. Especially this planet, in particular. After countless years of searching, I found you.

         Zjok immediately thought of the enemies of the Asids and their ongoing attempts to destroy them, so they can all continue their reign of domination. Enemies especially known as the Adoa. How powerful, Drokensmur?

         The Drokensmur looked at him. Very powerful. Its so powerful, itll rock your sock off, my boy! It will help you protect not just your planet, but also yourself, the others who care for you, and other planets alike. When I found you, Zjok, you seemed lonely, depressed, and always felt like you werent a part of something.

         Zjok tried his best not to cry. Y-yeah, thats true. But why me?

         I believe youre worthy of performing this task, with the use of Drokensmur blood, the mixing of hot boiling lava, and cold ice from a comet. All of these combined will create a Serum, combining all the powers used from the mighty Drokensmur god, Misara.

         Misara? Zjok seemed puzzled. What would you want me to do with it?

         Show it to your fellow Asids. This will be a revolutionary outbreak for your weapons, for centuries to come. It will give you power and the ability for you to annihilate your enemies. Extract my blood now, Zjok.

        

 

Chapter 17

 

            You be better not be messing with me, man, Zjok said with a laugh. He was so thrilled. This new idea of total annihilation, against the Adoa and enemies alike, will keep Suzia and other planets safe.

         No, dude, the Drokensmur replied, I am so not messing with you. Now, hurry, and fulfill your destiny. Take out your water container.

            Zjok hastily took out his container from his Vambit, opened it, and emptied all the water from it. Even though he had just been rid of all the water that he had for the entire month, Zjok did not care. The Drokensmur leaned over, the sound of his bones cracking and falling apart. The beast opened his mouth and out poured beautiful, golden blood. The blood perfectly poured into the container, which was only to hold a small portion of. Once the container was full, the Drokensmur coughed up the rest of his pool of blood, collapsing into it.

         Are you okay?!

         The Drokensmur coughed. Indeed, Asid. Carry on the Drokensmur legacy, fulfill my wish, and protect your planet.

         Zjok stored his container back inside his Vambit, standing over the Drokensmur. Anything else? Anything at all?

         Remember, the Drokensmur replied weakly, if the blood is used improperly, in any way, if it is against my wishes, a great consequence will fall upon you. The blood, you now possess, is now indestructible. Only the blood can be destroyed by improper use.

         Zjok understood this completely and nodded. Yes, Drokensmur.

         Thank you, for everything. Everything is fine, now.

         The Drokensmur made one last dying breath and had passed on. His body disintegrated, along with his blood which he was laying in. Zjok was now the holder of the remaining Drokensmur blood. He felt special! Zjok activated his jet-pack and flew back to his designated area, before any Asid guards were to discover him. Zjok couldnt wait to show this to the Main Council of The AKBHE Building. This was wonderful! He fell asleep in his bed for only fifteen minutes, before the young Asids were to begin their first hours of basic military training. Zjok kept the Drokensmur blood sealed tight in his black water container, which was being kept safe in his Vambit. Zjok didnt feel like a loser, anymore, he was a savior.

Everything is Fine

 

            Many Months Later

        

         Zjok didnt say a word about the Last Drokensmurs visit. He wanted to wait before he was to be with the Main Council. He couldnt hold still because he was so excited, even Preox thought it was weird.

            Are you okay, Z? Preox asked, as they watched Asids practice their skills with the Probes. ;

         Zjok looked up and smiled at him. Im great! Hows you and?

         Preox raised an eyebrow. Oh! Kriket? Oh, yes, I uh, well, Im going to call her tonight, as a matter of fact. She may be younger, but shes exceptionally intriguing.

         I hear you on that, Zjok laughed.

         So, are you still waiting for the Main Council to get back to you? Its been weeks since you last contacted them.

         This was true. The Main Council did not take well with appointments with a single Asid. The Main Council was always extremely busy with commanding ships and preparing other decisions for warfare. It would be a while before Zjok could show off his Drokensmur blood discovery.

         Im hoping I hear from them today, Zjok replied, with a smile.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

         What is it that you wish to present to the Main Council? Preox asked.

         Zjok laughed a bit. Oh youll see! Youre gonna love it.

         If its worth waiting for that long, then Im sure I will, Preox said with a smile. They watched the young Kriket beat one of the practice Probes, without getting a single scratch. She faced Preox, waving at him. Preox

Chapter 17

 

         smirked and waved back.

         Zjok began to tease him. Awwww! Preox and Kriket, so lovely!

         Oh, shut your trap, Z. This was one of the last moments Preox saw Zjok as a best friend.

        

         The end of the first year of the Asids first year of training was drawing near. This got Preox excited because he would see Kriket more often, rather than only talking to her from Vambit-to-Vambit. Everything was going great for Preox and Zjok, indeed. One day, Zjok was sitting alone in his room, on the edge of his bed, twiddling his thumbs. He wasnt sure what else to do today. Go eat? Go on a walk? Training was over for the day and Zjok had nothing to do. Preox was in The Storage with Kriket, which seemed to give Zjok the impression that was busy. Not only that, Ravocs having special relationships with a younger Asid was highly illegal. Looks like Kriket pushed him over the borderline.

         Then, the unexpected happened, as Zjoks Vambit began to make a ringing noise. Someone was summoning him. He activated his Vambit and the holo-graphic screen appeared, showing Admiral Bxirs face. Hay, skippy! Come on down to tha Main Council. I knu you has been waitin for us tah call ya down, so hurry up!

         Its been six months, Zjok replied.

         Indeed! Now come here. Yew are dismissed.

         Zjok latched his Vambit onto his armor, with pure excitement. He properly took the elevator down to the main floor of The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building. He left the elevator and took a right, only to see a massive door, plated with crystal. The door was see-through and Zjok could see Claknibox and Admiral Bxir beside it.

         Bout time you showed up, sissy sis! Bxir shouted.

         I appreciate your attendance, Ravoc Zjok, Claknibox said with pleasure.

         Zjok smiled, he was so nervous. Thank you, Magnate.

         Now, Bxir began, puffing a cigar, lets see whatchu got, boy.

         Zjok was seated at a small table, sitting before the Main Council. There were about twenty members in total, not the two Asid guards, who stood

Everything is Fine

 

         in front of their own pedestals. It was as if Zjok was at a personal court hearing. One of the guards, standing next to Zjok, happened to Setil. The one who used to bully Zjok in his past time. Setil looked down at him, snickering. Zjok did not feel like seeing his face, nor hearing his voice. This was his moment.

         The head council member happened to be Setils brother, Ritnop, Zjoks first Team Leader. He looked much taller and his Vambit was enormous.

         Alrighty, Ritnop first said, as all council members took their designated seats. Magnate Claknibox was on one side of Ritnop, as Admiral Bxir was designated on the other. Zjok, the Main Council has called you today because you have scheduled an appointment with us exactly six months and two days ago. We do apologize for the long wait, things have been a little hectic. From what all council members understand, however, we expect you to have something intriguing to share with us all. Go ahead.

         Zjok stood up and gulped. He was almost sweating. He was facing one of three Asid Military Main Councils on the entire planet of Suzia. This was as important as meeting with the president of the United States. Uh yes, Council Ritnop, I have discovered something of extreme value. I discovered it a day before I requested this meeting to occur. I believe it will be the ultimate solution against the Adoa, as well as many other enemies alike, and protecting this planet for centuries to come.

          Zjok continued to talk about how he discovered the remaining Drokensmur, who was willing to allow Zjok to extract his blood to create a powerful concoction. The guards, standing next to him, couldnt help but laugh, especially Setil.

         Council Ritnop, Setil announced, the Drokensmur have been deceased for centuries. Theres no way, in hell, that this blithering moron couldve met one!

         Zjoks temper rose. Its true, though. Drokensmur can live for millions of years, if they constantly remain in their evaporated state.  

         That is true, Ritnop replied, with a smile. He and the rest of the council members thought that Zjok was pulling their legs. This would eventually get Zjok into trouble, but Ritnop wanted to see what was really

 

Chapter 17

 

         going on, before they were to do so. You seem so confident in your discovery, young Envoy. Would you be comfortable in showing the entire Main Council of what youve obtained?

         Zjok was shaking, as he took the container full of Drokensmur blood and gave it to Setil. Setil took a look at the container, smirked, activated his jet-pack, and flew up to Ritnops pedestal. Ritnop opened the container, expecting for this all to be a bunch of bullshit. The golden blood shined bright on his face, startling the council members. Setil looked over his shoulder with wide eyes. Ritnop showed an expression of true fear on his face. He turned to his brother and gave him the container. Get this to the vault for high-security isolation and inspection.

         Yes, Council, Setil obeyed and began to take off with the container. Zjok got very confused.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         WAIT, WHAT?! he shouted, causing everyone to look at him. W-what happened?! Whats wrong?

         Ritnop stood up behind his pedestal. The substance youve obtained is strictly prohibited to be in this vicinity. It has to be disposed of properly, before it is used as something far more dangerous.

         Zjok couldnt speak. He was too shocked, angry, and utterly upset.

Everything is Fine

 

            Look at him, Zjok heard Setil laugh, hes gonna cry!

         Zjok, your idea is absurd and threatening against this planet, Ritnop announced. I suggest you leave the premises, now.

         Zjok didnt move, as a tear rolled down his cheek. He felt like a failure, once again, and Ritnop and Setil made it absolutely worse.

         Look at him! You big cry baby! shouted Setil, who was hovering in his Vambit, holding the container. A first class Envoy Officer is crying, before the Main Council of Suzia! This Asid is nothing more than a pathetic failure!

         Thats enough, you flag-nugget! Bxir shouted at Seril.

         Zjoks eye twitched, he began to cry harder, as he grinded his teeth. He was not sad, he was deathly inflamed. All that anger, sadness, and inner deep thoughts of failure and dissatisfaction, revolved in his head like a hurricane. Zjok had been a ticking bomb and it was time for the explosion.

         Zjok, Claknibox stood up from his pedestal, also ordering Setil to shut up. Are you alright, Asid?

         Zjok looked up at him, crying and smiling at the same time. It was a disturbing sight. Sure, Magnate Claknibox! Everything is fine! Everything is just FINE AND DANDY!

         Before the other guard, next to Zjok, could escort the Asid out, Zjok punched him in the face, taking his rifle and shooting him down. It was all slow motion for Zjok, especially since he had just killed one of his kind. Setil open fire on Zjok, who was a horrible shot. Zjok shot his Vambit, causing Setil to fall fifty feet to the concrete floor. Zjok activated his jet-pack and the auto-turrets in his Vambit and unleashed a hailstorm of heavy fire-power, before the rest of the Main Council could fire upon him. Zjok was screaming at the top of his lungs, as he watched Ritnop, Claknibox, and other councils fall from their pedestals to their deaths. Zjok felt a rush of excitement coming over his mind. He was completely engulfed with pure self-satisfaction. This was his destiny. He finally ceased fire, as a loud siren began blaring, Zjok laughed devilishly. Oh, you putrid animals! He found the container, near Setil. The Asid was still alive, but barely. Zjok approached him, with a frown on his face. Oh, did Humpty Dumpty have a great fall? Setil moaned

 

Chapter 17

 

            weakly, trying to get up. Pitiful boon. You shouldve listened to me. Instead, you ridiculed me. This will cease, along with your death!

            Zjok shot Setil in the stomach, finally ending his enemys life. Zjok screamed again, crying and laughing at the same time. Oh, dearest me! Theres going to be reinforcements! Whatever shall I do?! Oh, I know! Each council members pedestal is also a special launch pod! A launch pod for me to escape this pathetic planet! Let me work on a few schematics and switches! Oh, I almost forget my blood!

         Zjok picked up his container full of Drokensmur blood and realized that nothing was happening. He had remembered that there would be dire consequences if the blood was to be used improperly. Oh, I see. The Drokensmur wanted me to realize that the Asids are the true enemy! HA! This is my destiny! Oh, this is so much fun!

         Zjok went to Clakniboxs pedestal and activated the controls for the launch pod. He sat calmly in the seat of the pedestal, as the pedestal transformed into a launch pod. It lifted up from the ground, at maximum speed, and crashing through The AKBHEs ceiling. Zjok was no longer a part of the Asid Military. He was now a most threatening nemesis. He had no idea where to go next, either, just as long he was away from Suzia. Away from his problems, away from his enemies, including Preox. If the Main Council thought my idea was dreadful, then the others might as well think so, too. Asids, you will receive your punishment. I promise you this.


Everything is Fine

 


            Many Hours Later

 

            When Preox heard the news, he couldnt believe it, until he actually saw what had happened. He and Kriket had made it to the first floor of The AKBHE Building, where many Ravocs, Guards, Envoys, Magnates, and Admirals were inside the Main Council Room. Preox and Kriket watched, in horror, as Asids carried dead Council members out of the area.

         Preox, Kriket said, it was the first time she had called him by his real name, other than just calling him Ravoc Preox. Preox didnt turn his attention to her, he was too busy paying attention to what has happened. He couldnt believe that his best friend had betrayed the Asid Military. He and Kriket watched Asids take Admiral Bxir away, who seemed to be miraculously alive.

         Oh my God, Preox said under his breath and followed the Asids carrying the Admiral away. Admiral! Its Ravoc Preox, what happened?!

         Oh, put me down, Guards! Bxir ordered. The Guards set him down.

Chapter 17

 

            We thought you were dead, Admiral, Preox said with hesitance.

         Wail, then, Bxir said, with a puff of his cigar. I is okay, Prex, simmer down, now. Anyway, from what I can remember is tha I playd dead, so I can avoid gittin killd! Zjok went absolutely ape-shit in this joint. He startd to cry a bit, then he gone kill Magnate Claknibox r-right in front of meh Admiral Bxir broke down and sat on the floor, sobbing. Kriket and Preox knelt beside him. Kriket began to cry, too. Preox showed no emotion. Zjok is absolutely evil.

         Why? Preox asked. He really couldnt think of anything else to say.

         H-he jist snapped, Bxir added. Im gonna kill that prick tha next time I see im.

         Preox thought deep inside his head, thinking about all the moments when Zjok was ridiculed, humiliated, and teased, ever since they first arrived to The AKBHE Building. Zjok was finally pushed over the edge of sanity. There was no telling in what he could do now.

         Oh, Bxir exclaimed, finally getting up weakly. That dirt bag brought somethin, an took it wit him, when he escaped in tha launch pawd. We dint believe him at first, but it was Drokensmur blood. None of the other Asids know of this, but, Drokensmur blood is tha most dangerous substance, known to tha universe.

         I know that, Preox added. Ive done much research.

         Kriket, who was still sobbing, still had the strength to tease Preox. You nerd.

         Bxir took a step forward to Preox. Yer Zjoks best friend righ? 

         Oh, Im not. He betrayed us, Bxir. Though Preox did say that, though it was painful to accept.

         We have tah git that blood out of his hands, Prex. Quick, do you still have im tracked on yer Vambit? Yew tew were both Team Leaders, righ? Check yer Vambit, hopefully he hasnt gone too far or deactivated his tracking system.  

         Preox activated his Vambit and up came a holo-graphic screen, showing a yellow dot in the middle of the screen. It was Zjok, alright.

         It looks like the launch pod had taken Zjok toOh no.

Everything is Fine

 

            Tha home of tha Adoa Bxir said.

         Its Zjok, Preox said, as his temper was rising. Other Asids surrounded them, watching Preoxs Vambit. They were all angry and full of hatred, all towards Zjok. Preox answered the call.

         Hey, Preox, ol pal! Its Zjok! Oh, I see youve got the whole family with ya! Too bad they couldnt be my family, hell, none of you were in the first place. Well, how do ya like me now, Asids?! I have what you want, come get it.

         Zjok, youre on a planet infested with Adoa Mazers and Strikers, Preox replied, what makes you think you wont be dead, within the next few seconds?

         Zjok started laughing hoarsely. As he did, Admiral Bxir took some of Preoxs data, to get the information where Zjok was calling from. This would be of great use for when they actually go to planet Fleek to steal the blood back from Zjok.

         Oh, Preox! Zjok shouted. You have no idea how much luck Ive had on this planet! Apparently, the Adoa realize how much I hate all of you and they would certainly love to help me accomplish the task I am going to do, starting with this container full of Drokensmur blood.

         Youre bluffing, Preox replied.

         Oh, no, siree! See for yourself! Come here, Galg! Galg, the Chief of the Mazers, was now on the screen, waving at the Asids. Everyone gasped in horror, as Zjok and Galg laughed their evil laughs. Can you believe that all of this happened within hours?! Damn, Im good! All that training really pulled through, didnt it?! At least I am accepted here!

         Duh, Preox replied. Admiral, you do realize that would be a suicide mission, correct?

 

Chapter 17

 

              Indeed, Bxir answered, although, we may have a new partner fer you to aide you in this mission, which will take place within months.

             A special feller, by tha name of Rig.

          Galg laughed. What is your first order of business, master Zjok?

       First, Zjok began, make me a new Vambit. Next, were going to build our own, customary Adoa Probes. They can be used as good practice targets and also very exceptional soldiers. And finally, help me obtain hot lava and ice from a comet. Were going to make good use of this Drokensmur blood. The concoction shall be called, The Misara Serum. It will be the weapon of ultimate destruction, containing powers of massive annihilation. We must protect the blood, for the concoction will take a couple years to create. We must fulfil the last wish of the Drokensmur.

       Beautiful, Galg replied. Anything else, sir?

       Does this place have vending machines?        

       Why, of course.

       Take me to them!

Another Couple Years Later

         Preox was pissed, beyond it. He had just become a Magnate, Rig had just drank a good portion of the Misara Serum, and Zjok thought it would be fun to surprise planet Suzia with a daring attack. Not only attack, but to take the Misara Serum back from Preox. Preox kept the Serum safely contained in his new Vambit. As soon as he became a Magnate, Preox went to customize a new one, whereas Rig was taken into a research facility, due to the fact that he was poised with the essence of the Serum. All during these events, the Adoa struck The Asid Kranzir Blorton Hostility Education Building, with full

 

Chapter 17

 

            and merciless force.

         Just moments after Preox slowly tortured an Adoa Mazer, by tearing his teeth out, Preox finally came up with the idea of taking the Misara Serum to planet Strom. He wasnt so sure about the plan, though he knew it would be enough time to lose the Adoa from tracking the Serum down. Preox was definitely wrong on that part.

         Alongside the fact that Preox thought that planet Strom would be a great idea, he, Oil, Kriket, and Rig were running to Bxirs ship on the surface of Suzia. Preox and Kriket turned and looked up, for the Adoa was constantly striking The AKBHE Building, with their deadly fighter ships.

          More Mazers exited the building, firing their rifles at them. Rig charged at them and killed them instantly with his deadly lightning and other super abilities.

         WOO! I love me these new powers! Rig shouted excitedly.

         Brilliant work, Rig! Preox shouted, firing his rifle at Probes which were flying by, shooting down only a couple. Come on, guys! Were almost to the ship. We got to get the Misara Serum to planet Strom, now! It should give us some time to eventually lose the Adoa from tracking us down. In the meantime, Kriket, I wanna—. PEEEEW!

         A flash of purple fire-power flashed in Preoxs eyes and the next thing he knew, he was on the ground and being picked up by Rig. Was struggling to breathe. The searing pain in his throat was extraordinary. He couldnt scream in agony, nor could he speak. He throat was ultimately shot, by lucky aim. He couldnt hear a thing, but as he was being carried by Rig, he could see Kriket crying out for him, as she was shooting down more Adoa Mazers.

         MAGNATE PREOX IS DOWN! I R-REPEAT, MAGNATE PR-PREOX IS DOWN! Oh, God, hang in there honey, please dont go anywhere, please. DIE, YOU UGLY BASTARDS!

         Preox was now safe in Bxirs ship, although he was fatally wounded. Bxirs ship took off, barely escaping the Adoas clutches. As they left, The AKBHE Building began to slowly collapse, from the thousands of feet it once stood.

 

Everything is Fine

 

            Several Days Later

 

After Preoxs throat was shot, he miraculously recovered, even though he ended up in a deep coma for about a week. He made it to planet Strom, all thanks to Bxir, but planet Strom wasnt the first thought that occurred to him when he finally awoke. He saw a nice pair of Asid female breasts, as he weakly opened his eyes. They werent bare breasts, though plenty of cleavage was revealed. This made Preox think, Am I in heaven? What is this amazing view over my face? This certainly does not feel like I am dead, however, because my blood seems to flowing well. A little TOO well.

It was Kriket, dressed in a casual nursing uniform. She happened to be leaning over Preox, as he lay in a most comforting bed, working on machines that kept Preoxs health stable. She gasped with surprise and lunged herself at Preox.

Owwwwww! Preox shouted, reacting to the pain from his body, but quickly shut his mouth. His voice. It was raspy and hoarse. It sounded terrible. He felt his throat, which was patched up very professionally. Kriket, w-what happened? W-why is my voice like this?

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


Chapter 17

 

            You were shot, Kriket immediately answered. You were shot almost a week ago, as we were escaping from the Adoa. The Adoa left the planet as soon as we could. Luckily, thanks to your idea, we lost them. Weve been stationed on Strom for a while now, though I doubt we will stay any longer. Thank God it wasnt just us that got away. Anyway, Bxir allowed me to fix you up. I trained for the medical programs, back before The AKBHE was destroyed, and I have become efficient enough to actually work on patients. On top of that, Admiral Bxir promoted me to a Common 19 years early. Awesome, right? As for your voice, sweetie, it will no longer be the same, like it was before. I did all I could, but youre going to sound raspy and hoarse for the rest of your life.

         Preox was silent. He couldnt believe all of this had happened. It was like Zjok never was his best friend. Just a stranger, an awful stranger. What about my Vambit? Is the Serum still sealed in it?

         Researchers took the Serum to do some testing on how to destroy it. They havent been able to do it. I swear, that fluid is indestructible.

         Im gonna be the one in possession of it, if the Adoa actually find us, of course.

Just above Earths Orbit

Chapter 20

 

            Uh, s-sir? the Mazer stuttered. Zjok, with a quick reflex, slapped Jorfb across the face and looked up at him, his evil eyes glaring at him. HA! he hollered, jump-scaring the Mazers, once again. Many lives will be slaughtered, today, my fair lovelies. Pew pew pew! Die, Earth, die! Kingzing City – 3:00 pm

Good afternoon, Sue, Axtman replied with a smile, after he bought his hotdog. You look beautiful, as usual.

Sue was wearing a professional black suit and a blinding smile. Oh, officer, youre always a gentleman. Are you on your lunch break? Axtman took a bite of his hotdog and nodded, with a smile, with stuffed cheeks similar to a squirrels. Well, officer Axtman, you mind if I joined you?

This one is on me, Axtman replied and ordered another hotdog for Sue. She smiled happily and it was obvious that the two really, really liked each other. They might as well get married!

Confused, yet concerned, Officer Axtman and Sue looked up at the sky, seeing mysterious objects descend from the gloomy clouds. They were hurdling rapidly towards the city, which seemed threatening to many citizens. What are those things?! Sue exclaimed.

A massive flock of geese? Axtman suggested. The officer was dead wrong, once the objects in the sky seemed bigger, the closer they got to the city. Citizens looked up in the sky, in absolute awe. That all went away, quickly, when a scorching, green beam erected from one of the objects. The beam struck Eds hotdog stand, disintegrating it immediately. Bro! Not my hotdogs!

Citizens screamed and ran in horror, as more green beams of light struck buildings, cars, and even people, destroying anything it touched. Axtman took Sues hand and they began to book it through the onslaught of a vicious, unexpected nightmare. This is Officer Axtman, if you can hear what

Chapter 20

 

is happening through my walkie-talkie, which means were in deep doo-doo! I, we, need backup now! Kingzing City is under attack! I repeat, Kingzing City is under attack!

THINGS! SEND IN BACKUP! LOTS OF IT! MORE BACKUP THAN YOUR MOTHER!

A beam of light struck the ground, near Axtman and Sues feet, sending the couple flying. They landed harshly on the ground, as the city turned into a war zone.

Meanwhile

 

Jake was laughing his ass off! He just loved watching Kyle perform on stage, wielding a sword and getting in sword-fights, as a part of the plays choreography. Along with Jake, the rest of audience was roaring with laughter, as Kyle and another actor dueled with real swords. Of course the crappy choreography was intentional for comedy, however the swords that the two actors were using looked extremely realistic and dangerous. It was impressive and fun to watch.

Kyles character, Inigo Montoya, scoffed, Wouldnt you like to know? At least your loved one isnt dead, like my father. He was killed by a six-fingered man! Andrew swung his sword upward on Kyles, causing him to drop it on the ground. He pointed his sword at Kyle, who put his hands up to show his surrender.

Your father was killed by a six-fingered man?

Kyle nodded, as he pressed against a fake rock. Yes, when I was a boy. You see the scars on my cheeks? That was him. Someday, I will find the six-fingered man and you know what I will say to him?

Its going to be one hell of a ride.

Hollys House (10 Minutes before the Adoa Onslaught)

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 


         Holly Ransfield was always a terrific guitarist! Ever since she was the age of three, she would strum away on some good tuning with any form of guitar. Aside from that, knowing Holly Ransfield (the hottest chick, ever), many people would think that Holly would surround herself by a lot of loud music, especially when she would perform with The Nasty Pen. Those many people are absolutely correct and they would also think that Holly would have some sort of hearing issue, due to her constant visitation with all of this loud sound. Many people are wrong on that part; Holly can hear just fine.

         However, Holly is about to experience something so deafening, yet terrifying, her questionable ability to hear will slowly rise to its peak. This

 

Chapter 21

 

         will happen in about two minutes, which will be exactly eight minutes before the Adoa bombards Kingzing City.  During these two minutes of wonderful silence, Holly was getting ready for her band rehearsal which she was almost late for. Anyone who knew Holly, would find it highly misunderstandable to know that the sexy vixen would appear anywhere, along the lines of late. It was the thought of Jake that clogged her mind from doing what really had to be done. It wasnt her fault, however, it was that jerk-face Jake Matthew Smithy for putting a spell on her. She really didnt mind it, either. Their moments together, during their dates, made Holly realize that she and Jake were finally on good terms. Really good terms. The fact that Holly had strong feelings for Jake was very difficult to process, through her head. So thankfully, Evil Nacho was about to change all that, as being one major distraction.

         Holly, who had finally finished about an hours worth of makeup and hair-curling, had walked out of her bathroom, casually shutting the door. Charlie, her cat, perched on the arm of her couch, making a nervous meowing sound. Oh, Charlie, what is it, now? I just got you tuna, so why arent you satisfied with your life, now? The poor cat hissed at her, scampering away. Holly laughed and shook her head. Dont worry, Charlie, Momma still loves you. Holly was just about ready to head out the door, until a deafening explosion was head from the inside of her bathroom. The explosion, almost blowing the bathroom door right from its hinges, made Holly collapse and frantically run to her kitchen, to her pantry. She reached inside the pantry, pulling out a fully-loaded 12-guage shotgun. She took it off safety, pumped a shotgun shell, and stood in the kitchen pointing the gun at the bathroom door. She knew that explosion was no accident.

         Holly didnt seem the slightest bit frightened, at all, as she kept her focus on the door. Orange smoke, from the sudden explosion, seeped through the gaps of the door and Charlie was meowing frantically. Hollys blood began to rush through her body, keeping her index finger over the hair trigger of her shotgun. After several seconds of silence, the door began to slowly open, with an eerie creak. The orange smoke made its way through the entire interior of the house, causing Holly to cover her nose and mouth with her shirt to avoid excessive lung damage.

Unexpected Alliance
